loans.name: Rann

texts.en: Mrs. Rann K. is a 49-year-old widow and she now lives in Chrork Rom Deng village in Kampong Cham province. She sells beds in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Rann K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more wood to make more beds for her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: to buy more wood to make more beds for her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Lucy K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child, who is 33 years old. Lucy has been running a milling machine business since 2007. Milling machines are used to grind up grains (maize) to get flour. She does this both for her customers and for herself. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Lucy currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more maize. In the future, she plans to buy another milling machine. Lucy thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing maize

loans.name: Asaa Khery Group

texts.en:
Zanabia owns a small charcoal store where she also sells clothes in the Milinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She has worked at her business every day from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. for 3 years, currently earning an average monthly profit of $50. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and her business will grow.  

Zanabia is 45 years old, married, and has three children, ages 22, 18 and 10. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Afua, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Samandar

texts.ru: Бадалов Самандар проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 28 лет, женат , но детей пока нет. Кроме его жены с ним живут его родители. Семья большая , поэтому для того, чтобы обеспечить семью всем необходимым , ему приходится много работать. В данный момент он работает частным таксистом. Обратился за кредитом для того, чтобы произвезти ремонт автомашины. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Samandar B. lives in the Gissar region. He is 28 years old, married, but does not have any children yet. His parents also live with him besides his wife. The family is big and this is why he needs to work a lot to be able to provide his family with necessities. At this time he works as a taxi driver. He is asking for a loan to make repairs on his car. He can pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
“Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction”, says Evangeline.

Evangeline is 47 years old and happily married to Dante. Their marriage is blessed with three children: Mars - 23 years old, an Overseas Filipino Worker in Saudi Arabia; Glen - 21 years old, a laborer, and their youngest is Dante Jr. - 19 years old, works as an encoder in the market.

Evangeline has managed a hog-raising business for almost three years now. She is glad that she can generate an average of PHP 9,000 every four months. With her wish to expand her piggery, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. Aside from hog raising, her husband also operates a tricycle transport from which they get some of the financial support for the maintenance of their hogs. The loan she would like to borrow would be of help not only for her business needs but also for her family.

loans.use: To expand her piggery

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
EVA MERCEDES P. Y., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las innovadoras II” vive en el Jr Toronto MZ.6, tiene 37 años de edad, 3 hijos, y su pareja es albañil.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para abastecer su negocio.

Hoy en día, ella ha sabido progresar con su familia y el negocio de la bodega ha mejorado, tanto que le permite costear los gastos del colegio y así sus hijos pueden estudiar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará 1 caja de leche, 2 paquetes de gaseosas, y caja de atún, etc. 

“Mi negocio lo tengo gracias a  Manuela Ramos que me otorgó el préstamo sin mucho trámite ni dificultades y estoy segura que podré hacer crecer más mi negocio para que mis hijos sean profesionales”.
texts.en:
Eva Mercedes P. Y. belongs to the Communal Bank “Las innovadoras II”, lives in Jr Toronto MZ.6, is 37 years old with 3 children, and her husband is a bricklayer. She started her business selling groceries, and with a loan of 300 Nuevos Soles she purchased provisions with which to supply her business. Nowadays, she’s been able to move up with her family and her business has improved, so much so that it has enabled her to afford school expenses, allowing her children to study. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles she will purchase 1 box of milk, 2 packages of soda, cans of tuna, etc. “I own my business thanks to Manuela Ramos, who approved my loan without much paperwork or difficulties, and I’m sure that I’ll be able to make my business grow so that my children can grow up to be professionals”.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of various products such as milk, soda, tuna, etc

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86599&_tpos=16&_tpg=2
Rosa  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas. se quedo sin trabajo, y  por necesidad tuvo que dedicarse a cocinar, empezó  llevando  menús a diferentes empresas, hasta que le empezaron a pedir que hiciera buffet para eventos especiales, actualmente solo se dedica a hacer buffet.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de víveres para su buffet, según le pida. 
Desde que Rosa esta en Finca aprendió a esforzarse en el trabajo, a ser puntual con sus pagos y ser responsable  en el negocio.
El sueño de Rosa es poner un restaurante y tener una flota de taxi.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of “Las Orquideas” community bank. She was unemployed and, out of necessity, begin to work as a cook. She started by taking menus to different businesses until they began to ask her to provide buffets for special events. Now she works solely with buffets.

Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to purchase the buffet supplies that her clients request.

Since Rosa has been with Finca she has learned to work hard, be on time with her payments and be responsible in her business practices.

Rosa’s dream is to open a restaurant and own a fleet of taxis.

Rosa's first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86599&_tpos=16&_tpg=2

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of buffet supplies that clients request.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores
Luzmila es casada tiene 32 años, dos hijos de 11 y 2 años, el mayor esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Luzmila  es de Puno llego a trabajar a Lima  hace 9 años, se puso a vender zapatillas en gamarra como ambulante, ahora  se puso a confeccionar buzos y vende a las tiendas en gamarra.  
Desde que Luzmila esta en Finca aprendió como llevar su negocio gracias a las charlas que recibe.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la confección de buzos 
El sueño de Luzmila es alquilar una tienda en gamarra.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank. Luzmila is married, is 32 years old and has two children who are 11 and 2 year of age. The eldest is studying at public school. Luzmila is from Puno. She came to work in Lima nine years ago. She started selling sneakers on foot in Gamarra (area of Lima). Now she has started making sweatshirts which she sells to the stores in Gamarra. Since joining FINCA, Luzmila has learned how to manage her business, thanks to the advice she receives. Luzmila needs a loan of 3,000 soles in order to make sweatshirts. Luzmila's dream is to rent a shop in Gamarra.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luzmila needs a loan of 3,000 soles in order to make sweatshirts.

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en:
Banzragch S. is a single father who has one daughter. In 1993, together with his wife he started a retail business buying and selling raw materials related to livestock. He also buys wool, fur, cashmere and the leather from local herders at wholesale prices and resell them at a retail prices.

His spouse got sick and died a half a year ago. Since then, his business income has decreased. Banzragch is trying his best to move on and keep running his business at the local market. Banzragch is a well respected person as he has a loyal, hard working and humble personality. With this loan he plans to buy wool, cashmere and animal leather.

loans.use: Buy wool, cashmere, fur, leader etc.

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito I. is from the village of Paypayan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 52 years old. Pablito is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Pablito owns and operates a charcoal-selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling charcoal to the local community members. Pablito has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pablito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablito is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional  materials. This will be the first loan taken out by Pablito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Barangay Del Carmen in Iligan City. She is 49 years old. Evangeline is separated from her spouse and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business providing beauty services and reflexology to local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In July 2009, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Evangeline's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Lelia

texts.es:
La señora Lelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil casada, con 4 hijos, ella estudio educación segundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Chanu Chanu.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que lo utilizo en su negocio de preparación de chicharrón.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, y lo invertirá en su actual negocio de venta de chicharrón, y va a comprar carne de chancho, papas, chuño, etc  para venderlo en el mercado, su esposo a veces le ayuda cuando esta sin trabajo ya que es constructor.

Su deseo es continuar construyendo su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de carne de chancho, papas, chuño, etc

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Pacheco Velasquez Group

texts.es: Luz Marina P. y Blanca Estela R. ambas conforman el es Grupo Solidario P. Velásquez. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Luz Marina se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas. En cambio Blanca se dedica a la venta de frijoles hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio inicio con esfuerzos propios, ya que tenía que ayudar a sus 4 hijos para proporcionarle la oportunidad de estudio. A pesar de ser personas muy humildes y que siempre les ha gustado el trabajo duro y proporcionarles a sus familias las condiciones necesarias. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para cada uno de sus productos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda has been selling vegetables and cooked food snacks in her village for many years. She sells her own harvested vegetables by going house-to-house. Sometimes, she also buys additional vegetables from the market to sell to have a bigger income. Most of the time, her income is being used to support the needs of her family. Rosalinda would like to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She would be very thankful if she could borrow 4,000 PHP. She hopes that her request will be approved because her business is the only source of income that can help her family cope with their poor living situation.

Rosalinda is 45 years old. She is a very patient businesswoman in their village in the district Saranay of Barangay Flores Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to a farmer, Ricardo M., who is 48 years old. They have four children: three are already grown up and finished their studies up to secondary school only. Their youngest is just four years old and not yet in school.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Touch Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom T. is the leader of a four member group in Pou Khvet village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake maker. Her husband, Mr. Heng Soeun, is a farmer and cultivates rice on a piece of land he owns. The couple also acts as a rice middle-man. Since their business is doing well, they want to expand it by purchasing more rice to re-sell to earn more income. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest is too young to work or study. Mr. Heng Soeun came to request the loan, so he is presented in the picture instead of Mrs. Sokhom T.. 

Only one member in this group has an end-of-term loan, while the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, as they allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice to re-sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 25-year-old married woman with four children aged between three and nine years; all of her children are currently in school. Agnes resides and owns a four-room house which she shares with seven people. Agnes cares for additional family members in addition to her children. The family has access to electricity but not piped water. Agnes owns a bar selling all types of drinks, and she commutes from Mengo Kisenyi to her bar in Lugala Masanafu. On average she receives around 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for three years working with the same groupmates. Agnes uses public transport to and from shopping. Her challenges include defaulters and ever-increasing prices of liquor. Agnes wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin and crates of beer. She is aspiring to see her business grow stronger and start a beer deport.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel O. repairs electronic appliances at a shop in Elmina near Abvis. Samuel has junior high education. Samuel has been repairing electrical appliances since 2006. He is responsible for paying utility bills and rent for his apartment. His loan will be used to buy spare parts, tools and copper wire for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy spare parts, tools and copper wire for sale.

loans.name: Tarija Group

texts.es: Las Socias del grupo “Tarija” están representadas por el señor Víctor Hugo y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales 9 son mujeres y 3 los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como a la soldadura con arco y oxigeno y los otros son empleados con sueldos por comisión, entre las señoras se dedican a la venta cosméticos, comida, pan, frutas y masitas. La competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero saben el trabajo en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The members of the Tarija Group are led by Sr. Victor Hugo. The group consists of 12 members, nine of whom are women. The three men are engaged in different activities. One is an arc welder and the others are employees who get paid on commission. The women have retail businesses selling cosmetics, food, bread, fruit and pastries. The competition in their various lines of work is high, but the members know how to succeed in their respective businesses.

This loan will be used to grow their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to improve their earnings. As a result, they will be able to give their families a better quality of life. With regard to their credit experience, the members are starting their first loan cycle together. They know how to work as part of a solidarity group because they have had previous loans at other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
La  Señora María de Lourdes  de 33 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Tres Marías perteneciente  al Municipio de Chalco, En el Estado de México;  ella es casada  y tiene 5 hijos, todos ellos están en edad escolar, por lo que inicio una actividad de artículos  papelería y elaboración de manualidades (figuras de fomi, fieltro y demás) hace mas de 3 años,  ella inicia con esta actividad  debido a que su esposo trabaja en la central de abasto (alimentos) como cargador  y los ingresos que obtiene no le es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de la familia; por lo que ella para no descuidar la educación y cuidado de sus hijos, la cual es prioridad y anhela ver que sus hijos tengan estudios, ella requiere de mas capital e invertir en su negocio, generando mayor ganancia y así poder comprar una computadora que le ayudara a imprimir sus propios diseños para sus manualidades; por esta razón se une con otros conocidos para solicitar un crédito a través de Fundación Realidad A.C. que tambien tienen búscan una mejor calidad de vida.
Ma Trinidad J.  B.      Elaboración de casos.
Virginia M. Gutiérrez         Venta de Catalogó. 
Fabiola B. J.           Venta de Catalogó.
Ma Guadalupe Z. S.      Venta de Catalogó.
María José M. P.         Abarrotes.
Edith R. R.              Jarcería.
Irma G. T.               Botanas.
Gloria H. C.  	 Dulces.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Lourdes is 33 years old and lives in the Tres Marías community in the municipality of Chalco, in Mexico state. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are school-aged. This is why she began working with paper products and making crafts (shapes made of foam, felt, and other materials). She began more than three years ago, since her husband works in a food warehouse as a loader and his income is not enough to cover the family's needs. She chose this line of work to avoid neglecting the education and care of her children--which is her main priority, and she desires to see her children studying. She needs more capital to invest in her business, in order to generate higher earnings and be able to buy a computer to help her print her own designs for her crafts. For this reason she is getting together with other people she knows to ask for a loan through Fundación Realidad A.C. as they are looking for a better quality of life.

María Trinidad J. B.-Crafts Virginia M. Gutiérrez-Catalog Sales Fabiola B. J.-Catalog Sales María Guadalupe Z. S.-Catalog Sales María José M. P.-Groceries Edith R. R.-Housewares Irma G. T.-Snacks Gloria H. C.-Sweets

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer for designing crafts

loans.name: Ochuko

texts.en: Ochuko E. is 31 years old, married with 2 children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Ochuko works long hours selling soft drinks at retail prices to her customers to make a living  She has been in this business for a long time.She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Ochuko hopes for loan to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: María José

texts.es: La joven María José T. M. de 25 años tiene un bar-restaurante el cual tiene un estilo campestre muy agradable. Ella en este año nuevo desea hacer algunas reformas al local para proporcionar a sus clientes un mejor servicio  y está segura que con su esfuerzo, dedicación y trabajo se hará realidad.
texts.en:
The young Maria Jose T. M. is 25 years old and has a restaurant and bar, which has a very pleasant, country style. In the new year, she wishes to make some alterations to the business, in order to provide her clients with better service. She is sure that with her effort, dedication, and hard work, this will be achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase premium materials, such as liquor, basic grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is single. For the past four years, she has been selling various types of insurance. Her client base has been growing, bringing Irina a stable income. She would now like to borrow 12,000 UAH to improve her business. She would like to make repairs and improvements to her office, and hopes this will attract even more new clients.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to her office

loans.name: Romano

texts.en:
Romano M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcoholic beverages. She is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use and to make more alcohol to sell.  Romano is 34 years old and is divorced.   She has four children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more materials to use and to make more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Dominga Yamilet

texts.es:
La señora Yamilet B. tiene la edad de 34 años, es casada y comerciante, se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos Avon desde hace 7 años, el negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo y con el objetivo de tener otros ingresos y darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus 3 hijos los cuales están en edad escolar.
La señora trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 4 años y hasta la fecha se le han otorgado 17 créditos y nos expresa que han sido de gran ayuda, ya que esto le permite invertir en su negocio y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes cuando le hacen los pedidos.
texts.en:
Yamilet B., 34, is married and has been an Avon products merchant for the past 7 years. She started her business with help from her husband; her aim was to earn extra income so that their three, school-aged children could have a better standard of living. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for 4 years and has had 17 loans to date. She tells us that they have been of great use to her making it possible for her to invest in her business and meet her customers' needs when they place their orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men’s cologne, women’s perfume, lipsticks, eye shadow, vanities, shampoo, face and body creams, children’s cologne, lip-gloss.

loans.name: Luis Ricardo

texts.es:
Luis es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Chochope del distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado desde muy joven al transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi. Cuando empezó a trabajar en este rubro solía alquilar algún vehículo de este tipo para ganarse el sustento, pero luego empezó a ahorrar y hace cuatro años pudo adquirir su propio vehículo. Actualmente se vale de el para cubrir rutas dentro de su caserío y con las zonas aledañas.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad movil y el estado accidentado de las carreteras de la zona han hecho que su mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ello Luis se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Luis es una persona honrada y muy trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es bridarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior.
texts.en:
Luis is 31 years old and a father. He lives with his wife and children in the Chochope neighborhood, in the Motupe district. This is an agricultural zone within the province of Lambayeque, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has been transporting freight and passengers via “mototaxi” since he was very young. When he began working in this field, he used have to rent his vehicle, but he later began saving his money and was able to buy his own vehicle four years ago. He now uses it to work within his neighborhood and within the neighboring zones. He has continued to use his vehicle, but the conditions of the roads in the zone have caused some damage to his mototaxi, which is in urgent need of repair. Because of this, Luis has seen fit to request this first loan of 2000 PEN ($725) through Edpyme Alternativa. This will allow him to meet his objective. Luis is an honest, hard working man. His greatest desire is to give his children the opportunity to study and have a better career.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs to his mototaxi

loans.name: Juan Aurelio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Aurelio tiene la edad de 49 años, es casado, tiene 2 hijas que están una en secundaria y la otra en escuela primaria, trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chichigalpa desde hace un año y se desempeña como gestor de proyectos, además él obtiene otros ingresos, ya que le trabaja al Ingenio san Antonio como contratista desde hace 2 años.
Don Aurelio ha obtenido 2 créditos con Ceprodel y los ha utilizado para mejoras de su vivienda ya que le quiere dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 49 years old. He is married and has two daughters, one attends junior high school and one attends elementary school. He works as a project manager for the Chichigalpa city hall. He also receives additional income from his work as a contractor. He’s been doing this work for the past two years. Juan has had two previous loans through CEPRODEL which he has used to make improvements to his home and give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
Vasyl is a contractor who offers complete renovation and reconstruction services in his region. He is a businessman from Mukachevo, Western Ukraine. Vasyl is married with two sons. He has an employed team of different workers who can handle various exterior and interior repair issues. He has been in business for 5 years. The high quality of his services has been the main factor that has impacted rapid development of his business. Presently, Vasyl has about 10,000 grivnyas worth of inventory. His gross income amounts to 7,000 grivnyas a month.

Vasyl is requesting a loan of 10,000 grivnyas to purchase materials and equipment to do remodeling in some facilities in his region. He is hoping to take on several renovation projects thus ensuring consistent pay for his employees. Vasyl is a hard worker. He is a demanding employer but this helps him keep a good and solid standing among other competitors working in the same sphere of business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Narcisa Del Pilar

texts.es:
Narcisa M. de 40 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (lugar muy humilde, con calles de tierra y casa de caña) de Guayaquil. Solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja dando mantenimiento a las maquinas de una empresa, ellos tienen dos hijos de 6 y 4 años. 

Narcisa empezó vendiendo meriendas en la puerta de su casa a todas las personas que pasaban caminando, pero debido a los malos ingresos que tenia decidió retirarse y empezar otra actividad. Por esa mala decisión tuvo que iniciar un nuevo negocio con poca inversión e inicio la venta de artesanías.     

La venta de artesanías le rindió buenas ganancias y ahora es su principal actividad, trabaja todos los fines de semana sola. Ella hace muñecos de maneras, muñecos de trapos, cadenas etc. Con el préstamo quiere construir mejor su casa y comprar cemento, bloques y piedras para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y poder darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Narcisa M. is 40 years old and lives in the periurban district of Fortín in Guayaquil. This modest place has dirt roads and houses made of reeds. Narcisa receives electricity as her only basic service. Her husband works for a company by maintaining its machinery. They have two children, ages 6 and 5.

Narcisa began selling afternoon snacks from the doorstep of her house to people who pass through the area. Due to her low earnings, she decided to quit and start another business. With little investment, she began selling crafts.

Making and selling handicrafts generates good revenue, so it is now her main business activity. She works alone every weekend. She produces handmade dolls, rag dolls, chains, and other items. With this loan, she wants to improve her home and buy cement, blocks, and stone for her business.

In the future, she wants to build a better house and provide her children with a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, blocks, and stone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta A. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old. Violeta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been involved in her business for more than 20 years already.

In 2009, Violeta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Violeta from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. In 2003, he started working in wall coating and in 2007 he started working in the same field, but on his own. He is now requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase a scaffold to use for the coating of buildings.

loans.use: to purchase a scaffold

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe B. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Fe is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like 'puto' (a variety of rice cake), hotcakes, and 'siopao' (steamed bun with a variety of fillings) in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny N. (pictured above), 39, and her husband, Mr. Sithy Chham, 40, have been married since 1989 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two of them are garment factory workers, one attends school, and other two are still young. Besides her children, she also has her niece, who is a tailor, living with her. They live in a small village along national road number four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vanny has been operating a business renting a space in her house for three years. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for sixteen years. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Dan's Group

texts.en:
Dan T. N. was born in 1974. She lives in Luong Quy village with her husband and two sons. She not only grows rice but also sells clothes in the market. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 VND. This is the first time she has participated in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND in order to invest in her clothing shop. She is the leader of a 6-member loan group from SEDA.
 
About other borrowers in her group:
Nu T. D. was born in 1955. She has a store, and would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND in order to expand it.
Huyen T. T. N. was born in 1971. She is a tailor, and would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND in order to buy cloth.
Bon T. N. was born in 1951. She is raising 9 pigs, and would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND in order to buy food for them.
Giang T. N. was born in 1984. She has a daughter. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND in order to repair her house.
Tham T. N. was born in 1955. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND in order to breed poultry.

loans.use: To invest in her clothing shop.

loans.name: Akylbek

texts.en:
Akylbek  B. is 41-year-old ambitious  entrepreneur who lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has four daughters; the youngest one is three years old. Akylbek has a very united family, where all members help and support each other.

In 1995, in order to find a way to earn a living to support his family, Akylbek decided to begin his business. Experience showed that he was most successful in the trade sector. He engaged in garment-reselling with a starting capital of 8,000 KGS. Due to Akylbek’s strong efforts and tireless endeavor, he managed to enlarge his assortment of goods with various high-quality products.  In 2008, Akylbek took a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to set up a second sales point at the local market for selling children's and adults’ shoes. 

Unfortunately, Akylbek lost his business, which was burned to ashes during violent clashes, caused by deposed political regime which broke out in the city of Osh in June 2010.   But Akylbek, being a very optimistic and hard-working person, didn’t give up and is doing his best to rise from the ruins.  

Akylbek is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS to resume his lost business and continue his activities. It will allow him further development of his household and business. Akylbek believes that mutual understanding and friendship always lead to prosperity and well-being. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius O. is a 59-year-old gentleman who is married to Gladys O. and together they have three children ages 14, 10 and 7 years. He buys bread which he later sells retail to shops and schools within his locality at a profit. He is able to make a profit of Kshs 7,500 and this has been his business for the past four years.

Julius has applied for his first loan with KADET and he plans to use this loan to buy more bread for resale. He believed his hard work will pay off and he will be able to open his own bakery and also be able to steadily support an orphanage.

loans.use: To buy more bread for resale

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley A. is from the village of Tinago in Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old and married. She has two adult children. Shirley sells dried fish. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Shirley joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She had successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to buy more dried fish to sell. This will be Shirley’s fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Antônio M. nasceu na cidade da M., Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, pai de 4 filhos dos quais 3 vão a escola. Fez 10ª classe pretende continuar no futuro. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de M. para o bairro da Machava quando constituiu sua família. Trabalha como docente e funcionário permanente do Ministério de Educação, tem um salario de 4.392.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria (Millenium Bim).

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, barrotes, pedra, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir sua casa.
texts.en:
Antônio M. was born in M., Maputo, in Southern Mozambique. He is the father of four children, three of whom are in school. His studies were interrupted when he was in 10th Grade, but he hopes to go back to school one day. He lives with his family and two nephews in a house they own.

He moved to the neighborhood of Machava when he started his family. Employed by the Ministry of Education, Antônio currently works as a teacher, earning a monthly salary of 4.392.00mt. His salary allows him to pay for all the household expenses as well as put some money into a savings account at Millenium Bim Bank.

He learned about Hkuvuku from a co-worker, and this is his first loan. He plans to use the 10.000.00mt to buy construction material (cement, iron, beams, stones, sand, etc) to continue building his house.

He's confident in his ability to pay back this loan and plans to apply for others in the future, to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, iron, beams, stones, sand, etc)

loans.name: Oah

texts.en:
Oah B., 50, a widowed farmer who lives with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, typically makes US$1 every day and is aided by her daughters who work in a garment factory.

The Kampong Cham area has not seen favorable weather conditions for farming this past year. Along with increased inflation, it has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. As a consequence of these conditions, Oah has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan of US$500 to purchase rice and sell it for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell for a profit

loans.name: Dolores Ernestina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Para la señora Dolores este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le gustan más que todo las charlas sobre salud ya de estas aprende mucho. Tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 10 años, los mismos que están en la escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Vende productos para el hogar (planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, camas, etc.) además de ropa y zapatos de todo tipo. Su forma de venta es por cartilla o por catalogo, enseña la revista donde están todos estos artículos y sus clientes deciden que es lo que quieren, luego ella al completar el cupo limite realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos de acuerdo al número que tengan sus clientes y cobra los productos dados todas las semanas o cada quince como prefieran sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos ya que tiene dos pedidos para realizar y necesita el capital ya que el que tenia esta invertido. Su  sueño es tener su propia distribuidora de estos productos.
texts.en:
In El Progreso neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo, the 'Ilusiones' community bank meets every fortnight.  It is a marginal urban area which is very densely populated and known as the 'jail district' since the women's jail of Portoviejo is found there.

This is Dolores' third loan cycle with her community bank.  What she most likes about her community bank are the health talks since she learns a lot from them.  Dolores is 26 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have two children, aged 10 and 11, who are in school.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Dolores sells household products such as irons, blenders, fans, bed linen, etc.  She also sells all kinds of clothes and shoes.  She sells her products through a catalog.  She shows the catalog to her customers and they choose which products they want.  She then completes her quota, makes her orders, delivers the products to her customers and collects payment for the products every week or every fortnight as her customers prefer.

This loan will be used to buy more products since she has two orders to make and she needs capital because the capital she has is invested in the business.  Her dream is to have her own distribution company for these products.

loans.use: To buy irons, blenders, fans, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has been an ASHI member since 2001. Her family is very glad that she has an opportunity to improve their quality of living through the income of the farming business she has established with the support of the loans she has requested from ASHI. 

Her husband’s support of her farming business is Christine’s inspiration to continue going through the challenges of poverty while growing her business despite that. The farming business has brought pleasure to her family. Because of its profits, she has been able to support the family. Being a good mother, she always wanted to support her children in whatever career they would be taking to better their own personal life. 

Aside from her farming business financed by the loan she received from ASHI, she also sells  different small goods, which is her way of saving her profits to support the needs of her family, especially in the education of her children. With that, Christine is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds “palay”, and support her second venture. This would make their business grow and make more profit, which will enable her to reach her ambition in life.

Her long-term goals are for her three children to complete college and find better employment in the future. Education is their priority. This is the only wealth she can leave to her children that others can’t steal. The couple’s looking forward to that soon changing their lives, which are currently in poverty.  Aside from aiming to get out of poverty, they are also dreaming of the best in life that lives together and happily forever. 

Christine is glad to be a Kiva borrower and grateful for Kiva offering loans to support her business efforts.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, rice seeds "palay", and support her second venture

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es: Gissela, de 33 años, comparte su vida con Edu, de 35 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que crían y educan en unión familiar en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Hace 11 años que se dedica a la compra y venta de papa, en un puesto que alquiló en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Todos los días desde las primeras horas comercializa un promedio de 40 sacos diarios como mínimo, los cuales vende a 45 nuevos soles cada uno. El trabajo que realiza es muy sacrificado y a la vez gratificante, pues lo que más le gusta a Gissela es negociar la venta de las diferentes variedades y clases de papa, y al terminar el día se siente agotada por el trajín diario. Ahora ella quiere ampliar su negocio con la compra de un camión para poder trasladar los sacos de papa; de los terrenos agrícolas a la ciudad con mayor rapidez. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y se siente dichosa de pertenecer a un banco comunal, donde le enseñan a ahorrar y pensar en el futuro. Es por ello que el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 300 sacos de papa, que comercializará.
texts.en: Gissela is a 33-year-old woman whose life partner is 35-year-old Edu. They have 4 children together, and they raise and educate them in a rented house located in the city of Tarma. She has been buying and selling potatoes for the last 11 years in a stand that she rents at the wholesale market in her city. Every day from the early morning, she sells an average of 40 sacks of potatoes at 45 PEN each. Her job is both arduous and gratifying. What Gissela likes most is negotiating deals on the different varieties of potatoes that she sells. At the end of the day, she feels exhausted from her hectic day. She now wishes to expand her business by purchasing a truck to be able to transport her sacks of potatoes from the crop fields to the city even faster. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she feels proud of being a part of a communal bank in which she learns how to save money and plan for the future. For this reason, she will invest this loan in purchasing 300 sacks of potatoes, which she will sell.

loans.use: Purchase 300 sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Maira Quintina

texts.es:
la señora Maira Quintina A. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la colonia Nuevos Colorados y se dedica a la venta de frutas, Maira es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo, es muy honrada y responsable, su esposo la apoya y juntos salen adelante. su esposo vende frutas pero las reparte en su carro en diferentes lugares cercanos a su comunidad.
juntos trabajan mucho para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas pero mas necesita comprar cajas de uvas, manzanas y peras que son las frutas que mas se venden para la temporada navideña, su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maira is 31 years old and lives in the colony of Nuevos Colorados, Honduras. She makes a living selling fruits. Maira is a woman who is very dedicated to her work and is very honest and responsible. Her husband supports her and together they keep making headway. Her husband also sells fruits, but he distributes them in his car to different areas nearby in the community. They work together a lot to be able to make progress for their children. She plans to use the loan to purchase the fruits, but she also needs to purchase boxes of grapes, apples and pears, which are the fruits she sells the most during Christmastime. Her goal is to keep growing her business and thus having a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase apples, grapes, pears, pineapple, bananas, mandarins and oranges

loans.name: Ryad

texts.en: Ryad is a 53 year-old married man, living and working in Baalbeck, Ryad. He has owned a clothing shop since 1997 and is requesting a loan from A. majmoua for the first time, in order to buy new collections. Ryad’s work is improving day after day and all his clients recommend dealing with him. In this Holy season Ryad was generous with his clients and offered speciA. prices and offers that attracted many new ones who couldn’t refuse such offers. Ryad hopes to stay successful and meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy new collections of clothing

loans.name: Ofelia Piedad

texts.es:
Ofelia Piedad C. M. tiene 52 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre con el compañero y con los hijos en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los Ríos, Tiene un hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Ofelia Piedad se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es surgir y salir adelante.

Le gusta la cocina.
texts.en:
Ofelia Piedad C. M. is 52 years old.  She lives with her partner and child  in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The '26 de Noviembre' community bank is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The members of the community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Ofelia Piedad has been growing corn and rice for 5 years.  She buys her products in Agripac and sells her products in Ventanas market.  She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her corn and rice crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  All the members of her community bank face challenges such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.

Ofelia Piedad's dream is to get ahead in life.  She enjoys cooking.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina B. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 56 years old. Martina is a widow and has twp adult-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs to sell. She is just starting this business.

In 2011, Martina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Kuñatai Group

texts.en:
The women's committee called "Kuñatai" was formed on June 21st, 2010.  With a lot of effort they are now in their 2nd loan cycle.  Besides their independent work, the group also has joint activities which they engage in to reach the ultimate goal of helping their individual families.

One of the most touching stories is that of Ms. Maria V. who owns a small general store.  She says that her business helped her family's economy and living conditions.  She is the only supporter of her household and she also has to provide an education to her kids so she says that there was a big change in her family's economy thanks to her business.

According to Ms. Maria, the activities carried out with the help of the Foundation are very important.  Thanks to those activities, all the members of the committee have been able to develop their work skills and self-esteem.

loans.use: buying goods for subsequent selling

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna P. (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver. Her husband, Mr. Buntit Roath, is a farmer. They have been married since 1993 and have one daughter. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Vanna is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena G. is from the village of San Juan, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old and is married with five adult children. Rowena makes a living from running her own sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The shop's main source of income comes from buying and selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, convenience foods and biscuits, in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010 Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages and biscuits to sell. This loan will be the second taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve and expand the business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages & biscuits to sell

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is currently in a business of selling soft drinks. She is 27 years old, married to a policeman, with 3 children and 2 of them go to school. Lona borrowed a loan to stock soft drinks to sell. She hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is married and has three children, none of whom is in school. She also takes care of her mother. Mary lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She has a retail pharmacy. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days a week.

Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her drug shop, food and taxes. The main business challenges for Mary include thieves, defaulters and the rainy season.

Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of pharmaceuticals and syringes. Her goal for her business is to own a fully-stocked pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of drugs and syringes

loans.name: Beautiful Skies Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CIELITO LINDO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Yaneth. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: revistas, venta de cortinas, venta de comidas, venta de salchipapas, repostería, venta de rellenos.

La señora Yaneth,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por recomendación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de salchipapas que viene realizando hace una año atrás, negocio que aprendió por intermedio de una amistad.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de incremento de capital (para la venta de salchipapas) y la compra de una cabina telefónica. Los insumos para la elaboración de las salchipapas las adquiere de la calle Rodríguez y los venderá en Sensata de martes a domingo en horas de 16:00 a 23:00, con la ayuda de sus papas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hijo, pues ella es soltera.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Beautiful Skies" is on their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner), as part of Centro Focal de Santiago II. The group is made up of 8 members and it is lead by a board of directors and the group president Yaneth. The members of the communal bank have various business types, including: magazines, curtain sales, prepared food sales, salchipapas (a traditional fast food consisting of sausages and french fries), dessert sales, and stuffing sales.

Yaneth says that it is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer and she joined following a recommendation by a friend. She currently has a business selling salchipapas, a business she started last year. She learned the business from a friend.

The loan will be used to increase her working capital (for her salchipapas business) and to purchase a telephone booth. She acquires the ingredients she needs to make salchipapas at Rodriguez Street and she sells them at Sensata from Tuesday to Sunday, from 4pm to 11pm, with the help of her parents. This business generates an income to support her son in as much as she can. She is single. 

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the orientation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make salchipapas and to purchase a telephone booth.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support two children. She is widowed and has a business making and selling lechon (roast pig) in the Philippines.  Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years, and earns additional income by raising livestock.

Cecilia has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase pigs and supplies for her business.  In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, wood, and charcoal for her lechon business.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. Saad has run a shop selling toys, phones and CDs since 2008. He has three years experience in this field, a good reputation, and he is being  well known in his area.
He is requesting a $1,500 loan to purchase additional machines for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase additional machines for his shop.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira tiene 43 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arros . Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta descansar en la casa.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira, 43, is married and lives with her husband and their two children in Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

This group is known as Narcisa de Jesus and is located in the region of San Temistocles, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. The group members are farmers who grow short-cycle crops like corn and rice.

Rosa is a farmer, especially of corn and rice. She makes her purchases monthly in Ventanas and also goes to the markets there to sell her crop.s

She asks for a loan to buy more seeds, fertilizers and compost. The support from the loan will help her to meet her economic needs and to face challenges like pests, crop sickness and variations in climate. 

Her dream is to buy her own land. She likes to rest at home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Kpenoukpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPENOUKPO est composé de trois personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier au Bénin et mènent certaines activités ensemble. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Annick Vicencia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Annick Vicencia est née le 22 Janvier 1972 dans une ville du Bénin. Annick Vicencia  ne vit plus avec son mari. Annick Vicencia a quatre enfants, dont deux sont à sa charge. Parmi ses enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Annick Vicencia vit seule avec ses deux enfants dans une ville du Bénin. Pour subvenir à ses besoins tout en assurant les charges de ses enfants, Annick Vicencia mène comme activité depuis vingt cinq ans, la vente de condiments de sauce et d'épices. Annick Vicencia achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Annick Vicencia sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe  KPENOUKPO, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Kpenoukpo Group is composed of three people living in the same neighborhood in Benin and having some joint business activities. It is the third time that the group applies for financial assistance from the microfinance institution Alidé to boost its activity level.

The representative of the group, Annick Vicencia, who is raising her hand in the photo, was born in a city in Benin on January 22, 1972. Annick Vicencia does not live any longer with her husband. She is the mother of four children, of whom two are supported by her. Some of the children attend school. Annick Vicencia lives alone with her two children in a city in Benin.

To provide for her own needs and those of her children, Annick Vicencia has sold sauce condiments and spices for the past 25 years. She buys her supplies in Benin. Eager to satisfy their customers and increase their income, Annick Vicencia and her fellow members of Kpenoukpo Group apply for a new loan.

loans.use: to buy food condiments and spices.

loans.name: Daveiva Amparo

texts.es:
Daveiva de 46 años es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive en el municipio de Soledad con sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 a 19 años; allí se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y productos de limpieza para el hogar. Como esencias, fragancias, productos veterinarios, ácidos, venenos y desinfectantes.  Daveiva  empezó su negocio en el años 1995,  por iniciativa e su esposo ya fallecido, quien decidió proporcionarle un medio de sustento a su familia antes de morir, de manera que pudieran defenderse y eso fue su legado antes de morir en el año 2007. Su negocio ha sido posible, gracias a  los esfuerzos realizados conjuntamente con  su cuñada y su hijo mayor y se siente muy satisfecha porque su disciplina y trabajo han permitido responder a las necesidades básicas de su familia.  Su meta más adelante es ampliarlo y tener mas puntos comerciales, pero su capital de trabajo aun no es suficiente para este propósito. Este es justamente el motivo por el cual ha recurrido a su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará esencias, desinfectantes, productos veterinarios en mayor volumen, con tal de ganar descuentos por la compra de contado y en una cuantía que entusiasme a sus proveedores para hacerle una oferta tentadora.  
Su mayor desafío y sueño, es lograr que sus hijos tengan una educación de calidad para que en un futuro, logren ser exitosos en todo lo que emprendan.  Mientras Daveiva trabaja por cumplir sus sueños, se esmera día a dio por lograr fortalecer su negocio, en el cual ocurre un repunte en las ventas en cada quincena y una disminución de ellas en épocas de lluvia, lo cual se convierte también  en su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Daveiva, 46, is a hardworking woman who lives in Soledad with her three children who are from 11-19 years of age.  She sells natural products and cleaning items for the home such as perfumes, essence,  veterinary products, acids, poisons and disinfectants.  Daveiva began her business on her own in 1995 prompted by her husband so that she would be able to support her family if he died , and this business was his legacy when he passed away in 2007.  Her business has been possible thanks to the efforts she has made along with her sister-in-law and her oldest son, and she feels very happy because her discipline and work have allowed her to cover her family’s basic expenses.  

Her goal for the future is to expand her business and to have more sales options, but her working capital isn’t enough for this end.  So this is exactly the motivation she has to request a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use the money to buy  essences, disinfectants  and a large number of veterinary products so that she can receive volume discounts and purchase with cash in a quantity that will appeal to her suppliers to make her attractive offers.

Her greatest dream and challenge is for her children to have a quality education so that their futures will be successful in all they try to achieve.  While Daveiva works to fulfill these dreams, she strives every day to strengthen her business: her sales rise every payday and fall in the rainy season, which has also become a big challenge.

loans.use: To buy essences, disinfectants, and veterinary products in large volume

loans.name: 64 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tinh operates a farming food stall. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for vegetables and trees.

Tinh is 53 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.
Tinh is the group leader of the 64 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

This is Tinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Tinh has been involved in this business for 8 years.
The main hardships Tinh faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Tinh hopes to buy land of her own, to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for vegetables and trees

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 59 years old, married, and lives with seven family members, two of whom work. 

Murad has owned a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, sweets, cheese, and other dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2200 loan in order to buy two showcases and a generator for his market. He aims to make more money to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy two showcases and a generator for his market.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a thirty one year old married man with two children and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail shop business for three years. He started his business with 500,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardship is lack of enough capital to supply the customers. His vision is buying a motorcycle, finishing his house and educating his children. Vicent intends to use the loan to buy flasks, omo (soap) and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy flasks, omo and sodas.

loans.name: Rafikhon

texts.ru: Рафихон проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 20 лет. Он не женат. Имеет среднее образование. Три года как занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку на центральном рынке города, где продает фрукты. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Rafikhon lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 20 years and single.  He has a secondary education.  He has been involved in sales for three years.  Rafikhon leases a retail outlet at the city's central market, where he sells fruits.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 29-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon living with her only child who is still attending school. She has 10 years of experience working as a female hairdresser. In 2008, this woman was able to open her own female beauty salon. She works so hard to gain good income to be able to support her only child and pay the heavy life expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase hairdressing tools and additional beauty products. In the future, she is planning to further expand her business level.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools and beauty products

loans.name: Sorayda Clareth

texts.es: Sorayda Clareth tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva. Desde hace más de 6 años que tiene esta actividad económica. El esfuerzo que realiza todos los días por conseguir nuevos clientes, han hecho que su duro trabajo de resultado. El negocio lo aprendió por su Mama que anteriormente ella se hacía cargo del negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo Sorayda decide empezar su propio negocio. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, cremas, tratamientos, pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios entre otros.
texts.en:
Sorayda Clareth is 31 years old. Her business involves selling cosmetics and new clothing. She has been in this business for more than six years. The effort she puts forth every day goes toward attracting new customers, which she has been able to do as a result of her hard work. Sorayda learned this trade from her mother since she previously worked at her business. Over time, Sorayda decided to start her own business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy lip pencils, powders, crèmes, treatments, nail polishes, lipsticks, and other items.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, powders, crèmes, treatments, nail polishes, lipsticks, and other items.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Delia works hard to support her family. She has a business selling beverages and purified drinking water in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from a general store. Delia has been sustaining her business activities through nine previous loans from NWTF.

Delia is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of beverages and purified drinking water to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is married with three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Mitimos, Rizal.
To earn a living, Florenda works in a charcoal business. She has had this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3500. She has requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase 5 sacks of charcoal. Florenda has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Irene Del Rosario

texts.es:
Irene de 19 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, no tiene familia todavía, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesana.

Irene desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (cuenta con 14 ovejas) y caprino (cuenta con 20 cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y realizar ampliación de su corral, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Irene es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es tener  mejoras económicas para tener otras comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
