Irene, 19, lives with her husband in her own house; she does not have children yet.  The house does not have basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District which belongs to Piura Department.  The zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

Irene has been raising sheep and goats to sell (she has 14 sheep and 20 goats) for the last three years.  Her corral is located in her back yard.  It’s appropriate and she feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses so that the animals will reach optimum growth so that she can sell them in the different local markets obtaining good profits to cover her daily household expenses.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed and to enlarge the corral.  With income obtained from the sales she’ll be able to repay the loan and improve her quality of life.  Irene is a hardworking, very responsible person who only wants to improve economically to have a few comforts at home.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and enlarge her corrals.

loans.name: Donald Francisco

texts.es: Donald Francisco es un joven de 60 años, responsable, trabajador y dedicado a su negocio, que es recolectar chatarra este negocio lo inicio desde hace 10 años, inicio porque no tenía un trabajo estable y necesitaba mantener a su familia como padre responsable siempre le ha gustado hacerse cargo de su las necesidades que su familia atraviesa. Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar hierro, aluminio, níquel, acero, entre otros. así podrá trabajar y compartir con su familia mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Donald Francisco is a young man 60 years of age, responsible, hardworking and dedicated to his business, which is scrap metal collection. He started this business ten years ago because he didn't have a stable job and needed to support his family. As a responsible father he has always liked to take care of the needs his family experiences. 

Currently he needs a loan to purchase iron, aluminum, nickel and steel, among other things. Thus he will be able to work and share with his family, improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase iron, aluminum, nickel and steel.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 35 year old  and married with five children between the ages of 16-3 years old. All of her children are in the school. She has had a business selling food at a stall in Buluk, South Sudan for six years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions for her food stall. she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and blessed with a three -year-old child. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. For the last five years, she has been running a tailoring business to support her family. She also does farming to increase her income.

In the next five years, she wants to buy another sewing machine.  

Since Christine joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business.  She is requesting for loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Благодаря кредиту КИВА, который Валентина получила в прошлом году и вложила в улучшение условий в своих теплицах, она смогла содержать теплицы и увеличить свой доход за год с 70 000 гривен до 85 000 гривен. 
Следующей сезон будет для Валентины непростым, так как тепличный бизнес снова требует новых вложений: Валентине нужно достроить одну теплицу и переделать еще одну. Более того Валентина хочет закупить качественные семена, уголь и подкупить пленку. 
Благодаря полученной от прошлого сезона прибыли, Валентина и ее семья смогли позволить себе сделать дома небольшой ремонт, вставить новые окна, приобрести подержанный автомобиль ВАЗ 2106.
7 лет назад от Валентины ушел муж, все это время она справлялась сама. Сейчас вырос и женился сын, поэтому работают в теплицах теперь уже вместе с сыном и невесткой.
texts.en:
Thanks to the loan from Kiva that Valentina received last year and which she used to improve the conditions of her greenhouses, Valentine was able to maintain her greenhouses and increase her yearly income from 70,000 to 85,000 Grivnyas.
The next season will not be an easy one for Valentina, as her greenhouse business calls for new investments again: Valentina needs to finish building one greenhouse and to alter another one.  Valentina would also like to buy good-quality seeds, coal, and additional quantities of protective film.
Thanks to the profits made last season, Valentina and her family have been able to afford small home repairs, install new windows, and buy a used car, a VAZ-2106 (Lada). Valentina's husband left her seven years ago, and she has coped by herself since then.   Her son is now grown-up and married, and Valentina, her son and daughter-in-law all work together on the greenhouses.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, protective film, and coal.

loans.name: Tilekmat

texts.ru: Тилекмат  - 38 летний фермер, женат, воспитывает четырех сыновей и одну дочь, все школьники. Тилекмат на протяжении 18 лет занимается полеводством, ежегодно обрабатывая 1,8 га земли, где выращивает картофель и кукурузу и собранный  в сезон урожай реализует в г.Бишкек (столица). Внесезонным средством дохода для семьи Тилекмата является животноводство, начатое с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, его хозяйство, начитывающее 2 коровы, 7 телят, 40 овец, 1 лошадь, приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Тилекмат обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку телят и овец.  Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в реконструкцию сарая для скота.
texts.en: Tilekmat is a 38 year old farmer, he is married and has four sons and one daughter, they are all students. Tilekmat has been involved in arable farming for over eighteen years processing 1.8 hectares of land annually where he grows potatoes and corn and then sells the gathered season's harvest in Bishkek (the capital). Animal husbandry is the off-season source of income for Tilekmat's family which began with the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). At this time his farm accounts for two cows, seven calves, 40 sheep, one horse and brings about 8,000 som per month. In order to further increase the number of livestock Tilekmat has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves and sheep. He plans to invest the income from the loan in the reconstruction of the barn for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Bình's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình operates a food stall/restaurant selling snack. She is requesting a loan to purchase eel to make eel soup  to sell. Bình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bình faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Bình is 57 years old and she is married with 4 children. Bình is the group leader of the 05.04.45Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Bình lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bình has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase eel to make eel soup  to sell

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, a 36-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two sons. Her husband earns an income working as a truck driver. Ngoc runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods and many kinds of vegetables to people in the local community. She started this business ten years ago. 

Ngoc requires a loan to purchase a range of different products, including basic packaged foods and many kinds of vegetables, to meet her customers' demand. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase a range of different general store products to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 41 years old, married to Rose and blessed with two children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the last three years and it has been profitable.

Jared will use the loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle so that it can be in good condition. Thus he will be able to serve more customers as well as make more income to support his family by paying school fees for his children.

His future hopes and dreams are to buy more motorcycles and even have a transport company in the area.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and service his motorcycle so that it can be in good condition

loans.name: Jozel Mae

texts.en:
Jozel Mae is 26 years old and single with one child. Jozel Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Jozel Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo and other snack foods.

Jozel Mae has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Jozel Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo and other snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy more soft drinks and cook varieties of food

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is in the beginning phases of starting her micro-enterprise. She learned the basics of how to make sandals some time ago, but due to the lack of capital she has not been able to establish the activity as a stable source of income. About a month ago, she decided to attend the sandal-making courses offered at our offices in order to improve her skills and possibly progress toward a loan.

She makes the sandals in a small part of her home, but she is hoping that a loan will help her set up a workshop where she can be more productive. She also hopes she can invest in materials such as leather straps, soles, glue and other items necessary for the process.

Maritza is a mother of two children. Her daughter is 17 and often helps her in the sandal-making process. Her son is 15 and is still attending high school. The father of her children passed away about 11 years ago. Maritza has been able to support her family with jobs as a domestic worker, but she was not satisfied with the wages and the time she had to spend away from her children. She is now in a new relationship with someone who is very supportive of her idea to start a new business. She is very optimistic about the future thanks to the loan and the sandal-making opportunity.

loans.use: Invest in the materials necessary to make sandals and also build a workshop for production

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Ms. K. was born on April 4, 1958 and had 5 children, but 4 of them have passed away. She takes care of the 4 orphans of her eldest brother.

Ms. K. has been in rice agriculture for 4 years and currently owns a small plot of land with palm trees (she uses the nuts to make red oil and other products.) She doesn’t own her own plot of land for rice agriculture, so even though she does all of the work for 5 plots of rice, she is paid very low wages for sprouting the plants, planting them in the plots, weeding them and taking care of them for 4 months, and then harvesting them. Since she has almost no profit from all of her work, Ms. K. wants to buy land with other members of her solidarity group to divide amongst them.

Ms. K.'s group will purchase about 5-10 hectares so that each woman will have ½ a hectare to herself. She is a very responsible woman who has been trusted to take care of the local church, including all of its funds, and can therefore be trusted with a loan. She also supports her son while he is in medical school and she is hoping to one day be able to help him start his own practice.

Having only completed elementary school, Ms. K. finds it very difficult to make enough money to care for her family. She lives in her father’s house with her children and cannot afford to properly feed them. Two of the children are in school, 2 are apprentices, and one left his apprenticeship and is currently unemployed. Some days she eats only a very small amount of beans to last her through the whole day of hard labor and she buys corn on credit in order to help feed the children in her home.

Ms. K. cannot afford to pay for a doctor’s visit or for the medicine from a pharmacy, so she is forced to buy unregulated medicine sold on the streets when someone is ill. She cannot even afford to purchase boots in order to work in the water-drenched rice fields filled with worms that bite at her legs, so she simply wraps her feet in cloth.

Ms. K. is a very trustworthy woman and this loan will help her to be able to make a more decent living and to better care for her family’s needs.

loans.use: Ms. Kouvon is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase some land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is 43, married to Esteban C.. Hermelinda make all types of typical Paraguayan clothes, bed covers, and hammocks. They are parents of three children of ages 14, 9, and 6. Having started their business 10 years ago, the couple works very hard every day to complete as many products as possible. During this winter, they are selling about 70 per week. However, during the summertime they sell more than 150 per week, since they make clothes that differ from the ones they make in the winter.

The couple works at home and travels to other cities, but mostly to Asuncion that is a two hour bus ride away, to sell their products. On average their clothes sell for about US$10 each. They are seeking a loan to buy more thread, fabric, and dye from Asuncion. They need to buy more dye because they take the neutral color fabric that they purchase and dye it into different colors in order to make a variety of women's clothing. In particular, many clients prefer the dyed fabric and the wide selection of colors for their clothing.

loans.use: Purchase thread, fabric, and dye.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Trần Thị Thủy, 38 years old, lives in Quảng Đức with her husband. They have 2 children, 1 boy and 1 girl who are currently in school. Married sine 1996, their main occupation is rice wine brewing. Their rice wine is of high quality so it gets sold very quickly. Each week, they make 5 batches, each batch is made with 10 kg of rice. Their daily revenue is about 5 USD. Their family financial has been solidified ever since they joined the fund program. Apart from making rice wine, the couple also works for others in their free time to earn more money. Ms Thủy is requesting a loan of 450 USD to buy more rice to augment their rice wine production.

Translater from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Trần Thị Thủy, 38 tuổi, hiện đang sinh sống tại xã Quảng Đức, có hai người con 1 trai 1gái đang trong độ tuổi ăn học. Cưới nhau từ năm 1996, nghề nghiệp chính của hai vợ chồng chị Thủy là nấu rượu. Rượu của gia đình đảm bảo chất lượng nên nấu được bao nhiêu tiêu thụ hết bấy nhiêu. Mỗi tuần chị nấu 5 nồi rượu, mỗi nồi 10kg gạo. Thu nhập mỗi ngày của chị là 5 USD. Kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên đáng kể từ ngày chị tham gia Quỹ. Ngoài việc nấu rượu tranh thủ lúc nhàn rỗi anh Cấn chồng chị còn đi làm thuê để có thêm thu nhập. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 450 USD để mua lúa nhằm tăng thêm lượng rượu nấu ra hàng ngày.

loans.use: buy rice to brew rice wine

loans.name: Fredah

texts.en:
Fredah B. and her husband own the St. James Memorial Medical Center and Nursing Home. Her husband is the doctor at the clinic and they live on the premises with their 3 children and two orphans. They have been offering medical services at the clinic for 6 years. Malaria patients are  the largest part of their care followed by counseling to HIV/AID’s patients. The clinic provides 24 services which also include general practice, overnight nursing care and lab work.

With their loan they plan to buy a hemo-meter to do in-house blood work. This will help them to determine patients with diabetes and other blood related health concerns. In villages, these private centers are critical for without them there would be no health care. Since it is private pay, this is truly a labor of love for the doctor and his wife. She is also involved in many community leadership positions.

loans.use: Fredah and her husband plan to use their loan to buy a hemo-meter to do in house blood work at their clinic.

loans.name: Mimin

texts.en: Mimin is 44 years old and is the mother of a child aged 12. She sells housewares and can earn about US$ 5 per day. Her husband, R., sells vegetables at the market and usually earns about US$ 3 per day. Mimin needs a loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her  little business selling housewares

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 48 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) since 1995. She used her initial loan of 20USD to raise pigs. Like a lot of other families in the cluster, her family has no other job but raising pigs and farming. This is why Mrs. H.'s family still has a lot of difficulties. The quality of life increases significantly when she pioneered to change from the original method of farming to the VAC method (VAC stands for farming/gardening, fishing, and breeding animals). The first days were not easy, but Mrs. H. is still patient and firmly believe on her chosen project. With diligence and patience, after all those years, she now has 1 acre of land to use the VAC method, and this project continues to reward her a steady income. This loan cycle, Mrs. H. would like to borrow 650USD to buy foodstuff and fertilizer. She wants to continue to be a TYM Fund member and borrow money to increase her family income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiệp, 48 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1995. Vốn vay ban đầu là 20USD chị đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Cũng như bao gia đình khác trong cụm, ngoài chăn nuôi, làm ruộng, gia đình không có nghề phụ gì nên cuộc sống gia đình gặp nhiều khó khăn, vất vả. Cuộc sống có bước thay đổi khi gia đình chị đi tiên phong trong việc dồn điền đổi thửa, chuyển đổi sang mô hình VAC. Công việc trong những ngày đầu không dễ dàng nhưng chị Hiệp vẫn kiên trì đầu tư vào dự án mà mình đã chọn. Với đức tính cần cù, chịu khó, qua nhiều năm đến nay gia đình chị đã đạt thành quả là một cơ ngơi khang trang với hơn 1 mẫu VAC khá quy mô và đang cho thu nhập thường xuyên, ổn định. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 650USD để mua thức ăn gia súc, phân bón. Mong muốn của chị là tiếp tục được vay những mức vốn lớn hơn của Quỹ để đầu tư phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

loans.use: Buy foodstuff, fertilizer

loans.name: Juana's Group

texts.en:
Juana, ClotilD., and Fernandina are members of the community bank “Imasumac”. Juana and Fernandina have belonged for ten years, while ClotilD. joined two years ago. In that time they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and to save. In addition they are now friends with the other associates in their bank.

Juana is 60 years old. She is married and has seven children. One of her daughters has been living in Miami for the last seven years. Juana buys vegetables in the countrysiD. and sells them in Ayacucho. She also has a business washing laundry.

ClotilD. is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and three year old son. ClotilD. is a trained nurse but cannot find work in that field. Currently ClotilD. runs a business typing forms and doing computer design. She has been running this business for the past three years.

Fernandina is 43 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 24 and 11. Fernandina sells vegetables. She buys vegetables in bulk in the city of Ayacucho and then sells them around the region. She has been doing this since she was fifteen years old.

Juana, ClotilD., and Fernandina need loans of 450, 1500, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy vegetables such as squash, carrots, and onions. ClotilD. will buy a new printer.

One of the most important things about the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Juana, ClotilD., and Fernandina plan to use their savings to open a stO. in their house, get a passport to travel to Brasil and work as a nurse, and to put a roof on their home. Their dreams are to build a house for their daughter so she will come back from Miami, own a nice home, and to have a big stO. in their home.

loans.use: Juana, Clotilde, and Fernandina need loans of 450, 1500, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy vegetables such as squash, carrots, and onions.  Clotilde will buy a new printer

loans.name: Kiwalazi East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joyce N.. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Joyce is 28 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 3 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Joyce makes approximately UGX 6000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Joyce is joined in her small group by Rose N., Edodo G., Scovia N., and Annet B.. Rose N. has a business selling matooke and wants to increase her sales. Edodo G. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to increase her inventory. Scovia N. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more stock. Annet B. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to uplift business.

loans.use: To add capital to tomato business and boost it

loans.name: Benita's Group

texts.es:
Benita, Marcelina y Celestina have belonged to the Yanapanakusun Banco Comunal, which means "let's help ourselves" in quechua, for 10, 1 and 12 years respectively.

Benita is separated, is 41 years old and has 4 children. She sells food in a rented stall on the puente nuevo. Benita also has a small grocery store in her house that is run by her daughter.

Marcelina lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 3 children. She sells candy, cakes and chicha (corn whiskey) while walking along the Avenida Javier Pérez.

Celestina is married, is 57 years old and has 6 children. Celestina and her husband have a carpentry shop in their house.

Benita, Marcelina y Celestina need loans of 600, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soap, detergent, oil, cookies, soft drinks and wood.

Benita, Marcelina and Celestina's dreams are to improve their businesses, for their children to become working professionals, and to have stable business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Benita, Marcelina y Celestina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa “Ayudémonos” en quechua, hace 10, 1, 12 años respectivamente.

Benita es separada, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Benita venD. comida en un local alquilado en el puente nuevo. Además Benita tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa que esta administrado por su hija.

Por otro lado Marcelina es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina venD. golosinas, pasteles y chicha D. manera ambulatoria en la Av. Javier Pérez.

Mientras que Celestina es casada, tiene 57 años y 6 hijos, Celestina junto a su esposo tienen un taller D. carpintería en su casa.

Benita, Marcelina y Celestina necesitan un préstamo D. 600 soles, 450 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, jabón, detergente, aceite, galletas, gaseosas y maderas.

Los sueños D. Benita, Marcelina y Celestina son mejorar sus negocios, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un negocio estable.

loans.use: Benita, Marcelina y Celestina need loans of 600, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soap, detergent, oil, cookies, soft drinks and wood.

loans.name: Sok Sam Group

texts.en: Mrs. S. S., a farmer, is the leader of this group.  She is 49 and married with two children, both of whom are enrolled in state school.  In December 2007, one of the children got typhoid which cost $100 to cure. Her husband, Mr. Salim L., is a farmer who also generates an income from palm trees. Now living in a small house in Chrok Kov village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Mrs. S. S. and her family are having difficulty during the rainy season because of a bad roof. She is therefore seeking a loan to build a new house in the village. Previously, she obtained $250 from Acleda Bank to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to cultivate on her rice field.

loans.use: To build a new house to improve living conditions.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa O. runs her own auto repair shop out of her home in the Sandino City neighborhood in Managua, where she tends to her customers in a large room with stabilization space for the vehicles. Since she started her business more than eight years ago, Josefa has had the support of her husband, who works as the mechanic. By means of this business they are able to support their two children, a girl and a young man, and provide them necessities. It's for this reason Josefa is looking for support from Kiva partner Ceprodel. With the loan she will purchase much-needed tools.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino, la señora Josefa O. posee su propio taller de reparación de vehículos en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes en un terreno amplio con espacio para estacionarse.

Desde que inició su negocio hace mas de ocho años, ha tenido el apoyo de su esposo el cual se dedica a la labor de la mecánica. Por medio de este negocio ella apoya a sus dos hijas (una niña y una joven) supliendo sus necesidades. Por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar herramientas de trabajo que le son de mucha necesidad.

loans.use: Purchase much-needed tools / Compra de herramientas

loans.name: Soben

texts.en:
Mrs. Soben S. lives in Kveth in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chheun Kong, are rice farmers. Aside from this business activity, Mrs. Soben S. is a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business has improved, Mrs. Soben S. wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Soben S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to raise.

Mrs. Soben S. is 48 and the mother of six children, one of whom is working in Naga Club, a famous gambling place in Phnom Penh. A second child migrated to work in Thailand while another one assists his parents in the rice fields. The remaining three are attending the local school.

Previously, Mrs. Soben S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Ema's Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Ema is 32 years old. She is married and she has four children aged 20, 17, 15 and 11. She also takes care of 3 other people aged 28, 18 and 16 years old. She became a fruit and vegetables seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 7.30 AM to 5 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Ema now hopes for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with maize sales, shopkeeping, tailoring and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo R., 23, sells ice to various businesses and restaurants in Kampong Chhnang where she lives with her husband, Chhay Li Houn, and her parents. In Cambodia, many businesses purchase ice each day for their customers, because they do not have refrigerators. Chhay Li Houn sells ice along with his wife and together they typically make $10 per day. They do not have any children and they are still living with Keo R.'s parents, because they are a very young couple. Keo R. has asked for a loan of $1200 to purchase a piece of farmland to grow rice for additional income for her family. She can rent the land out to other farmers and this will allow her to diversify her sources of income and improve her family's quality of life. Keo R. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Chhay Li Houn, is pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase farmland to rent out to farmers

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Мукарамджонова Ханифа жительница района Вахдат. Возраст 50 лет,замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее.Ханифа более 25 лет занимается животноводством. Она обеспечивает молоком и кисло-молочной продукцией свою большую семью,а лишнее продает своим соседям.В данный момент возрос спрос на ее продукцию .Клиентка решила купить дойную корову.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 15 месяцев
texts.en:
Hanifa M. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 50 years old, is married and has 6 children. Hanifa has a high school education. She has been raising livestock for over 25 years. Hanifa provides milk and dairy products for her large family and sells extras to her neighbors. At the moment there is an increase in demand for her products. Hanifa has decided to buy a dairy cow. She plans to pay back her loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Judumishe Group

texts.en:
Rehema has been selling chapati and maandazi in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. Chapati is a flat pancake fried in oil and cooked over coals. It is eaten for breakfast, lunch, or as a snack and can be eaten plain or rolled with fruits or vegetables inside. Maandazi are a small, donut-like square of fried semi-sweet dough. Both chapati and maandazi are common foods in Tanzania.

Rehema earns a profit of approximately $80 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more vegetable oil and flour for the foods that she prepares. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profits to get more food for her family and improve her home.

Rehema is 21 years old, married, and has no children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Fatma, who has her own small business selling clothes in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable oil, flour, and other ingredients for the foods she prepares.

loans.name: Mrs. Phan Chheun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of eighteen members, is located in Kruos village in Takeo Province.  The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phan C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a 33-year-old mother of four children who attend the local school.  Mrs. Phan C. is a mat weaver. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Thoeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. He faces a small problem because his field is insufficiently fertile to support his crop. Thus, they decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. These loans do not require any principal repayment until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. The loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: El Manzano Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario EL MANZANO  viven en el Km. 21 carretera Masaya Managua,  sus negocios están ubicados en su casa de habitación y de ahí parten a vender de manera ambulantes en los mercados de Managua y Masaya 
Son de procedencia humilde, sus casa son modestas y bien ordenadas, son vecinos y por tal motivo se unieron para formar un grupo y ser sujetos de créditos , los productos los compran por mayor en el mercado oriental, Doña Lilliam  inició su negocio de venta de ropa con la ayuda de su hermana mayor la que la llevaba desde pequeña a los mercados cuando contrajo nupcias su esposo le ayudo con un capital menor para iniciar su negocio, en la actualidad con la ayuda de adim ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo,
 Junto con el crédito ADIM al g/s lo han capacitados  lo que les ha servido para superar sus temores e inseguridades y a sentirse capaz de enfrentar la vida. 
Todo el g/s  en un futuro cuenta con ampliar su  negocio Para alcanzar su sueño se propone continuar cumpliendo con sus cuotas y tratar de ahorrar  de sus ganancias para ir mejorando su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the El Manzano lending group live off of km. 21 of the Masaya-Managua auto route. They are neighbors who have united to form a group eligible for credit. They are of humble origins but while their homes may be modest, they are clean and well kept. Their businesses are based in their homes, where they make everything they sell as vendors at the markets of Managua and Masaya. Thanks to the loans they have received from ADIM, El Manzano's members have been able to overcome their feelings of insecurity and financial uncertainty and finally feel able to take control of their lives. Doña Lilliam, for example, has been working in the markets since she was a child, selling clothes with her older sister. When Lilliam married, her husband gave her a little money so that she could start her own clothing business, but it is only currently, with the help of ADIM, that she truly has access to working capital. With these loans, each member of the group hopes to see their business grow. Additionally, they would like to invest in improving their houses, but this is a long term goal. In order to achieve their dreams, they will continue to make punctual payments on their loans and save what they can from their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital, business expansion

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mr. L., 29, raises pigs and chickens for sale in his village of Sanday in Siem Reap Province. He has been working with his wife since 2005 and earns around $2 per day. The young couple care for one child and work hard every day to generate as much revenue as possible to support the family's living and save money for their children to attend school in the future.

Mr. L. is a good communication person in his village, which has contributed to the success of his business. Because of growing his business, he needs to have a pig food making machine. Hence, he would like to request a loan to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To purchase pig food making machine

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna B. est célibataire mais a à sa charge 4 enfants. Elle souhaite poursuivre et fructifier son activité de restauration. Elle vend le repas du petit déjeuner au marché où elle tient un étal. Elle contribue à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Maïmouna B. is unmarried but supports four children. She would like to continue her restaurant business and yield a profit. She sells breakfast meals at the marketplace, where she has a stall. She helps to improve her small family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell breakfast at her eatery at the marketplace

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Mr. Vun N., 54, and his wife, Mrs. Kim-at Lun, 34, were married in 2004 and have no children yet. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Vun has been a mason for fifteen years. His wife stays at home. Their main income is from his construction business, but he does not have enough materials to run his business.  He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase more construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Adijatu

texts.en: Adijatu is 37 years old and married with four children. She resides in Lagos State with her family. She sells tailoring materials like zips, thread, etc. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Kosal Penh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of fourteen members, is located in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Kosal P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fishwife.

Her husband, Mr. Khut Louch, is a fisherman who is saving the money to support his family. Although he tries to work hard he still earns less income to support his family living because he has few fishnets and others tools for his fishing. Thus, Mrs. Kosal P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and others tools for her husband’s fishing.

She is 40 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Mrs. Reth C. does not come to take a loan but her husband does, so he is presented in the picture instead her.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets and others tools for her husband’s fishing.

loans.name: Fiatagata

texts.en: Fiatagata N., 32, is married with 4 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the Fishing business. She sells to the village people and the public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (approximately 140 USD).  SPBD loans are Fiatagata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a new fishing canoe, swimming shoes, spear and a cooler to store the fish

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Lares Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD D. LARES”, son naturales del distrito D. Lares en la provincia D. Calca, del departamento D. Cusco. Ubicado a 4 horas y 30 segundos.

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades agrícolas como es la siembra D. papa, maíz, trigo, cebada y las labores domésticas en el caso D. las mujeres con la venta D. comida en la plaza central del pueblo, los días sábados y domingos, los varones llevan sus productos como granos secos a vender a otros distritos dentro D. la ciudad del Cusco y a la misma ciudad del Cusco, los socios requieren el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes cultivos y compra D. productos como, fideos, arroz, aceite, harinas, verduras y otros.

Los socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y el préstamo otorgado parea la realización D. sus sueños, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The members of the “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD D. LARES” bank are from the Lares district, in the province of Calca, located within the region of Cusco. Our members alternate between agricultural activities, like planting potatoes, corn, wheat and barley, and home-based businesses in which the women sell food in the main town plaza on Saturdays and Sundays, while the men take products like dry grains and sell them in other districts around and within the city of Cusco. The members need this loan to reinvest in their various crops and to buy products like dry noodles, rice, oil, flour, vegetables and other ingredients. The members are grateful for the support they have received and for the approval of their loan, which they hope will help them realize their dreams. They promise to repay this loan according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling food in the main town plaza

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 34 años, vive con su hijo de 17 años en casa de su madre. Se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en la feria comercial de su ciudad, de preferencia sale los domingos, ya que en ese día hay mayores posibilidades de ventas, por lo que siempre cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo para cargar los paquetes de mercadería que transporta. Empezó hace 5 años, y hasta el momento su negocio le ha resultado rentable, lo que la motiva a continuar para incrementar cada vez más su capital de trabajo. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy segura de permanecer en su banco comunal, pues le agrada la forma de trabajo de todos sus compañeros. El dinero que está solicitando es para adquirir nueva mercadería, y con ella regresar a la feria de su localidad, ya que en las últimas oportunidades, por tener menos prendas, solo vendía por su barrio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 34 years old. She lives with her 17 year-old son in her mother’s house. She sells clothing as a street vendor in the city’s market. She prefers to sell on Sundays, since the possibility of making sales is greatest on this day. She always counts on her son’s help to carry the packages of merchandise that she transports. She began with this 5 years ago, and so far the business has been profitable. This is what motivates her to continue increasing her working capital. This the second time she has had a loan with MFP and she is certain that she will stay with her communal bank because she likes working with all of the group’s members. The loan she is requesting is to purchase new merchandise. With new merchandise she can return to selling in her town’s market; the last few times she only sold in her neighborhood because she didn’t have many items of clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Акбарова Дилором- женщина 1961-го года рождения, разведённая сама воспитывает двоих детей.  Имеет среднее образование. Работает воспитателем в детском саду.Чтобы как-то пополнить свой семейный бюджет она решила   заняться  продажей метражных тканей и женской обуви на центральном  рынке  Джаббор-Расуловского района.Так как у нее  нет мужа , она растит 2-х детей в одиночку и конечно же ей очень трудно. Дилором  закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан.  Она хотела  бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому что, хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Dilorom A. is a woman born in 1961, divorced and is raising her children by herself. She has secondary education. She works as a mentor in a kindergarten. To increase her family budget just a little bit she has decided to start selling fabrics and women's shoes on the central market of Jabbor-Rasulov region. As she does not have a husband and is raising two children alone it is very difficult for her. Dilorom buys the merchandise from the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan. She wants to increase the assortment of her merchandise because a good variety attracts more customers. For this she has decided to take out a loan to increase the assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one roll of summer fabric and a batch of summer shoes

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
The smiling face shown in the photo is Mrs. Chan S., age 25, who lives in Banteay Meanchey Province. She is looking for a loan to buy house repair materials to support her husband’s business activities, working in construction.

Chan S. is a young mother caring for two young kids who are enrolled in the primary school. Presently, she sells different kinds of vegetables in the market to earn a living. She can generate $2 or $3 of income per day to contribute to her family’s food.

loans.use: To buy house repair materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita B. is from the village of Tuburan. She is 48 years old. Edita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Edita owns & operates a food vending business in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Edita has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Edita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Edita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
Venta de haba, CDs, productos plásticos, ropa y tejido de mantas, son algunos de los negocios de las integrantes del grupo “Sembradoras” que  a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal “German Busch”. 
Se agruparon hace aproximadamente tres años por la necesidad de contar un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios. Un ejemplo claro es lo que hace  Primitiva T. de 48 años que sola mantiene a sus tres hijos ya que enviudó hace  dos años, ella vende ropa como poleras, shorth y los lleva a los Yungas ( lugar cálido) y requiere incrementar mercadería por lo que solicitó el préstamo.
texts.en:
Selling beans, CDs, plastics, clothing and woven blankets are some of the businesses of members of the "Sembradoras" group, which is, in turn, a part of the Regional Office “German Busch”.

They came together as a group approximately 3 years ago because of a need for capital that would allow them to improve their businesses. A clear example is the business of Primitiva T., who is 48 years old and supports her three children by herself, since she was widowed two years ago. She sells clothing, such as t-shirts and shorts, which she brings to los Yungas (a warm climate). She needs to increase her inventory, for which she requested the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and primary materials

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Letecia is a resident from the village of Flores Naguilian, Isabela. She is happily married to Herminigildo, who is a teacher in their village. They have six children, most of whom are already grown. Some of her children have their own families and live on their own, but they still maintain communication.

Letecia has three pigs, which she raises to generate income. She is asking for the support of KIVA lenders because she does not have enough capital to purchase feed for her pigs. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en: Yasser operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation three years ago. He is a 32-year-old man who lives in Palestine with his wife and their five children. Yasser sells products like rice, canned foods and drinks, candies, evaporated milk, etc. He is requesting a loan with which he will increase his merchandise and provide his customers with a diversity of products. He would appreciate your assistance very much.

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

loans.name: Saray Y Responsabilidad 2 Group

texts.en:
Elia is a 48-year-old borrower who lives in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Elia is the coordinator for her group, Saray y Responsabilidad, and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Elia lives in La Habana, a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro. She lives with her two teenage children and is also raising her niece. Elia runs a small colmado from her home. Colmados are small corner stores that sell food, drinks and general household products for the residents in the neighborhood. Elia’s colmado focuses on food only, and she sells the basics of the Dominican cuisine: rice, beans, plantains, sugar, flour and oil.

San Pedro is a small city with many amenities. Unfortunately, there are several neighborhoods which lack access to those amenities. La Habana is one of those neighborhoods. Most of the city has running water, somewhat reliable electricity, and decent waste management, but La Habana lacks all of these. Despite the difficulties in her community, Elia is happy that she now has access to loans which have given her more business in her neighborhood. With the extra profits from her business, Elia is able to better raise her children and she hopes to send them to university after they finish high school. Thank you for your loan to Elia and the Saray y Responsabilidad group!

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Jmv

texts.en:
JMV N. is 37 years old and is married with six children aged 3 through 15. He and his family live in Burera district in the Northern Province of Rwanda, approximately three hours drive from the capital city of Kigali.

His village, called Rugarama, is where he has had his business of tending chickens and selling them and their eggs since 2006. His business is open every day from 6 in morning to 5 in evening and he employs two people in his business so that it runs well and gives him some time with his family.

JMV is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase more chickens and eggs that will help him to increase his sales and attract more customers. This should produce additional profits which he will reinvest into his business to create a strong and secure future for his young family.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and eggs

loans.name: Vicenta Antonia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Inmaculada se formó en la ciudad de Manta en la provincia de Manabí, este es un puerto marítimo muy visitado por los turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de  sus habitantes  viven de la pesca artesanal.

La señora Vicenta es oriunda del cantón Santa Ana, llegó a vivir a Manta hace 18 años, está casada tiene  y tiene tres hijos;   ella se dedica a la cría de pollos en un promedio de 100 a 200 aves  en una pequeña área de su casa que destinó para montar su criadero,  su  esposo es el encargado de comprar lo necesario  para su pequeña granja avícola, una vez listos los vende en pie o pelados a sus vecinas y en el restaurant donde ella trabaja  de 9 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación ESPOIR  invertirá en la compra de crías y productos como maíz, balanceados y vitaminas para la crianza de sus pollos apra incrementar poco a poco su criadero.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "María Inmaculada" was formed in the city of Manta, in the province of Manabí. Manta is a tourist coastal town that is visited by many from all over the country and abroad. The majority of the residents lives off traditional subsistence fishing. Vicenta is from the Santa Ana canton and moved to Manta 18 years ago. She is married and has three children. She raises chickens, between 100-200 birds on average, in a small area of her yard that she designated as their coop. Her husband is in charge of buying all necessary supplies for her small avian farm. Once the birds are ready for market, she sells them live or plucked to her neighbors and to the restaurant at which she works from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. With the loan she is requesting from Kiva partner Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy chicks and supplies such as maize, balanced food, and vitamins so that she can slowly increase the size of her coop.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chicks and feed to raise chickens

loans.name: Segundo Benancio

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad en el sector Poste Blanco del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años se dedica al transporte de carga y de pasajeros en su mototaxi. Este negocio es el único ingreso económico con el que viene sustentando a su familia, por lo que todos los días se esfuerza al máximo para poder sacarlos adelante. Segundo trabaja desde las seis y media de la mañana hasta las cinco y treinta de la tarde.

Debido al mal estado de los caminos y de la mayoría de calles que recorre diariamente, hace algunos días su unidad móvil sufrió algunas fallas mecánicas que la han dejado inoperativa, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para cubrir los gastos de reparación.

Segundo nos comenta que su más grande anhelo es instalar una pequeña tienda que le permita tener los ingresos suficientes para terminar de construir su casa. El ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución en oportunidades anteriores y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsablidad al momento de asumir sus pagos, por lo que es considerado un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 33 year old father. He lives with his wife and his two children, 11 and 8, in the Poste Blanco sector of the Paiján distict, Ascope province, La Libertad region. This is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked for three years transporting cargo and passengers in his "mototaxi" (three wheeled motorized taxi). This business is the only source of economic income that he has to support his family. Therefore, everyday he puts forth his maximum effort to be able to get them ahead. Segundo works from six thirty in the morning until five thirty in the afternoon. Due to the bad condition of the paths and the majority of the streets that he travels daily, his taxi suffered mechanical difficulties and stopped working several days ago. That is why he saw the necessity of asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 500 PEN to cover the repair costs. Segundo tells us that his big wish is to set up a small store that would allow him to have sufficient income to finish building his house. He has worked with our institution previously, and he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his payments. Therefore, he is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair expenses for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a married with 3 children who are still in school. She is a 42-year-old business woman. She started trading fifteen years ago and she enjoys selling goods. She trades in clothing materials. Susana believes in hard work and dedication. She has gained lots of marketing experience, making her one of the successful traders in the local market she sells. Her would provide her with more capital to purchase more stock of clothing materials to serve her customers this Christmas festivities.

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie M. is from Sta. Barbara, llagan, Isabela. She is 35 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Rosemarie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rental of equipment for the extraction and sale gravel and sea sand.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen S. lives in Preak Svay village in Kandal province and she is 47 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Phun S., are farmers who own a small piece of land they use to grow bananas and sugarcane.

In the sugarcane field, they have some problems because it has infertile soil. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sen S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticide to support her field.

Mrs. Sen S. is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pesticide for her field

loans.name: Arlie

texts.en:
Arlie M. lives in the village of Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arlie has run a general store for the last eight years. In February 2010, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, her first, to buy additional items to sell and increase her supply of working capital. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell and increase her supply of working capital

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle A. is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of La Carlota, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Annabelle operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Annabelle has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately PHP 7,000 a month from these activities.

In 2002, Annabelle joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 13,000 from NWTF. Annabelle is now requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Annabelle from NWTF.  Annabelle plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the tuition fees for her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon."

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Victorias Group

texts.es: El grupo las victorias se na dedicado a la fabricaciòn y venta de delantales  y hace 5 años atras y con ello se an mantendio y han apoyado a sus hijos en la edad escolar, pero ellas quieren fabricar màs y tener a la venta  para cubrir la demanda por lo que acudieron a la ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR  para este apoyo y quieren tener màs capital para invertir en los delantales y asi superar y realizar sus sueños de esta en otro nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The Las Victorias group is dedicated to making and selling aprons. They have done this for five years and with it have supported themselves and their schoolage children. However, they want to make more and sell them to cover the demand. For this reason, they went to ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR for this support. They want to have more capital to invest in the aprons and in this way get ahead and have their dreams come true in another lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital Application

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Guillermo Alfredo

texts.es:
El  Señor. GUILLERMO ALFREDO M., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua.
El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y dos de  ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido el  crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de dos perlines y cinco laminas de zinc para el techo de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor. GUILLERMO ALFREDO M., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua. El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido el crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de dos perlines y cinco laminas de zinc para el techo de su casa de habitación. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a married man who has one child.  He is a businessman who operates a wholesale shop where he sells mobile phone airtime cards.  He was previously selling vehicle tyres and oil.  He has four years experience in his business.  He joined Matel group in Faulu Kenya after being introduced by a friend.  He was previously guaranteed a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to boost his business.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy mobile phone airtime cards.  He hopes to improve his living standards in the future.  For this reason, he works hard in his business.  He sees himself owning several shops in ten years.  He describes himself as confident and determined.

loans.use: To buy mobile airtime cards

loans.name: Mrs. Sinoeun Soy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nine people from Preaek Anhchanh village, in Kandal province make up this group loan.  Each member will use a piece of the loan to improve their own business. Sinoeun S., who is a vegetable seller is the group's president.  She wants to expand her business and requests a loan to buy more vegetable for resell.  Her husband is a taxi driver who owns a car and his profits help to support his family.  They have three children; one helps out by selling vegetables.  The other two attend a local public school.

loans.use: Buy more vegetable for resell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 27-year-old married man living with his wife and their two children in Lebanon. He's a skillful hairdresser, having many years of experience. In 2003, he opened his own barbershop in his hometown. This man caters to a wide range of clientele in the village and its neighborhoods.

Today, Hussein wishes to improve his barbershop by changing the decor, repainting it, and purchasing a new seat. This is his second cycle, and he has always reimbursed on time. His previous loan allowed him to become the owner of his shop and stop paying rent. Hussein is certain that, with the help of the loan, his business productivity will increase, and he will be able to collect more savings for his house. He also plans on increasing his merchandise, which includes shampoos, gels, and sprays, so that he can attract more clientele.

loans.use: To change the decor of his shop

loans.name: Sok Eng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Eng C. is 56 years old and is the leader of a village bank loan group, having been selected by the members, located in Roka village in Takeo province. With the loan, the members of this village loan will further their different purposes and they hope to increase their income to support their families. 

Mrs. Sok Eng C. is a pig breeder and also a rice wine maker at home, able to earn a small income to help support her family. For both their businesses, Mrs. Sok Eng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed for pig breeding and to buy rice for rice wine making. Her husband, Mr. Chhum Sou, is a farmer and also helps his wife with her businesses. This couple has five children; two are seamstresses in a garment factory while the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for pig breeding

loans.name: Srieng

texts.en: Mrs. Srieng B. was born in 1965 and she lives in Dak Por village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer of construction road, and the other is housework. Although they all try to work hard they can earn less income. So to improve her condition her family living, Mrs. Srieng B. is seeking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business to increase her family’s income this current year with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mr. Sary V. is a driver; he drives for a company in Phnom Penh City. His wife is a garment factory worker. They have been married since 2008, and have no children. The family lives in a village along National Road Number one, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sary is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. 

In the photo is Sary’s mother, because he and his wife were at work when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more children's clothes and body lotion

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en: Mkhitar S., who is married and has two children, lives in the village of Baghramyan in the Shirak region of Armenia. With his wife, he cultivates land and keeps a small farm which provides some income for the family. Mkhitar has applied for this loan to cultivate three hectares of wheat and expand the farm.

loans.use: To cultivate 3 hectares of wheat and expand the farm

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 24-year-old man who is ambitious and hardworking. He lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

For six months now, Innocent has been operating a cinema hall and he confesses to have not met any hurdles so far and the business is steadily growing. His dream is to see it become a big theatre.

Innocent intends to use the loan to purchase a television set for his cinema hall.

loans.use: To purchase a television set for his cinema hall

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A.  is currently in the business of selling a variety goods such as beans, onions etc and is requesting a loan to stock more items to sell.  Betty is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 3 children and 1child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: stock more  items to sell

loans.name: Melvin

texts.es: El Sr. Melvin B. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como profesor de secundaria donde tiene once años de laborar en el Instituto José de la Cruz Mena. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc y pago de mano de obra para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en: Mr. Melvin B. is a native of the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón.  He currently works as a secondary school teacher at the José de la Cruz Mena High School where he has worked for eleven years.  This is the first loan he has applied for through Ceprodel.  It is for purchasing bricks, cement, sand, zinc and to pay for labor in order to improve the living conditions for his children.

loans.use: Purchase bricks, cement, sand, zinc and pay for labor.

loans.name: Felipina

texts.en:
Felipina P. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena. She is 65 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, Felipina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Felipina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2001, Felipina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Felipina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the 18th loan that Felipina has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Serapia

texts.en:
Serapia N. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Serapia has s a business selling kitchen wares — casseroles, frying pans and rice cookers. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Serapia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and aa working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Serapia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra Díaz  tiene 41 años de edad y vive en el barrio Alcalá de a ciudad de Bogotá, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 22 años, con los que sueña verlos exitosos en un futuro muy cercano.  Alexandra se dedica a coser camisas, y uniformes de dotación,  mediante el sistema satelital, es decir le envían la prenda cortada para que ella prepare, ensamble y acabe cada una;  últimamente está  diseñando sus propias camisas y necesita capital para invertir en sus materias primas e insumos,  porque a razón de su experiencia ha logrado una muy buena calidad en lo que confecciona, por esos ha conseguido buenos clientes en diversa empresas y también de su antigua clientela doméstica;  así que con  su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  va a comprar tela, pellón, hilos  y botones para ese fin. Cuando Alexandra inició su negocio lo hizo hace ocho años,  maquilando para una fabrica, pero gradualmente se le han abierto las puertas en empresas y almacenes y ella ha respondido, porque está confeccionando camisas con técnicas que realzan la calidad de la prenda, por ello ha logrado nuevos y exigentes compradores.
Su sueño es tener un almacén abierto al público, donde confeccione exclusivamente   sus diseños  acoplados con corbatas y pantalones para hombres, ella desea que esté ubicado en un corredor comercial estratégico,  para que sus ventas cada día se incrementen y logre ser exitosa con sus confecciones y con su almacén. En la actualidad sus ventas promedios son de $6.000.000 COP, su utilidad bruta es de 45,9%, tiene un capital de trabajo de $3.070.000 COP y su rotación de inventarios es de 25 días. Si usted conoce a Alexandra, percibirá que tiene unos   objetivos  muy claros especialmente en lo que se refiere a posicionar las camisas que va a producir y que representan 200 unidades al mes en este momento, porque su sueño es crecer empresarialmente y continuar sacando a sus dos hijos adelante
texts.en:
Alexandra Díaz is 41 years old and lives with her two children, ages 20 and 22, in the Alcalá neighborhood of Bogotá.  She dreams of seeing her children become successful in the near future.

Alexandra sews staff shirts and uniforms.  In her case, customers send her the cut fabric and she assembles and finishes each item.  Lately she has been designing her own shirts and needs working capital to invest in supplies and materials.  Her experience has allowed her to create very good quality, so she has attracted good customers from different companies, as well as her previous local customers.  This will be her first Kiva loan through “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,” and she will use the money to buy fabric, leather, thread, and buttons.

She began her business eight years ago, by doing work sent to her from a factory, but this has gradually opened other doors for her with other companies and clothing warehouses and she has responded to this opportunity because she is making shirts, using techniques that improve the quality of the clothing.  This has brought her new customers who seek good quality.

Her dream is to have her own clothing warehouse open to the public, where she can manufacture her exclusive designs, and pair them with men’s slacks and ties.  She would like it to be located in a strategic business corridor so that she can increase her sales each day and be successful with her sales and clothing warehouse.

Currently, her average sales are 6,000,000 COP; her net profit is 45.9%; and she has working capital in the amount of 3,070,000 COP.  She rotates her inventory every 25 days.  If you were to meet Alexandra, you would see that she has clear objectives, especially in her plans to produce 200 shirts a month, because she wants to grow as an entrepreneur and continue moving her children ahead.

loans.use: Materials and supplies

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
Fani forma parte del grupo “Paz y Progreso” el cual está conformado por 12 Amigas que decidieron poner el nombre al grupo por los deseos que quieren para ellas. Ella trabaja haciendo manualidades y utiliza su préstamo en pinturas, microporoso y otras cosas para el acabado D. sus trabajos, espera ampliar su negocio y formar un equipo D. trabajo para hacer las manualidades en cantidad, así mismo espera poder seguir apoyando a su hija Gaby en sus estudios D. educación y espera que las habilitaciones sigan apoyando al grupo.
Los acompaña la señora Astuvilca (camisa floreada), fundadora del grupo.
texts.en:
Fani is a member of the 'Paz y Progreso' (Peace and Progress) group which is maD. up of 12 friends who decided to give the group this name because of the wishes that they have for each other.  Fani makes handicrafts and she will use her loan to buy paints, 'microporoso' (a type of foam) and other items for finishing off her crafts.  She hopes to expand her business and get together a workforce so that she can make handicrafts in larger quantities.  She hopes, in this way, to be able to continue supporting her daughter Gaby in her studies and hopes that her group keeps being supported by their training sessions.
