Accompanying the other members is Astuvilca (in the flowery blouse) who is the group's founder.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia tiene 48 años de edad, es casada con Esteban de 50 años y tienen 03 hijos; viven en su propia casa en el distrito de Ayna San Francisco y es una familia muy feliz. Julia, se dedica al negocio y tiene ingresos distintos; obtenidos de la venta de refrescos de chicha, que ella misma prepara, asimismo vende frutas variadas como: plátano, mango, piña, pacae y cítricos, asimismo vende pan. Esta serie de actividades lo realiza dentro del distrito de San Francisco con ayuda de sus hijos. Julia sabe como administrar su tiempo, madruga a las 04 de la mañana para dirigirse al horno a recoger los panes, luego se dirige a las esquinas para poder venderlos; una vez  culminado con sus ventas, se dirige a su kiosco de frutas, que a la vez también aprovecha en vender sus refrescos; ya que su espacio de frutas es amplio. Su actividad es rutinaria viene  trabajando hace más de 15 años, le encanta este negocio porque gracias a ello pudo sacar profesional a uno de sus hijos. Para el futuro desea abrir una fuente de soda, para aumentar sus ingresos económicos y poder atender a más clientes. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y asegura que no dejará de pagar sus cuotas, En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada  por ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con los tres mil que solicita, comprará lo necesario para aperturar su tienda, una fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old.  She is married to 50 year-old Esteban and they have three children.  They live in their own home in Ayna San Francisco district.  Julia's is a very happy family.

Julia makes income from a number of businesses.  She sells 'chicha' (a drink made from corn) which she makes herself and she also sells various fruit such as bananas, mangoes, pineapples, guavas and citrus fruit.  Julia also sells bread.  She carries out these business activities in San Francisco district with the help of her children.  Julia knows how to manage her time.  She gets up at 4.00am and heads for her oven to collect her bread.  She then heads out to the street corner top sell the bread.  Once she has finished making her bread sales, she heads off to her fruit stand where she sells her fruit and also her soft drinks since her fruit stand is quite spacious.

Julia's business is routine.  She has been working for more than 15 years.  She loves her business because it has enabled her to support one of her children in becoming a professional.  In the future, she would like to open a soda fountain in order to increase her income and serve more customers.

This is Julia's sixth loan with MFP and she assures us that she won't fail to make her loan repayments.  She is a very well-respected member of her community bank as she is very punctual with her repayments.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy the supplies she needs to open her soda fountain.

loans.use: To buy materials and products to open her soda fountain

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes es madre soltera con 31 años de edad tiene tres hijos de 15,12 y 7 que se encuentran en edad escolar ella vive en casa de sus padres ubicado en la calle Catalina,Lourdes se inicio aproximadamente tres años en el negocio de la venta de jugos y desayunos de forma ambulatoria en la actualidad cuenta con un puesto alquilado ubicado en el mercadillo de manzanilla, el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de vitrinas y electrodomesticos para el negocio, se le otorga el financiamiento por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a 31-year-old single mother of three school-aged children ages 15, 12 and 7. She lives in her parents' home on Catalina Street. Lourdes started her business approximately three years ago. She sells juices and breakfasts on the street. She currently has a rented stall in the Manzanilla Market.
This authorized loan will be used to purchase display cases and home electronics for her business. She has been granted this loan because she has good references, and the desire and ability to repay it.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mrs. Channa N. is a married and has four children, all of whom attend a local public school. They also spend time working on the family's farm. She was born in 1974 and lives in Damnak Reachea village, which is located in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Sor, own a three-hectare plot of land where they grow rice and vegetables, which they make a living by selling. Mr. Bunthoeun Sor also works in construction. The family has a problem because their farm has a lot of insects. To increase her production of rice, Mrs. Channa N. is applying for a loan to buy pesticide. She will also use a portion of this loan to hire workers to help her to do her farming.

loans.use: To buy pesticide for a rice and vegetable farm

loans.name: Madres Activas Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed on September 16th, 2008, on the initiative of Ms. Carolina Velazco (a former member).  The group was formed thanks to the overwhelming desire of its members.  

The members of this group are investing the loan they receive into buying fruits, vegetables, clothing, soft drinks, articles of jewelry, bread and meat to resell in their businesses.  All of the members of the committee say they are happy with the given credit because they will be able to improve their lives.

Mrs. Delcida is the chairwoman of this committee.  She has a small general store which sells everything.  But it costs a lot of money to stock the store to supply the needs of her customers, so she applied for a loan because believes that with this investment she can progress.

loans.use: To purchase products to resell

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Gerelmaa is 40 years old and lives with her two daughters in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a plot of land that they own.  Her older daughter attends college while her younger daughter attends a local secondary school. 

Gerelmaa began selling a variety of wall coverings at a rented stall in a nearby market in 2007.  She wants to expand her business and increase her income.  She is a hardworking and polite person. Her older daughter helps her with the business. Gerelmaa is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more wall coverings for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more wall coverings

loans.name: Pregreno

texts.en:
Pregreno G., J.. is from the village of San Francisco, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old.  Pregreno is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Pregreno owns & operates a business selling seafood products, like milkfish and sardines, in the local community.  Pregreno has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Pregreno joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pregreno is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish, like salmon & mackerel. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pregreno from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, like salmon & mackerel

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 44 years old and married, with 2 children, 7 and 9 years old. He lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with his family.

Rene is a farmer who owns land in his town. He tills his land and prepares it well for cropping. Rene grows rice that he sells to his community. He usually earns about 3,000 PHP from his farming. Rene also owns a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife manages. They sell noodles, canned goods and other kinds of products. Rene says that the store helps the family with their daily needs.

Rene has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. He is hopeful that this loan will help his businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia N. is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her maids. Sylivia lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Sylivia sells charcoal. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products in a retail shop from which she also generates additional income. The main business challenges for Sylivia include thieves and the rainy season.

Sylivia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes tiene 45 años, es madre soltera con un hijo a su cargo. Desde hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios son con esfuerzos propios, pues desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida con la venta y elaboración de rosquillas, ya que ha sido un negocio de familia, pues le tenía que ayudar a su Mama a vender estos productos es por eso que lucha todos los días para darle esa oportunidad a sus hijos, a pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado sigue con esta actividad. Ella invertirá el financiamiento en leña, maíz, queso, cuajada, huevo, canela, mantequilla, leche entre otros productos indispensables. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, pues todavía no tiene ciertos servicios básicos.
texts.en: Maria Lourdes is 45 years old. She is a single mother raising one son. For more than 5 years, she has worked at this business, which she started on her own. When she was very young, her mother taught her how to make a living making and selling rosquillas [doughnut shaped pastries]. This has been the family business and she had to help her mother sell these products. That is why she struggles every day to give her children that opportunity, despite the difficult situations she has faced with this activity. She will invest the loan in firewood, corn, cheese, egg, cinnamon, butter, milk and other indispensable products. She dreams of improving her home, since it doesn't have the basic utilities yet.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, cheese, curd, eggs, cinnamon, butter and milk, among other indispensable products.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is married with three school-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 20 years. Nestor is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds of corn to be planted on their farm. Nestor hopes this loan will grow his operations. Currently, he earns PHP 60,000 for each crop in this field of work. Nestor desires to expand his farm site soon for additional income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en: Vianney is 26 years old. He is not married. He owns a supermarket in which he sells several items such as water, sugar, juices, biscuits, milk etc. He has done this business for one year and eight months and it has enabled him to meet his needs. He is requesting a loan to buy more items for his supermarket and make more profits. He plans to save all his profits.

loans.use: To buy items for his supermarket.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José nacido el 12 de noviembre de1978 en Chuquisaca casado con doña Elodia  hace 9 años que el llego al Torno a buscar mejores días para el y su familia,  y lo encontró en Las Liras en la cual tiene su parcela para trabajar agricultura, siembra maíz, yuca, poroto y arroz. Pero  también se dedica a sacar madera y entregar a los carpinteros, vive a 30 km del Torno al oeste y la distancia hacia las localidades es larga por este motivo desea comprar una motocicleta para poder movilizarse mas rápidamente, es una persona trabajadora y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. José was born on November 12, 1978 in Chuquisaca. He is married to Doña Elodia. Nine years ago, he arrived in El Torno in search of a better life for himself and his family. In the area of Las Liras, he acquired a parcel of land to use farming. He grows corn, cassava, beans, and rice. José also chops wood for delivery to carpenters.

He lives 30km to the west of El Torno, so the distance to get into town is quite far. For this reason, he wants to buy a motorcycle so that he can get around more quickly. José is a hardworking individual and is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Sra. María es cliente recurrente de Fundación Paraguaya, está casada con el señor Jorge, con quien son padres de seis hijos de los cuales tres ya son mayores de edad y se desenvuelven en forma independiente mientras que los otros tres están residiendo con los mismos, están domiciliados en Ciudad del Este. 
La Sra. María estuvo dedicada a la venta de ropas en forma independiente durante mucho tiempo, el Señor Jorge es de profesión de albañil por lo cual realiza trabajos diversos por toda la zona. Amos se consideran personas muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas. Todo lo que realizan lo hacen para procurar a sus hijos una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de ropas, pues esta entrando el cambio de estación y le gustaría contar con una gran variedad de ropa para la venta. Tiene mucha esperanza de que el credito la podrá ayudar a salir adelante.
texts.en:
María is a recurrent client of Fundación Paraguaya.  She’s married to Jorge and they are the parents of six children three of which are adults and live independently and three that still live at home with their parents.  They live in Ciudad del Este.

María sold clothes independently for a long time.  Jorge is a bricklayer so works on various projects throughout the zone.  Both consider themselves to be very hard working, self sacrificed people.  Everything they do is aimed at providing their children with care-free, dignified lives.

She is asking for the loan to buy clothes because the season is about to change and she’s like to have a large assortment of clothes on hand to sell.  She has a lot of hope that the loan will help her get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Betty Gladys

texts.es:
Betty de 29 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Su esposo labora en una empresa como operador de maquinas. Tienen tres hijos de 3 y 2 años y uno de 8 meses. Tienen una papelería.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás cuando pasaron por una crisis financiera su esposo no trabajaba que ella hizo un préstamo y abrió una papelería para mantener a la familia. Labora de lunes a domingos de 6H00 am a 8H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas mercadería para sus respectivas ventas en el negocio y tener mas ingresos. En un futuro quiere darle lo mejor a sus hijos en educación y salud.
texts.en:
Betty is 29 years old.  She lives in Fortin, a peripheral area of  the city of Guayaquil. Her husband works for a company as a machine operator.  They have three children ages 3, 2, and 8 months. They have a stationery shop.  

She started the business some time ago when they were in a financial crisis and her husband was not working.  She got a loan and opened a stationery shop to support the family.  She works from Monday to Sunday from 6am to 8pm.  With this loan she would like to purchase more merchandise to sell and to increase her income.  In the future she would like to provide her children with the best education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase paper goods, notebooks, and pens.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Fe has a pigpen and she sells matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.
Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Gan-Uchral

texts.en:
Mrs. Gan-Uchral, 32, is a woman who is trying to improve her family's quality of life. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is 8 and a pupil of secondary school. And her husband has been a watchman in a private company since last year. 

Gan-Uchral has been running a meat-selling business in a butcher shop for 9 years and she has gained enough experience in this business field. She is a hardworking woman and wakes up at 5 in the morning, then finishes the job at 9 in the evening every day.  

She is planning to expand her business through raising her business trading capital. It is more beneficial to her monthly earnings and family finances. So she is taking a loan to increase her business trading capital by the purchase of wholesale meat. Her next plan is to build her own butcher shop in the backyard of her house.

loans.use: To increase her business trading capital by the purchase of wholesale meat.

loans.name: God Bless Ii Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in the village of Yoni in northern Sierra Leone about 39 years ago. She is married to a police officer, and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Kadiatu sells pepper and palm oil and has been doing this business for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (1,500,000 Sierra Leone leones) to buy large quantities of pepper and palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of pepper and palm oil to add to her business.

loans.name: Har

texts.en:
Har, 58 years old, is a recycler. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $15 per day. 

She has four children, 29, 27, 21 and 20 years old. None of her children is studying; they are all working in the factory for $13 per day for all. 

Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $15 on electricity, $40 on hire workers, $35 on transportation, and $30 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a hand tractor for plowing the villagers' farms to get some more income when her husband is off from doing construction. In the future, she wants to extend her recycle warehouse to stock more things for resale.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for plowing.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein, a 48-year-old married father of three children, has owned and operated with the help of his wife a small restaurant since 2005. Hussein sells chicken and Falafel sandwiches, the latter of which "can be served as veggie burgers too since they have the same shape but instead of meat, pork, fish or chicken, they are made of ground broad beans and chickpeas with special herbs and spices to provide a special flavor". His customers can be both local villagers and foreigners passing through to other villages.

Working hard on improving his business, Hussein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a grill and a freezer for his restaurant. The grill will help him cook special chicken sandwiches with various flavors, and the freezer will help to preserve the freshness of his Falafel mixture for several days.

Hussein's plans for expansion including enlarging his restaurant in order to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: to buy a grill and a freezer for his business.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El señor Lucio tiene 61 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos.

Don Lucio es un hombre muy luchador que ha trabajado desde los 8 años de edad. Fue su padre quien le enseñó primeramente el oficio de la alfarería (elaboración de ladrillos de barro, tejas, etc). A la edad de 25 años de edad, Don Lucio contrae matrimonio con su actual esposa.  Desde entonces él le lleva el sustento a su familia por medio de la agricultura. Fue así que poco a poco Don Lucio y su esposa han logrado tener un pedacito de tierra en donde cultivan. El terreno está ubicado a dos kilómetros y medio de su casa. Para llegar ahí solo lo pueden hacer a pie, caminando por veredas angostas en donde hay arbustos espinosos.Cuando ya tiene la cosecha, Don Lucio carga el maiz en su espalda para llevarlo hasta su casa, cruzando todas las veredas. Luego, él lleva el maiz en una carreta o en bus a venderlo en el pueblo más cercano. Todo este esfuerzo él lo hace con amor para su familia ya que es de esta forma como él puede llevarles el sustento diario. Don Lucio se levanta todos los días a las 4:00 de la mañana y termina a las 8:00 p.m. Cada año, Don Lucio almacena una parte de su cosecha en graneros y eso le sirve como materia prima para el siguiente año. Por esta razón, él no tiene que comprar la semilla para sembrar, aunque si tiene que comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas.

Para seguir trabajando, Don Lucio está solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas para la cosecha de maíz; y también para la compra de árboles de chile guaco. El quiere sembrar chile en el terreno de su casa para así tener un ingreso adicional con la venta de los chiles. 

Con respecto al beneficio del préstamo, Don Lucio manifiesta con sus propias palabras lo siguiente: “tendré el pan de cada día, tendré vestuario para mi familia, tendré salud y amor en el hogar por la satisfacción de que el préstamo ayudo a realizar mi objetivo y que Fundación Campo siempre ayuda al más pobre.”

El deseo de Don Lucio es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El quiere que sus hijos tengan un buen ejemplo de sus padres. El quiere que sus hijos aprendan que con esfuerzo y dedicación se puede vencer cualquier obstáculo, por muy difícil que parezca, y que la mejor forma de ganarse la vida es trabajando.
texts.en:
Señor Lucio is 61 years old, and lives with his wife and five children.

Don Lucio is a very hard-working man, who has been working since he was 8 years old.  It was his father who first taught him how to work in pottery (making mud bricks, tiles, etc.)  At the age of 25, Don Lucio married his current wife.  Since then, he has supported his family by means of agriculture.  Little by little, Don Lucio and his wife have been able to get a small piece of land which they cultivate.  The land is located two and a half kilometers from their home, and can only be reached on foot by walking through narrow paths with thorn bushes. When it's harvest time, Don Lucio carries the corn on his shoulders along the paths to bring it back to his home.  Then he brings the corn in a cart or on a bus to a village that's very close by, where he sells it.  He makes all this effort out of love for his family, and in this way he is able to provide them with their daily bread.

Don Lucio gets up at 4 a.m. every day, and finishes working at 8:00 p.m.  Every year, Don Lucio stores a part of his harvest in the granary, and uses it as starting material for the following year.  For this reason, he doesn't need to buy seeds for sowing, although he still needs to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides.

To continue with his work, Don Lucio is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo for the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for his corn crop, and also to purchase guaco chili plants.  He wants to grow chili peppers on the land belonging to his home, so that he can earn some additional income from the sale of the chili peppers.

In regards to the benefits of the loan, Don Lucio states the following in his own words: "I will have daily food, I will have clothing for my family, I will have health and love in my household, with the satisfaction of knowing that the loan has helped me to achieve my goal and that Fundación Campo always helps the poorest people."

Don Lucio's desire is to improve his family's quality of life.  He wants his children to see their parents as a good example.  He wants his children to learn that with effort and dedication they can overcome any obstacle, as difficult as things may seem, and that the best way to earn a living is through work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and guaco chili plants.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a married and lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. For the last four years, she has earned a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as noodles, sugar, vinegar, canned goods and vegetables. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to expand the size of her store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn has run her sewing business for almost 23 years. She is 45 years of age and married with four children. Now, Roselyn would like to improve the dresses she's made in order to encourage more customers to buy her products. She couldn't achieve this goal without sufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000. With this loan, she can buy garments, threads and other accessories needed for her sewing business. In addition, this loan will help her to greatly increase her production, as she has many orders to deliver. She hopes to be able to maintain her business, which enables her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy garments, threads and other accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda, a married mother of two, is 30 years old and resides in Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur where she owns farmland upon which she raises crops to make a living. In this business more than three years, she earns about Php 5,580.00 each month.

A member of GDMPC for more than two years, Esmeralda has requested a loan of Php 45,000.00 to purchase fertilizer and pay for rice planting. Some of the rest will be allotted for her children's education and saved for the next planting. She will use the additional profits arising from the loan both for her family's daily needs and her rice farm. Esmeralda is hoping that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for rice planting.

loans.name: Laurd

texts.fr:
Client de 36 ans, marie et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge varient entre 1 et 9 ans. Il se lance dans la menuiserie il  ya de cela 17 ans, quand il arrête ses études en classe de cinquième.
Ayant déjà bénéficié de 3 cycles de prêt a Hope Congo, il a vraiment  fait des énormes  bénéfices  avec la vente de ses meubles.
Il a fait des remboursements effectifs et a toujours épargné et ces différents prêts  ont réellement change sa vie financière et économique.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer le stock des fournitures pour fabriquer ses meubles, en achetant les produits comme des rouleaux de tissus e velours, de la planche, des contre plaques, des éponges, de la colle et des pointes.
Sa stratégie est de fabriquer des meubles, comme des gardes linges, des buffets, armoires, des lits, des fauteuils, qu’il expose pour la vente.
Très connu par la qualité de travail fournit, avec ses bénéfices, il est entrain d’économiser pour acheter une machine de rabotage et sciage  des planches, une tour a bois pour fournir a ses clients un travail finit et bien fait
texts.en:
This is a 36-year-old client, married with three children whose ages range from 1 to 9 years. He began carpentry 17 years ago when he interrupted his schooling in fifth grade.

Having already been granted three loan cycles from Hope Congo, he made ​​huge profits from the sale of his furniture. He promptly reimbursed the loans and always put aside some savings. These loans have truly changed his financial and economic life.

This new loan will serve to strengthen the stock of supplies he needs to manufacture his furniture, by acquiring products such as rolls of fabric and velvet, boards, plywood, sponges, glue and nails.

His strategy is to manufacture furniture, such as wardrobes, buffets, cabinets, beds, armchairs, he then exhibits prior to sales.

Well known for the quality of work provided, he is currently putting his profits into savings to eventually buy a machine to plane and saw boards, and a wood lathe, to provide his customers with a final well-finished product.

loans.use: To buy planks, plywood, varnish and sandpaper

loans.name: Sotoewa

texts.fr:
Sotoewa est une femme âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle n’a pas d’enfant.  
Sotoewa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1986. Elle fait le commerce de légumes et de produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients au grand marché. Elle achète les produits à lomé. Elle vend seule. 
Sotoewa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des légumes et des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Sotoewa voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sotoewa is a 57-year-old woman. She is married to a driver and has no children.
Sotoewa has worked as a retailer since 1986. She sells vegetables and general food products to all types of customers at the grand market. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself.
Sotoewa has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy vegetables and general food products. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Sotoewa would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with her profits, she intends to change her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and general food products.

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Sophors and her husband, Bunrat, have been married since 2008. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. As you may be able to see from the picture, Sophors is pregnant.

The couple sells mangoes for a living. They purchase mango contracts from fellow villagers before the harvest season, and when the mangoes are harvested they carry them to sell at a market located in Phnom Penh.

Sophors is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional mangoes for resale purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.name: Clem Karl

texts.en:
This is Karl, 22, a resident of Paliparan Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. Single, he is working hard to provide for his daily expenses and also to help his parents and siblings.

Karl makes a living by selling jewelry, cell phones, ready-to-wear products and other merchandise. He has been in this business for four years and is very knowledgeable about the preferences of his customers, most of whom are students and young people. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is applying for a loan of 15,000 PHP. He will be using the money to buy more products to sell. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business. 

Karl dreams of being successful in his business. As a CCT community partner, he faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products and other items needed in his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 24-year-old married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for one year.

Mary is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Mercedita has a shop that sells computer accessories & school supplies. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stock, such as computer accessories & school supplies.
Mercedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mercedita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock, like computer accessories & school supplies

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et de 4 enfants en moyenne. Elles vivent  dans des  familles polygames dans la ville de Bougouni, au quartier de Médine.  
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles se sont connues par les liens de voisinage et de commerce. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et des fruits et légumes.
FANTA, est la présidente du groupe, elle est devant avec a un panier de tomate fraîche contenant un peu de choux, sur son pied. 
Elle compte acheter, avec son prêt, 400 kg de tomate fraîche, 300kg de choux et divers petits colis de condiments(fièfiè, poivre, poudre de gombo et de Sounbala). Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako avec les grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour soutenir les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The BADEGNA group consists of married women who average 29 years of age and four children each. They live in polygamous families in the city of Bougouni, located in the Medina district. They know one another as neighbors and through their trade. They sell food condiments, fruits and vegetables. This is their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans were repaid without problems.

FANTA is the president of the group. She is sitting at the front in the photo with a basket of fresh tomatoes and cabbage. She will use her loan to purchase 400 kg of fresh tomatoes, 300 kg of cabbage, and various small packets of condiments (fièfiè, pepper, okra powder and Sounbala). She buys her merchandise from wholesalers in Bamako, and she conducts her sales at retail at the big market of Bougouni and from her home, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, part of which is to be used to cover the costs of the children’s healthcare and education, and the remainder to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments, fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Youn's Group

texts.en: Youn’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Youn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is married with a 6 year old son. She cares for her elderly father who is very sick and is living with her family. Victoria graduated the Specialized Technical School. She deals in selling new clothes for women and children. She started as a teacher in Day Care and then changed to a salesperson in a store. Eventually she started her own small business selling new clothes in the market. Her business is the main source of income for the family. Victoria has great managerial and entrepreneurial skills and has a good reputation as a business owner. She is very affable and sociable. She is very good at getting a wide assortment of clothing items which helps her find her market and be successful in her business. Victoria has proven that she is trustworthy by repaying 10 previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delays. Victoria has a shortage of capital and that’s why she is requesting a loan. She needs $1,000 to get a better assortment of goods for the busy holiday season which will help her promote the growth of her business and thereby provide for her family.

Вікторія Шевякова – одружена, в неї є 6-річний син. Вона дбає про батька похилого віку, який живе з нею. Вікторія закінчила технікум. Заробляє на життя продажем одягу для дітей та жінок. Якийсь час Вікторія працювала вихователем в дитячому садку. Потім пішла на іншу роботу, почала працювати в магазині. Врешті решт вирішила почати свій власний бізнес та продавати одяг на ринку. Її бізнес є основним джерелом прибутку для родини. Вікторія – талановитий підприємець, має чудову репутацію. Вона дуже люб’язна та ввічлива з клієнтами. Вікторії завжди вдається представити різноманітні товари, які користуються великим попитом. Завдяки цьому вона досягає успіху в бізнесі. Вікторія підтвердила, що їй можна довіряти, тому що вона без жодного прострочення виплатила усі 10 попередніх позик, які отримала в „Надії України”. Вікторії не вистачає коштів, тому їй потрібна позика. Вона просить 1000 доларів для того, щоб ще більше урізноманітнити асортимент товарів напередодні святкового сезону. Отримання позики сприятиме розвитку її бізнесу та допоможе Вікторії забезпечити потреби своєї родини.

loans.use: To increase inventory for Christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane Muthoni Mwangi intends to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Ascención

texts.en:
"I've already built a second story for my house, but it's still missing a few things. Namely, I wasn't able to put on the roof, so none of it is livable yet, and I built the rooms for my children. With a lot of work, I was able to put up the walls, but I was not able to finish everything." I'm requesting a loan of $1,2000 to put on the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

“Ya terminé de construir la planta alta de mi casa pero me faltan algunos detalles, sobre todo me falta poner el techo para poder habitar esos cuartos ya que los construí para mis hijos, con mucho esfuerzo logre levantar las paredes pero ya no pude terminarlo” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para poner el techo de la planta alta de mi casa.

loans.use: Put a roof on the second story of his home

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza is 52 years of age, she is married and is the mother of three youngsters. Her husband has a grocery store, yet the income he obtains is not enough to cover all the basic needs of his family. As Lorenza is an enterprising woman, she started her own taco store. Her taste for cooking and her personality have helped her build relationships with others who have helped her build her business. Little by little she started earning a good reputation, and thanks to the good quality of her products, her clients have multiplied.

Now Lorenza needs a $ 925 dollar loan which she will use to refurbish her store. She wants to improve the service offered to her clients and to continue to grown. She is willing to return this loan in 6 months. You can be a part of this business and help this family. They thank you very much for your trust and support.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorenza tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres jóvenes. Su esposo tiene una tienda de abarrotes y el ingreso que obtiene no cubría todas las necesidades básicas de su familia, pero como Lorenza es una mujer emprendedora e inició su propio negocio con la venta de tacos, su gusto por la cocina y el su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás le han ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos sus clientes se han multiplicado.

En estos momentos Lorenza necesita de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local, porque quiere mejorar el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes y continuar creciendo, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes formar parte en este negocio y ayudar a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Taqueria Refurbishment

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Djamila B. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. She is 29, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Djamila owns and operates a small beauty salon. She has in her employ one woman (pictured here), who is the only breadwinner for her family.

There are quite a lot of beauty salons around and competition is fierce. Most importantly, Djamila tries not to lose her customers, who, she fears, might leave her to look for more attractive shops. To cope with this, Djamila needs to renovate her salon and to make it more attractive. For this purpose, she has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of US$ 500. She hopes eventually to develop her business further.

loans.use: To renovate her beauty shop

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is a hardworking 32year old single woman with 6 children. She also cares for 4 orphans. She has a retail store with a bar. And, she is also raising 30 pigs. The pigs will mature in 8 months at which time she will sell them.  
In her retail store Christine sells sugar, maize flour, salt, rice and g-nuts. In her bar she sells a matooke wine. Matooke wine is made from unripe bananas which are buried in the ground and covered with banana leaves for three days to soften them. Then they are roasted slightly and again buried for three days after which they are stomped in a dug out log and placed in an earthen jug to ferment for 14 days.
Christine  has been in business for 10 years and a member of her lending group for 7 years. With her loan she plans to buy maize and matooke feed for her pigs. One day she hopes to buy a pick-up truck so that she can transport her pigs to market.

loans.use: Christine plans to use her loan to buy maize and matooke feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Amin is a 30 year old man who lives with his wife and two children in in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. Amin owns a grocery store.  He is planning to buy a car. He therefore needs a loan to buy merchandise to generate greater revenue. This is the second time Amin is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. Amin is known to be a reliable micro entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Miss Kol C. is single and lives with her mother (shown in picture). Her family lives along National Road Number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of growing flowers for selling. She grows many kinds of flowers in the farm near her house. She started this business in 1980.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of $600. She will use this money for purchasing a water pump and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: For purchasing a water pump and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 26 years old and has been selling bananas at the market for three years. She purchases them directly from the farmers and sells them to locals. Lydia works alone at the market while caring for her two-week old baby. Her two other children attend primary school.

Lydia is not married and she, along with her three children, live with her sister and her husband and their two children.

She dreams of making enough money to enable her to start a grocery store.

loans.use: Lydia is looking for a loan to purchase more bananas to sell at her stall at the local market.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina Gonzales is considered a hard working, honest, understanding woman and a good mother. She is married to Mr. Teodulo Rivera San Roman who is a general assistant to a carpenter. They have three children; Eliud Geovane is single and 22 years old, Kelia is 15 years old and a high school student, and Sara Janai is 8 years old and is in primary school. They all live at home.

She started her business to be able to move ahead and help her son finish school and also help her husband with the expenses of the home and satisfy her personal needs. She started out 15 years ago selling fabric that one her brothers would send to her from the city of San Luis Potosi. Later, a friend invited her to sell cosmetic products; this was in May of 1998. She started selling these products to her existing customers, neighbors and family members. With this income she was able to help her son finish high school.

She is now requesting a loan of USD $300 which she will repay in 4 months to supply the orders that her customers place and have a larger variety to offer to her prospective customers. With your support Bernardina will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Bernardina González se considera una persona muy trabajadora, honesta, comprensiva y buena madre. Esta casada con el Sr. Teódulo Rivera San Román quien es ayudante general de Carpintero, tienen 3 hijos Eliud Geovane de 22 años, soltero; Keila de 15 años, estudiante de secundaria y Sara Janaí de 8 años estudiante de primaria; todos viven en casa.

Inició el negocio por deseos de salir adelante y lograr que su hijo terminara la secundaria así como poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y poder satisfacer sus necesidades personales. Emprendió hace 15 años vendiendo tela que un hermano le enviaba desde la ciudad de San Luis Potosí, posteriormente una amiga la invitó a vender productos cosmeticos, esto fue en mayo de 1998, comenzó ofreciendo estos productos a los clientes que ya tenía, vecinas y familiares, con este ingreso logro que su hijo terminara la secundaria.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir los pedidos que le hacen los clientes y para tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a los posibles compradores. Con tu apoyo Bernardina saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Miss Sopheab M. is single and lives with her mother, who is a farmer, and her younger brother, who builds wooden houses. The family lives on an island on Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss Sopheab has been a weaver for over ten years. It’s a skill she learns from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who will sell them in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase a construction crane for her brother use to build wooden houses.

loans.use: To purchase construction crane

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia V. works in a shop and lives with her parents in the zone of Pura Pura in the city of La Paz. The requested loan will be used to build a room which will be used as a kitchen. This is the 4th loan she has received and the socioeconomic analysis shows that she qualifies to receive this loan.

La señora Claudia C. V. es empleada en un puesto de venta, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pura Pura de la Ciudad de La Paz.. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación que será utilizada como cocina. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente, por lo que puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To construct a new room to be used as a kitchen

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun L., 25, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Mov, 24, who live on an Island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2001 and have two sons.
 
Mrs. Sokhoeun and her husband have been silk weavers for 10 years, selling their products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. 

Now Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk material for the weaving business and to build up the grade of the ground upon which her house sits, as it currently floods during the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and raise the grade of the ground upon which her house sits.

loans.name: Thi Ly

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ly, 51 years old, has 3 grown-up children. Before joining the TYM Fund, her family's income came mainly from farming, livestock and her husband's income as a hired worker. After joining the Fund, she had more capital to invest in buying and selling poultry. Her first loan of 1,000,000VND (about 66USD) was used to purchase poultry from various poultry farms and resell them in wet market and kiosks. This business has brought about a substantial source of income for her family. Currently, her husband and children also help her in this business. Everyday, her husband and children buy poultry and resell them to various restaurants, while she sells them in the market. With the experiences obtained in 8 years, she is able to improve her family's economy, and her family's monthly income is now 4,000,000VND (266USD). This time, she would like to borrow 925USD to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lý năm nay 51 tuổi,gia đình chị có 3 con đã trưởng thành.Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và tiền đi làm thuê của chồng chị . Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương, có thêm vốn chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán gà vịt. Với số vốn 1.000.000đ được vay ở vòng 1 chị đã sử dụng để đi mua gia cầm từ các trang trại về bán lẻ tại chợ và các đại lý. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi đã đem về thu nhập đáng kể cho gia đình. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị cùng các con đều tham gia buôn bán gà, vịt. Hàng ngày chồng chị và các con đi lấy hàng về bán lại cho các cửa hàng ăn, đại lý còn chị bán lẻ tại chợ. Với những kinh nghiệm kinh doanh đã được tích luỹ trong 8 năm thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng tăng lên, hiện nay tổng thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 4.000.000đ/tháng. Vòng vốn tới gia đình chị mong muốn dược vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mở rộng mô hình kinh doanh, buôn bán.

loans.use: selling poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase materials for tapestry-making purposes

loans.name: Dejana

texts.en: Dejana B. was born in 1989. She comes from Doboj where she lives with her parents. Dejana is employed and she earns 400 KM monthly. Beside her job, she re-sells cosmetics and jewelry, bags and straps. She wants to order more products and be able to offer more and get more customers. That is the reason why she has requested a loan through WWI in the amount of 1300 KM.

loans.use: To buy products for re-selling

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
Comité Jazmín, así se denomina el comité integrado por 16 mujeres del Bº Anahí de la ciudad de Capiatá, este grupo se conformó gracias a que la actual presidenta Valentina A. se acercó a la asesora en una reunión que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma quedó muy entusiasmada y logró conformar su grupo en fecha 12 de setiembre del 2008 con 16 mujeres, quienes se encuentran muy contentas trabajando con este programa.

Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades tales como:

1. Valentina A.. Confección y venta de ropas artesanales.

2. Silvina Montiel. Venta de comidas.

3. Raquel A.. Venta de ropas.

4. Rosa A.. Venta de ropas y lencerías.

5. Marina Pérez. Venta de comidas.

6. Evangelista A.. Venta de comidas y bebidas.

7. Celia González. Venta de comidas.

8. Gabriela A.. Venta de comidas.

9. Milda R.. Venta de golosinas.

10. Gladys González. Costurera.

11. Andresa R.. Venta de comidas.

12. Nilva P.. Venta de remedios refrescantes.

13. Ida E.. Venta de lencerías.

14. Ester R.. Venta de frutas y verduras.

15. Amancia Benítez. Venta de comidas.

16. Limpia P.. Venta de comidas.

Todas las integrantes del grupo demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo.

Invertirán su crédito en compra de materiales para la confección de ropas artesanales, compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, compras de lencerías, compra de ropas, compra de remedios refrescantes, compra de frutas y verduras, compra de golosinas, compra de telas e hilos para la confección de ropas.
texts.en:
Jazmín Committee is made up of 16 women of Bº Anahí from the city of Capiatá. This group was brought together because the current president Valentina A. was approached by a counselor in a meeting about the Program of the Committee of Enterprising Women. Valentina was very enthusiastic and succeeded in making her group on September 12, 2008 with 16 women, who are very happy to be working with this program.

The members of this group will use their loan for different activities including the following:

1. Valentina A.. To make and sell traditional clothes. 2. Silvina Montiel. To sell food. 3. Raquel A.. To sell clothes. 4. Rosa A.. To sell clothes and undergarments. 5. Marina Pérez. To sell food. 6. Evangelista A.. To sell food and drinks. 7. Celia González. To sell food. 8. Gabriela A.. To sell food. 9. Milda R.. To sell sweets. 10. Gladys González. Dressmaking. 11. Andresa R.. To sell food. 12. Nilva P.. To sell refreshing comforts. 13. Ida E.. To sell undergarments. 14. Ester R.. To sell fruits and vegetables. 15. Amancia Benítez. To sell food. 16. Limpia P.. To sell food.

All of the members of the group show companionship and solidarity. They attend weekly meetings and pursue activities to collects funds for the common good of the group.

They will invest their loan to buy material to make traditional clothes, ingredients to make food, undergarments, clothes, refreshing comforts, fruits and vegetables, sweets, and fabric and thread to make clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. is 37 years old and the leader of a group of six members who all live in Svay Chrum Thmey village in Kampong Chhang Province. She has five children; one is a tailor, one helps the parents' business, and the others are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Nut Sony, sell beef in the local market. Since this business is going well, they have a lot of customers and increased demand. Thus, Mrs. Srey C. decided to request a loan to purchase more beef to sell to her customers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
The Amanecer lending group was founded in January 2008 by 17 very active and mutually supportive women. They enjoy the concept of gaining access to working capital through the formation of social relations, seeing it as an opportunity to unite and stand in solidarity with one another. The group's members dedicate themselves to a variety of businesses. Basilisa, Rosaria, Andrea and Elva sell groceries; María Ángela, María Evergista, Clara, Norma, María Benita and Perla make and sell meals; Susana, Carmen, Benigna and Sofia make and sell clothing; Pabla sells jewelery; and Fermina and Felicita sell cleaning products. The group counts on its members' mutual support and confidence in one another's projects. Although each member is individually responsible for their loan, together the group fosters a strong work ethic. Amanecer's members strongly believe in social inclusion and their community has been greatly strengthened by the growth of their group, improving the quality of life for many small businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva volunteer

El grupo se constituyó en el mes de enero del año 2.008, el comité está integrado por 17 señoras activas y muy solidarias. Ellas valoran la oportunidad de obtener capital social y de trabajo mediante relaciones sociales el cual hace que las mismas sean muy unidas y solidarias. El comité se denomina Amanecer, cada una de ellas se dedican a distintas actividades comerciales como venta de comidas, artículos de limpieza, bijouterie, frutas y verduras, etc. El grupo cuenta con integrantes con una firme base en la solidaridad y confianza para el desarrollo de sus proyectos conjuntos. Las mismas valoran la oportunidad, ya que el programa les permite potenciar emprendimientos individuales y al mismo tiempo generar una relación solidaria entre ellas. Entre las asociadas se fomenta una cultura de trabajo y los pilares de la inclusión social para que el comité funcione en forma excelente. Gracias al programa dentro de la comunidad se generó una reconstrucción de lazos el cual ayudo a mejorar las condiciones de vida de muchas mujeres emprendedoras. Basilisa A. Venta de comestibles María Ángela B. Venta de comidas María Evergista B. Venta de comidas Susana V. Confección de ropas Fermina C. Venta de productos de limpieza Benigna A. Venta de lencería Felicita P. Venta de productos de limpieza Clara B. Venta de comidas Elva A. Venta de frutas y verduras Norma D. Venta de comidas Del Rosaria Otazú Despensa Carmen D. Venta de ropas María Benita B. Venta de comidas Pabla A. Venta de bijouterie Andrea M. Despensa Sofía Espínola Venta de lencería Perla López Venta de comidas

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of: ingredients for food preparation, fruit, vegetables, basic home articles such as milk, bread, sugar, meat, etc., purchase of jewelry-making supplies.

loans.name: Raheela Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Raheela baji is a 49-year-old married lady and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its holy shrines and she feels herself blissful to be a part of this city. Her husband's name is N. A. and he runs a grocery shop near the community. He has got a good reputation with people and people often come to him to buy groceries.

Raheela baji is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son runs a video game shop. Her daughter is in 5th standard. Raheela baji herself is involved in a clothes knitting business. She collects orders from her neighbors and prepares the knitted clothes and earns money. She uses her money to pay school fees for her daughter and bears her other expenses as well. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy jewelry, e.g., bangles, earrings, and necklaces for her jewelry store. Sadan baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Ghazala baji wants a loan to buy bangles for her bangle-selling business. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent E. is 36 years old and married with one child. He has a farm where he cultivates palm trees, pineapple, and cassava. Presently, he needs to do some clearing and also plant crops in the farm. Innocent is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 30,000 to hire more hands for clearing and to do some planting as well. He says thanks to Kiva and all its lenders.

loans.use: For the clearing and planting of more crops on his farm

loans.name: Unidos Podemos 1 Group

texts.en:
Maria M. is the group 1 coordinator for the Unidos Podemos (United we Can) Bank of Hope from El Seybo. Maria and her group will be taking out their 7th loan from Esperanza International. Maria has 2 children ages 17 and 11. Her goal is to make her business grow in order to support her family. She finds that her biggest challenge is to remain in good standing with her financial commitments. 

Maria raises pigs for resale. She is now expanding into raising chickens, since they are cheaper to raise and in more demand. This way she can raise an animal in a short time and sell it quickly. She hopes one day that the profits that she makes from raising animals in her backyard and sells in her community market, will be enough to buy a farm and supply meat on a larger scale. 

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchase pigs and chickens for resale

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni R. is currently in the business of selling beer and soda and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Poni is 20 years old and single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.  

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan.  The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house.

loans.name: Tes' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tes V. has been selected to be the leader by the other three members in the group loan; all the members are people living in Battambang Province.

V., age 59, earns a living by selling breakfast foods in her home. Most of her clients are villagers who live near her house. She is a widowed mother who has three children who are married. One of her sons still lives in the family home and helps to support the family by selling car wheels. V. would like a loan for her son to use as capital to buy additional wheels for sale.

The other three borrowers are:

S. is a widowed woman selling ice blocks in her home and she requests a loan to buy a used motorbike to transport fish for sale.

V. is a grocery seller, applying for a loan to increase her stock of grocery items.

L. sells fresh fish in the market and she is requesting a loan to order more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional wheels for her son's business

loans.name: Aditza Maria

texts.es: Doña Aditza es una mujer que trabaja desde su juventud, en la venta de ropa interior, tiene dieciséis años en las ventas, el cual inicio con ahorros y dinero que su esposo dio. Tiene 46 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Smit, su esposo es guarda de seguridad, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 17 años los cuales estudian, sus planes es comprar ropa de vestir y mas ropa interior para fortalecer su inventario que espera con este crédito aumentar sus ganancias y captar mas clientes. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, también espera poder ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Aditza has been working since she was a young woman, selling undergarments. She started her business sixteen years ago with her savings and money from her husband. She is 46 and lives in the Enrique Smit neighborhood. Her husband is a security guard, and they have two children, 7 and 17, both of whom are in school. She plans to buy outerwear and more undergarments so she can build up her inventory. Aditza hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and win more customers. She is grateful to AFODENIC for supporting the growth of her business. She also hopes to be able to help her children go to school so they can have a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and undergarments.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina O. has been selling maize, groundnuts and beans in Yamoransa, Cape Coast, since 1994. She travels to farming areas to buy the food supplies in large quantities, keeps them in a warehouse and then distributes them to her customers upon demand. 
Dina is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Her husband is a driver. 
Dina uses her income to pay for school fees and utilities. She will use this loan to purchase more food supplies for selling. With the profits from her expanded business, Dina plans to put up another building.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies

loans.name: Hongorzul

texts.en:
Hongorzul H. is 31 years old. She is married and is the mother of two daughters. Her family lives in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter, Anujin, is 7 and attends an elementary school. The youngest is only 9 months old.

In 2003, Hongorzul and her husband, Undrah, opened an internet center and a cafe near her home. To increase her business income, she moved her business to a location downtown and switched from a cafe to a pub. Her monthly income has increased as a result of the good location, although her rent is dramatically higher.

Hongorzul is a humble and hard-working person who wishes to have a big family with many children. She says "My family had been living with my parents for many years. Only in the last two years, has my family has been living on our own. I really want to have my own condominium. My husband and I are planning to take out a mortgage from XacBank (Kiva's partner microfinance institution). We are working hard to save for a down payment."

With this loan, Hongorzul will pay her business rent for next 6 months.

loans.use: To pay her business rent for next six months.

loans.name: Oluwabumi

texts.en: Oluwabumi is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She has been a fashion designer since 2001. She is single without a child and she is 31 years old. Oluwabumi hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She is indeed grateful.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel T. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Rachel owns and operates a service-based business, primarily providing manicure and pedicure services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rachel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven B. is 37, married and lives in Siem Reap Province. Her husband works in construction. They have four children who are all in school.  To earn a living, Ven B. raises many pigs in a stall behind her house. She normally sells all her mature pigs for slaughter three or four months after she begin feeding them. Because raising pigs is a very profitable business for her family, Ven B. requests a loan to use as capital to purchase pig food and additional small pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and additional small pigs to raise

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita is 32 years old and is a resident of Barangay Binarzang, Quirino, Isabela. She is happily married to Jomar, a simple farmer. They have been married for two years but do not yet have children. They hope that someday they will be able to start a family. This dream inspires them more than anything else to work hard.

Since their marriage, Genita has maintained a general store. She and her husband are working hard, not only to meet their daily needs, but also to save for their future family. At present, Genita would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise for her store. She hopes to obtain a loan of 10,000 PHP to use toward the growth and progress of her business.

loans.use: To use toward the growth and progress of her business.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a married mother of four school-aged children. For the past year she has been selling used clothes to support her household. She relies on the income from this business to buy food and pay the utility bills. She is requesting a loan to inject more capital into the business to purchase further bales of used clothes. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi and mostly sells her goods through hawking. Yaa hopes to make a good income and set aside some savings to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Magfirat

texts.en:
Magfirat U. is 42 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. To support her family, Magfirat is selling clothing for kids. She has been in this business for two years. During these years, she has gained experience in choosing goods of good quality that meet the requirements of clients with various levels of income. 

The business is very stable and that allows Magfirat to improve the living standards of her family. Magfirat has been working with IMON for more than two years. She managed her previous loans with accuracy and performed all the payment in a timely manner. 

Today Magfirat requests a $800 loan in order to expand her inventory for selling. Magfirat would like to thank everyone supporting her and will ensure that she’ll pay the loan in time. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to expand inventory

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro de ocupación pequeño agricultor y productor de leche, la que  comercializa con Pil Andina, para su posterior transformación en productos derivados del mismo (queso, yogurt, etc.), la esposa es su principal apoyo en el trabajo que desempeña; tiene 2 hijos 1 en colegio, viven en casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Tipampa Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para poder aumentar la producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el  crédito anterior fue cancelado puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Genaro.
texts.en:
Genaro is a small farmer and milk producer. He sells the milk in Pil Andina to be made later into dairy products (cheese, yogurt, etc.). His wife is a great help to him in his work. They have two children. One is in school. They live in their own house, which is in the Tipampa Achacachi community in the Omasuyos province (three hours from the city of La Paz). The loan is to buy a dairy cow of medium quality to be able to increase milk production and increase family income. This is his second loan with IMPRO. He repaid his previous loan punctually. The completed evaluation shows that Genaro is qualified for the loan he is soliciting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel K. is 32 years old and is single. He is an entrepreneur who lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda where he has a photo-studio and a cafeteria plus movies to rent. His business is open from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day and he has operated his business successfully for several years.

Samuel is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing some new computers and other new accessories to attract more customers to his business.

Through accessing this loan, Samuel hopes to earn more profit, which will help him to set aside money to buy his own house.

loans.use: To buy additional computers and equipment

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.fr:
Monsieur Hamadi D. est un homme marié de 39 ans et père de 7 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants à Flaba, un village situé à 14 km de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Hamadi abandonna l’école coranique (qu’il fréquentait) à l’âge de 15 ans pour des activités agricoles au profit de ses parents. Quelques années plus tard il commença les activités génératrices de revenus pendant les périodes mortes. Aujourd’hui, ce sont ces activités économiques qui ont pris le pas sur l’agriculture. Depuis maintenant 6 ans, Monsieur Hamadi D. exerce les activités d’achat et de vente de céréales (mil, maïs, fonio, riz etc).  
Cette activité est  menée au village et une partie est vendue dans le marché de Bougouni les jours de foires.
Dans le souci d’agrandir son entreprise, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son troisième prêt individuel, après avoir bien remboursé les deux  prêts précédents.
Ce nouveau  prêt servira à acheter des sacs de céréales petit à petit. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Bougouni auprès des producteurs et effectue sa vente en détail, en gros et au comptant à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Monsieur Hamadi D. envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir davantage son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamadi D. is a 39-year-old man and the father of seven children. He resides with his wife and children in Flaba, a village located 14 km from the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). At age 15, Mr. Hamadi dropped out of Koran school (which he used to attend) for farm work, to his parents’ benefit. A few years later, he started doing revenue-generating work during the slow periods. Today, his commercial work has surpassed farming. For six years now, he has been in business buying and selling grains (millet, corn, fonio, rice, etc.) This business operates in town, and some of the goods are sold at the Bougouni marketplace when the fair takes place. Concerned about expanding his enterprise, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, with which he is now on his third individual loan after having repaid the two previous ones. This new loan will be used to buy sacks of grain a little at a time. Supplies are gotten from producers from villages surrounding Bougouni. And sales are made in cash at the retail level to customers composed of retailers and consumers. He envisions realizing a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA. With the profits, he envisions expanding his enterprise further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon G. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has eight school-aged children. Corazon owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
