Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus tres hijos.
La señora Viviana trabaja como empleada en una ladrillería de su zona, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de el muro perimetral de su vivienda y darle así mayor seguridad a sus pertenencias. 
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Viviana C. lives in her own home with her three children in the Llojeta region on the west side of La Paz. Viviana works in a brick-making company in her area and supports her family with the income she earns. The loan she is requesting is for the construction of a wall on the edge of her home which will secure her belongings. The socioeconomic analysis for her business is favorable and she qualifies for this loan, the second that she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building a wall in her home

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a focused, hard-working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her business profitable. She is a LAPO client because of our commitment to improve lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is married, has five children and is 47 years old. Esther makes a living selling groceries, foodstuffs and drinks in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has applied for a loan for NGN 100,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Dionita

texts.en:
Dionita S. is from the village of Sta. Barbara. She is 41 years old. Dionita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Dionita owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Dionita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dionita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Dionita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a small businessman from Pavlograd. He has been in the confectionery sales business for only 4 months. He likes working with this type of merchandise and always offers only high quality products to his customers. Alexander makes about 5,000 grivnyas in profit each month.

Alexander is seeking a 6,000 grivnya loan to fix the car that he uses for transportation of merchandise from wholesalers to his vending location. It will facilitate his trade and help him meet clients’ demand. Alexander is hoping to further grow and develop his venture and reach self-sustainability in the future.

loans.use: To do some repairs on his vehicle

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Mrs. Math T. is 60 years old and the mother of six children. She currently stays at home to care for her children and to cook food for her family. She relies on the income from her husband’s fishing and from her sons who work in construction.

Recently, her husband is not able to catch more fish because he lacks essential accessories and some of his existing equipment is ruined. Therefore, Math T. requested a loan which will allow her husband to buy a fishing boat as well as to repair his broken equipment so as to resume his fishing activity.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for her husband as well as to repair broken equipment

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Phen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who all live in Melong Khang Cheung village in the Takeo province make up this village bank loan. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Phalla P. is a farmer who owns 1.4 hectares on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. On this farm, she now faces a small problem because she needs to plow the field; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to plow her field. 

Her husband, Mr. Kheiv Sameourn, is a construction worker. Mrs. Phalla P. is 29 and the mother of two children who are both attending the local school. 

Mrs. Ing Rotha, who is a group guarantor, is also presented in the picture with her village bank members.

loans.use: To hire laborers to plow her field

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 50 years old, is a rice farmer. She is married to Antonio, who is also a farmer. She currently owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) rice field.

Marilyn said that right now, her income from the farm is too small because farm inputs are too expensive and during harvest, the price of the rice decreases. But she is determined to earn from her farm so she does her best to make it productive.

Marilyn would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 which she will use to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan G. de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

El padre de Juan tenía el sueño de tener su propio asadero de pollo. Juan con los pocos ahorros que tenía decidió hacer realidad el sueño de su padre comprando un pequeño asadero. 

Ahora el tiene un local alquilado con un empleado trabajando y su horario es de 09:00 am hasta las 21:00 pm. En su asadero vende pollos enteros con ensalada y colas a $ 9.00. Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos, bebidas y víveres para su asadero de pollos. 

En el futuro quiere comprar su propia casa y hay adecuar el asadero.
texts.en:
Juan G. is 25 years old and lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil, Ecuador. His house is made of cement and has basic services such as water and electricity. Juan's father always wanted to have his own chicken roasting business. Using the few savings he had, Juan decided to make his father's dream a reality by buying a small roaster. He now rents a space and works from 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM along with one other employee. In his small restaurant he sells whole roasted chickens with a salad and a drink for $9.00. With this loan he wants to buy chickens, drinks, and other supplies for his business. In the future he wants to buy his own house and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens, drinks

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is widowed and a mother of one. She rears chicken on her farm to earn a living. She sells eggs, chickens and chicks to her neighbors and friends who know about her business. She also runs a retail shop to earn enough money to support her family since she is the breadwinner.

She has been saving her money with her group in Faulu Kenya named Kasa Self Group. The group guarantees loans for its members. She has previously taken out and successfully repaid three loans from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, to expand her business. She has requested a loan for 60,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy chicks and chicken feed. She hopes to grow her business to a wholesale outlet in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
El  Señor. FRANCISCO JOSE B., Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua.
El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y   estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado ocho  créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los ocho créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de medicamentos para sus dos hijos pequeños que se encuentran mal de salud.
texts.en:
El Señor. FRANCISCO JOSE B., Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua. El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado ocho créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los ocho créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de medicamentos para sus dos hijos pequeños que se encuentran mal de salud.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar mediacamentos para sus hijos que se encuentran enfermo

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La  señora Lourdes, es de San Estanislao, tiene casa propia.
Es propietaria de una tienda de ropas, que esta ubicada en el mercado de la ciudad, con 10 años de funcionamiento, con clientela formada y un buenas ventas, ya que tiene buenos precios y calidad sus mercaderìas, tambien el buen trato con los clientes.
Desea ampliar su local para poder tener màs variedad de ropas y otras cosa que los clientes solicitan para ello queire obtener el préstmo y así invirtir en la compra de ropas.
texts.en:
La señora Lourdes is from San Estanislao and owns her home. She is the proprietor of a clothing store, which is located in the plaza of the city. The store has regular customers, good sales, and has been open for 10 years. Also, la señora Lourdes takes good care of her customers and offers very reasonable prices and high quality of merchandise. She wishes to expand her premises and offer more variety of clothing and other things that her customers request. She would like to invest this loan in clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jeans, T-shirts, sundresses, blouses, and other items

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is from the village of Kiburiao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is a 68 year old widow. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2006, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 47 years old and married with five children. Chantal’s husband is a driver and Chantal herself is a businesswoman. Both of them work for their family profit. Chantal owns a small business selling various styles of clothes in her living place. She employs one person from her community as a helper and the hours of her business are ten hours per day except on Saturday. This is her sixth year of successful business operation.

Chantal is now requesting a second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing bales of clothes. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her earn more profit. With this profit, Chantal will be able to renovate her house and save money for her future.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na V. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She works very hard to support her family in Kantuot Thum village in Takeo province. Mrs. Na V. is also a rice seller in the local market. Mrs. Na V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to enlarge her business. Her husband, Mr. Darith Vong, is a construction worker who makes a small salary to help support his family. The couple has a a one-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more rice to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel L. is from the town of Surallah. She is 36 years old. Hazel is single. Hazel owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also manages a farm where she plants and harvests rice crops. Hazel has been engaged in her business for over five years.

Hazel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Hazel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Hazel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell  and also for farm inputs for her rice farm. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Hazel from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing livestock to raise & sell; inputs for rice farm

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena C. is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd. She is 39 years old. Elena is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making dried fish for sale in the community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elena is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been operating her mixed farm for over thirty years in the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, milk, beans, millet, vegetables and tea leaves, which she sells to the Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. She also operates a business selling both second-hand and new clothes. Mary is 52 years old. She is married and has been blessed with six children, all now adults. One of her children is currently attending school.

Mary has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, after she successfully completed her previous loans. She has requested this loan of 90,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow and expand her cereal business by increasing stock. She hopes to be able to provide for the basic needs of her family with the proceeds from this loan.  

In the future, she plans to start a big hardware store and to buy a transportation truck.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and to expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Ronta

texts.en:
Ronta L. is 37 years old. He is married to Parane L. and he is a father of four school-going children. 

Ronta farms his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last eight years. He learned about KADET Ltd. through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his second loan; he is planning to spend twenty-five thousand Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his five-acre wheat farm. 

He is anticipating buying some farm machinery with the profit from his expanded farming activity.

He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to spend twenty five thousands to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his five acre wheat farm.

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara B. is the leader of the group, she is 22 and married. Her husband is a farmer. 4 years ago she used to raise money by selling foodstuff, and then she changed her business and began to sell glass-ware. Gulnara’s brother helps her run this business. Now they have managed to purchase a lot (size-four hundred parts). The loan's purpose is to buy more glass-ware for further resale. In the future she is planning to give birth to a child, to obtain a stall in the “Dordoi” market, and to support her parents materially.

Gulgaky J., 31 is  married. Together with her spouse, who is a construction worker they bring up three children (the son, a schoolboy and 2 daughters). The family began their own business 3 years ago At first they have used to breed cattle, then they built a shop next to their house and started to sell foodstuff. During these years they have managed to purchase a pavilion. The loan purpose is to increase commodity circulation. In the future the family is planning to build a house, again to do farm animal husbandry, to obtain a car and a flat.

Aisha O., 51is married. Together with her husband, who is recovering his health after an operation, they have two children (a son and a daughter). The son supports his parents by working as a builder. Today Aisha keeps house, but she wants to start her own business by selling foodstuff. For this reason she needs a loan. In the future she is planning to buy a flat, to plant trees and to build a temporary construction. 

Orolkan S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 42 and married to a man whose profession is a cattle-farm worker. The couple have five children, almost all of them are school pupils. Two years ago the clients had bought 3 farm animals, one of them was resold, then they bought 10 more livestock animals, 2 calves and had managed to earn 2000 soms. Today this business is making profit to the family. During this time they have purchased a temporary house. The loan purpose is to buy 3 livestock animals. In the future the family wants to obtain a bus, to build a big house, and give education to their children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy more glass-ware

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid B. is 43 years old and lives in the town of Masidi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is divorced and has seven children, six of whom are currently in school. He makes a living by selling products made of clay, and has been in this line of work for more than 10 years. He also owns houses which he rents out.  

To help expand his business, Rashid has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use this loan to expand his business, increase his profits and buy more food for his family. In the future, he hopes to earn enough money to be financially independent.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Wilson Chege

texts.en:
Wilson has been farming in Olkalou town since 1996. He is 32 years old and married to Mirriam Wanjiru. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to plant more vegetables in his farm.

In the future, Wilson hopes to build rental houses to increase and diversify his income.

loans.use: To plant more vegetables on his farm.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy G. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Juvy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits, junk foods and instant noodles in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum N., 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. N. sells frui, earning an income of about USD 15 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4 per day. One of her children is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

N. has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more fruit to resell. In the future, she would like to use aN. additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. N.'s husband appears in the photograph because N. was not available.

loans.use: buy more fruit to resell

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante ella vende todos los días desayuno y almuerzo, ella trabaja desde las 05:00am hasta las 03:00 pm,la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo y de esta forma sacan adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su negocio y de esta forma sale adelante.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “My Peru” Community Bank. This bank is located in the Cusco District, which is in the province and department of Cusco.
The member’s name is Mrs. Roxana. She is 28 years old, has a partner and three children. Her daily activities vary. With her restaurant business she sells breakfast and lunch every day. She works from 5:00am until 3:00pm. She works alongside her husband in order to help her family progress.
She is asking for a loan in order to help her business grow.
She is thankful to be part of this dream of being part of the Community Bank and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: This member is asking for this loan in order to invest in her restaurant and help her family progress.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Aty Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio san Isidro de la ciudad de  Caacupé. 
La Presidenta, la Sra. Carmen S. vive con su marido e hijos, es una mujer muy trabajadora, invierte su crédito en su negocio.
Posee una pequeña confitería, está muy conforme con el apoyo brindado por la Fundación y por su intermedio a kiva.
Ya que gracias a ello su negocio va creciendo cada vez más, de esa forma logra mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Solicita nuevamente el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de confites como harina, azúcar, levaduras y otros.
texts.en: The women of this committee are from the neighbourhood, San Isidro, of the city of Caacupe.  The president, Carmen S., lives with her husband and her children.  She is a hard working woman that invests her loans into her business.  She owns a small pastry shop and is very satisfied with the help provided by the Foundation and Kiva.  Thanks to them, her business has been continually growing.  As a result, she has been able to improve her and her family's quality of life.  She is applying for a new loan to purchase raw materials for making baked goods, such as flour, sugar, yeast, and other ingredients.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for baking such as sugar, flour, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, de 57 años, se separó de su mujer hace 20 años, pero vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos a los cuales cuida, y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). El trabajo que le permitió darle el sustento económico a su familia es el trasporte público. Hace18 años que labora en la empresa de trasporte “Santa Rosa” cubriendo las rutas La Merced-Oxapampa, y según menciona le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque puede conocer nuevos lugares y diferentes personas, ya que a veces cubre las rutas a la ciudad de Pozuzo-La Merced; y aunque a veces le resulta un poco cansado, él, no se rinde pues según sus propias palabras “todo trabajo tiene su lado bueno y malo”. Ahora planea acondicionar su casa para poder comenzar con el negocio de alquiler de cuartos, ya dio el primer paso con el pintado de las paredes de los cuartos y, según afirma le falta muy poco. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y está segura que podrá salir adelante con la ayuda de su banco comunal, donde le enseñan a proyectarse y ahorrar. De obtener el crédito podrá comprar los materiales necesarios para arreglar el baño de su casa, y de esa manera comenzar con su nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 57 years old.  He separated from his wife 20 years ago but he lives with his 3 children who he cares for and educates in his own home, located in the town of La Merced (central Peruvian jungle).

The work which has enabled Gerardo to financially support his family is providing public transport services.  He has been working for the "Santa Rosa" transport company for 18 years, covering La Merced - Oxapampa routes and he tells us that he likes his work a lot because he gets to know new places and different people since he sometimes covers the Pozuzo - La Merced routes.  Although his work is sometimes a little tiring, he does not give up because, in his own words, "every job has its good points and its bad points".

Gerardo is planning to remodel his home so that he can begin to rent out rooms.  He has already taken the first step in painting the walls of the rooms and he says that he doesn't have much left to do.

This is Gerardo's eighth loan from MFP and he is certain that he will be able to get ahead with the help of his community bank where they teach him to plan and save.  Gerardo will use his loan to buy the material he needs to fix up his bathroom and, in this way, begin his new project.

loans.use: To buy material to remodel his bathroom

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofía; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de choclo, ella vende en el mercado en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un puesto para poder vender el choclo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa.          

                  
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" ["Hard-working Mothers"] community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs Sofia. She is 42, lives with her partner, and has 6 children. She shares her daily chores with her business selling corn. She sells on the street in the market from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She wants to have a stall for selling her corn; she wants to expand her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials to fix her house.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: she is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials to repair her home.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey P. was born in 1954 and she lives in Samphli village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3.50-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family and she also sells noodles in her local village.

She has a problem with the rice field, because it is time to grow the rice. So, to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Srey P. is seeking a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the rice field. She is a widow with two children, two of whom are employed in garment factories.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the rice field.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José, cuenta con su negocio que es una pulpería. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se siente muy contento. Su actividad está ubicada en su vivienda. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitar diferentes productos, por lo que se siente muy contento de ofrecer este medio de vida. El solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan entre otros productos que le solicitan.
texts.en:
Pedro José's business is a small grocery store.  This is not the first time that he has taken out a loan and he feels very happy.  His business is located in his home.  His customers come to him and request different products.  He is very happy to be in this line of work.

Pedro José is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, bread and other products that his customers are asking him for.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda is currently in the business of selling bread and bedsheets.  She is 31 years old and is married to a policeman.   They have 7 children, 5 of them are in school.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bread and bedsheets to sell.  Finda hopes to pay her children's school tuition with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more bread and bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Gulayon.  She is 61 years old.  Aida is widowed and has four children.  To make a living, Aida owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling native nito products to local businesses and community members.  Aida has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.  Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional raw materials for her nito weaving business.  This loan will be Aida's seventh loan from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the daily needs of the family

loans.use: To purchase materials for her nito weaving business.

loans.name: Byekwaso

texts.en: Byekwaso Asad is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 42 years old and married with 10 children, 6 of whom attend school. Asad has a milling machine in Kyaburyenzibwa that grinds products such as maize, millet, sorghum, cassava, etc. Since there aren't many milling machines in his area, Asad is able to pocket a profit of 40,000 UGX daily. In addition, he is also involved in agriculture and tailoring, working closely with his wife and children. All of Asad's businesses are self-initiated and his hardworking nature has enabled them to grow. His future plan is to financially grow his business and to have a sociable family. Asad needs a loan to be able to buy more seedlings for agriculture and more clothes to be sold and sewn for the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting and clothes to sell for the Easter season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old man, engaged to be married,  from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and one sibling. He has worked in the construction field for more than 12 years, and in 2000, he started running his own business. He is especially talented at completing drywall projects. He works closely with multiple construction projects and he also manages houses in his village and its surroundings. 

He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was very satisfied with the results. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy construction tools and supplies because his business is growing and he's planning to work on bigger projects.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and supplies.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Gladis es socia del banco comunal La Dalilas, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 68 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Son 3 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene una bodega en su casa, la cual atiende con la ayuda de su hija y su esposo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 kilos de pescado seco, 3 kilos de fariña, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 2 bolsas de detergente, 1 caja de leche chica, 1 bolsa de fideos, 1 caja de aceite chico y 1 bolsa de lejía, 1 caja de mayonesa.
Todos estos años se ha dedicado a mantener a flote su negocio, con mucha dedicación, quiere tener una vejez tranquila sin depender de ninguno de sus hijos, no quieren ser una carga para ellos.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of 'Las Dalilas' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 68 years old, married, and has four children.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  She has a small grocery store in her home and she serves in her store with the help of her daughter and husband.

Gladis will use her new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy 10 kilos of dried fish, 3 kilos of flour, 1 sack of sugar, 2 bags of detergent, 1 box of milk, 1 bag of noodles, 1 box of oil, 1 bag of bleach and 1 box of mayonnaise. 

Over the years, Gladis has worked hard to keep her business afloat.  She has worked with a lot of commitment.  She would like to enjoy a relaxed old age without being dependent on any of her children.  She does not want to be a burden to them.

loans.use: to buy milk, flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A. is now 56 years old and married with six adult-aged children. Rosita is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 8,000 per month. 

Rosita is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase corn seeds and pay for services to plant corn. She grows corn and has been doing this for 25 years.

In the future, Rosita hopes to produce a large quantity of corn and a make a higher income to supplement their daily basic needs and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and to pay for services to plant the corn

loans.name: 08.02.39 Thiệu Toán - Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Ngan is 19 years old.  She is married and does not have children.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.  

Ngan is the group leader of the 08.02.39 Thieu Toan solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.  She works in the agricultural sector, raising poultry and cattle.  Ngan has been involved in her business for less than a year.  The main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  This will be Ngan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  The profit she generates will be reinvested into her business and used to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby chickens and pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 2 &3 Group

texts.en:
Magaly is the coordinator of her group El Sol Sale Para Todos (The Sun Shines For Everyone) 2 & 3. They are located in the city of Hato Mayor in a  small and rural community.  

Magaly is a single mother who makes her home in a simple structure with 5 of her 7 children.  Two of her children are already grown.  She says that her most difficult challenge right now is improving her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy working and running her business.

Magaly started her business with her first Esperanza loan almost 6 years ago.  She is now receiving her 11th loan.  Magaly sells clothing.  With this loan, she will invest in her business by buying more products to sell such as slippers and blouses.  With every loan she has been able to expand her inventory with many different products.  

Magaly dreams of having a store, of being able to proviD. for her younger children to attend university, and of finishing her house.  Her business profits will be reinvest and by a getting better income, she will be saving more to reach her dreams and many other projects she wants to do to generate more income.

Magaly wants to finish building her house and make it a safer structure.  She is always working because work is one of her favorite things to do.  Magaly and her group thank you for your help in achieving their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: to buy slippers and blouses

loans.name: Katya Carolina

texts.es: La señora Katya Carolina es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace 1 año cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada  donde ofrece variedad de artículos como lo es ropa en diferentes tallas, zapatos, calcetines y zapatos. En este momento desea invertir en su negocio para compra de mercancía para tener mayor variedad y así sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en: Katya Carolina is a hardworking and enterprising woman. For one year she has had a business selling used clothing where she offers a variety of items, such as clothing in different sizes, shoes, and socks. She would like to invest in her business by buying merchandise so that she can have a larger variety, and that way her sales will grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Francisca Anita

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del banco comunal Miraflores del Distrito D. Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 60 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Lleva 2 años en este banco comunal, ella se dedica a brindar el servicio D. lavandería.  Francisca deciD. trabajar para estar ocupada y ayudar a su esposo y lo hace solo en su casa, son hijos ya son mayores.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 bolsas D. cemento, 1 metro D. arena, 2 varillas D. fierro y 3 planchas D. calamina transparente, todo ello para acondicionar un ambiente más amplio para su lavandería.
Se siente muy bien porque pueD. generar sus propios ingresos y comprarse lo que necesita, agradece a Manuela Ramos por todas las cosas que ha conseguido hasta este momento.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the "Miraflores" community bank, in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 60 years old, married, and has three children.

Francisca has been a member of this community bank for two years.  Her business is providing a laundry service.  She decided to work so that she could keep herself busy and help her husband.  She does her work alone, at home.  Her children are already grown up.

Francisca will use this new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy 5 bags of cement, 1 meter of sand, 2 iron rods and 3 sheets of transparent corrugated plastic in order to enlarge the area in which she carries out her laundry service.

Francisca feels very good because she is able to make her own income and buy what she needs.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the things that she has achieved up to now.

loans.use: to buy cement, corrugated plastic sheets, etc.

loans.name: Vasta

texts.en:
Vasta is a forty six year old married woman with seven children who rents a house in Kasese,Uganda. 

She has been in business for sixteen years.  She started by selling local porridge and expanded to poultry and also selling beer. Her challenge is lack of enough capital to buy feed for her poultry.   Her vision is to have two retail shops and to increase the number of birds she rears.  Vasta needs the loan facility to buy birds for rearing.

loans.use: To buy birds for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more children's shoes for his business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 32-year-old married woman with six children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.The responsibility to look after the family is vested in her and her dream is to educate her children. She has been dealing in the sale of clothes for ten years. She started this business with the savings from her hotel, a business she had run for five years. The main hardship she faces is high commodity prices. Her vision is a big shop, a permanent house, plus educating her children. Faith needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mahmadshokir

texts.ru: Махмадшокир проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается растениеводством. В основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Mahmadshokir lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 34 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in agriculture and primarily grows vegetables for sale.  Mahmadshokir has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Burton

texts.en:
Burton is a 43-year-old man, married to Jane. Together they have two children aged 5 and 16, who both go to school. His primary business is selling glassware at the busy Githurai market. He has been in this business for the past nine years. The business gives him a monthly income of KES 2,000.

This is his first loan from KADET, and it will help him purchase more stock. The anticipated profits will help him expand his business and educate his kids. 

He hopes to become a property manager and construction contractor.

loans.use: to purchase more glasses for resale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su mamá de 68 años, su compañera de vida y con un hijo.

Él se dedica desde los 12 años a la agricultura y a cuidar ganado junto con su hermano mayor. Fue su papá quien les enseñó este trabajo para que ellos tuvieran como ganarse la vida honradamente.

Don Juan tiene que trasladarse a una ciudad del oriente del país, para adquirir los insumos necesarios para realizar su trabajo. Don Juan se levanta todos los días a las 5:00 de la mañana a pastorear los animales y luego se dedica a las labores en su cultivo de maíz.

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar dos vacas de ordeño (que den leche) y cultivar maíz. De esta forma Don Juan podrá vender la leche que den estas vacas todos los días en su comunidad, y con este ingreso podrá llevarle alimento a su familia y comprar insumos agrícolas. Don Juan es el único proveedor para su familia.

Don Juan vive con su mamá, su esposa y su hijo en una casa de 4x5 metros cuadrados de adobe, con techo de láminas de metal muy viejas  y no tiene habitaciones. El sueño de Don Juan es construir una casa de ladrillo con habitaciones. Con las ganancias que obtenga de su trabajo él quiere ahorrar para hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old, lives with his 68 year old mother, his life partner and a child. 

He has been working in agriculture and livestock care for 12 years together with his older brother. It was his father who taught them this work in order that they could earn an honest living.

Juan has to travel to a city in the eastern part of the country in order to get the supplies he needs so he can do his work. Juan gets up every day at 5:00AM to graze the animals and later he works cultivating corn.

He is asking for a loan from Fundacion Campo in order to buy two dairy cows to obtain milk, and to grow corn. In this way Juan could sell the milk from the cows every day in his community and with this income could provide food to his family and buy agricultural supplies. Juan is the only provider for his family.

Juan lives with his mother, his life partner, and his child in a 4 x 5 square meter, very old, one-room adobe house, with a sheet metal roof. His dream is to build a brick house with rooms. He wants to save for his dream from the profits that he earns.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows and supplies to grow corn.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is 34 years old and has been engaged in buying and selling fruit and vegetables for four years. To improve their living conditions even more, her husband is currently working as a Security Guard in Manila. They are helping each other to achieve a comfortable life. The couple is blessed with two children, who are currently studying.


Remalyn is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy coconuts, beans, ginger, onions, and garlic as additional goods to sell. She is hoping to increase her usual income in order to provide for the needs of her children especially for their educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, beans, ginger, onions, and garlic as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang is 28 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has been living and working in the Baray district for ages. Besides cultivating seasonal crops, Mrs. Leang has operated a selling business in her community. Her business is running smoothly with many loyal customers who come to buy regularly. She sells mixed items like sweets, groceries, packaged noodles or foods, canned foods and drinks. Typically, she yields a profit of $3 USD per day by selling her products. 

Mrs. Leang has noticed that most of the villagers there have difficulties, especially when they want to husk their rice; they have to go far away from the village and take more time to transport the rice back and forth. In an attempt to generate additional profits, Mrs. Leang is seeking a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to buy a rice-husking machine and start up a new business by providing rice-husking services in and around the community. With the rest of the loan, she’ll purchase more rice to husk for selling. With her profits, she plans to fix her house partially and save some money for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy a rice-husking machine and to purchase more rice to husk for selling.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Claudia tiene 30 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Santa Lucía en el departamento de Cortes. Vive con su pareja de 8 años, Alan y tienen dos hijos de 1 y 6 años de edad. El hijo mayor asiste a la escuela. Ambos adultos trabajan en la venta de lácteos para sustentar a la familia. 

 La pareja vende lácteos y chicharrones de forma ambulante. A sus clientes, les ofrece una amplia variedad de lácteos, entre ellos: queso, quesillo, cuajada y mantequilla. Trabajan todos los días por necesidad económica. Ellos esperan que con su esfuerzo, van a poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una mejor vida y una excelente educación. 

Con su primer crédito, Doña Claudia logró aumentar su clientela y algunos empezaron a comprar exclusivamente de ella. Con el préstamo actual de L13,000,  ella va a invertir en los insumos de los lácteos y los chicharrones para poder expandir el inventario. Su trabajo se hace difícil sin tener un coche propio, pero la pareja va a dedicarse mucho a su labor para salir adelante. En un futuro muy próximo, esperan tener algún local fijo donde pueden vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Claudia, age 30, lives in the Santa Lucía village in the Cortes department.  She lives with her life partner of eight years, Alan.  They have two children, ages one and six.  The oldest child goes to school.  Both adults work selling dairy products in order to support the family.

The pair sells dairy products and “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds) in an itinerant manner.  She offers a wide variety of dairy products to her customers.  Cheese, fresh white cheese, curds, and butter are among the products that they sell.  They work every day out of financial necessity.  They hope that with their efforts they will be able to get their children ahead.  They also hope to give them a better life and an excellent education.

With her first loan Claudia managed to increase her customers, and some of them started to buy from her exclusively.  With the current loan for 13,000 lempiras she will buy supplies for the dairy products and the chicharrones in order to be able to expand her inventory.

Their work is difficult without having their own car.  However, the pair will devote themselves to working a lot in order to get ahead.  In the very near future they hope to have a fixed location where they can sell their products.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the dairy products and the chicharrones.

loans.name: Dagbegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DAGBEGNON est composé de quatre membres qui cohabitent dans la même maison. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Béatrice est celle qui a une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première  fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Béatrice est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Symphorien. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Béatrice n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Béatrice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Béatrice apporte une aide à son mari dans les diverses charges de la famille. Depuis six ans, Béatrice mène comme activité la vente de vêtements et de l'arachide grillé par le système de distribution. Béatrice s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Béatrice et les autres membres du groupe DAGBEGNON sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est de renforcer d’avantage leur activité.
texts.en: The DAGBEGNON group is composed of four members who live together in the same house. The representative of the group, named Beatrice, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of raising the level of their activity, in order to better cope with the demands of their clientele, the group is asking, for the first time, for the financial support of Alidé. Beatrice is thirty years old and is married to a driver named Symphorien. The couple has four children, all in school. Beatrice did not go to school. Beatrice lives together with her husband and children. Beatrice helps her husband with the various needs of the family. For the last six years, Beatrice has done business selling clothing and roasted groundnuts through a distribution system. Beatrice stocks up in one of Benin's markets. With the goal of strengthening their operations and better satisfying their customers, Beatrice and the other members of the DAGBEGNON group are seeking a first loan from Alidé. Their ambition is to strengthen their operations even more.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Shikamana Group

texts.en:
Zibora is the facilitator of the Shikamana group. Zibora and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Zibora and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Zibora takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. With income from her maize sales, Zibora will save for future use and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Shikamana group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Zibora with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married and blessed with three children who are in school. He has been practicing both crop and dairy farming for the last twenty years to support his family. He has employed two people to assist him manage his business. He is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a married man living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He has 2 children, ages 18 and 16.

Leonardo is a seaweed farmer. Through this business, he is able to provide for his family's needs and send his children to school. Leonardo works hard to improve his income and continue supporting his family.

Leonardo has requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, nylon and other materials. Leonardo plans to make improvements to their house soon.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, nylon and other materials

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old, married to Mary, and they are blessed with one child aged 12 years. Peter has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 10,000 after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Wangninangbe-As Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINANGBE-AS est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Lucie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Lucie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Lucie est âgée de 26 ans et vit au Bénin. Lucie est mariée à un peintre du nom de Christian. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Lucie collecte des bouteilles vides qu'elle revend depuis quinze ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Lucie vend également des crevettes. Lucie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pierrette ensemble avec les membres du  groupe la WANGNINANGBE-AS, sollicite un premier  crédit auprès de  ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des bouteilles vides et des crevettes.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: My name is Mercedes H. and I own a store that sells popular products such as basic food staples and household items.  I also sell toys for children.  I have had my business for two years, and my son helps me attend to clients and run the store. With the income from my business I am able to support my family.  My clients are all very loyal. My store is located near a public school in Tegucigalpa.  With a loan, I hope to increase my inventory so that I will be able to earn enough money to support my family and pay for my sons education.

loans.use: To purchase plastic toys, churros, soft drinks and ice cream cones.

loans.name: Maria Expectación

texts.en:
Mrs. C. y T. is a grocery story owner on the west side of town. She would like to have more inventory to offer her clients a greater variety of products. She says, "I would like your support for my little store. I need more merchandise to sell. I need more household basics, but I can't do it alone. I need your help and I think that with $1200, I can have my store well stocked."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. C. Y T. es propietaria de una tienda de abarrotes en el poniente de la ciudad ella desea contar con mas inventario para ofrecerle a sus clientes mas variedad de productos. "Quiero que me apoyen con mi tiendita necesito mas mercancía para vender me faltan muchos artículos indispensables para la casa, pero yo sola no puedo requiero de su atención creo que con $1,200.00 dlls tendré bien surtida mi tienda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov S. is married with 3 children and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by purchasing second-hand clothes from the market and selling them at retail. This kind of business can generate about $4/day in revenue, while her husband who works in a private company can help and maintain the family's savings. Meanwhile, two of her children are enrolled in school and another one learns in a nearby hair salon. S. hopes the loan will help to expand her business by purchasing more clothes due to a great demand from her clients. In the future, she would like to own a stand at the market so that it's easier for her to sell.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes to expand a business

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by six women of the Regroupement des Balayeuses de Ndayane association, led by Madame Louise N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The 'balayeuses' or sweepers number 65 members and are divided into four smaller groups. They often suffer from the lack of financial resources. The sweepers take charge of improving living conditions by regularly sweeping the streets and main boulevard of their neighborhood, because the local government does not provide garbage collection services. With time, this citizen practice of taking responsibility for improving local living conditions has spread like an oil stain to the surrounding localities.

Objective: To support these women in their retail trading activities.

Specific objective: To provide the members of this group with the resources they need to strengthen their trading activities, allowing them to continue their neighborhood cleaning services as well.

Brief description of the activities to be financed by the loan: The members of this group engage in retail sale of all types of common consumption items [i.e. food products, clothing, etc.]. With the loan funds, the group will buy such products in bulk and resell them among the members of their association and to other customers, and the profits earned from all these transactions will be used to repay the loan and to reinforce the purchasing power of the group.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

« Contexte du projet :Les balayeuses sont au nombre de 65 membres reparties dans quatre petits groupement, elles souffrent le plus souvent de la rareté des ressources financières. Les balayeuses prennent en charge la gestion pratique du cadre de vie a travers des actions de balayages périodique des rues et boulevard de leur quartier, faute d un système régulier de ramassage des ordures par les autorités locale. Avec le temps cette forme citoyenne de prendre en charge la gestion du cadre vie a fait tache d huile et sera repartis dans les environnants.

l’objectif : Appuyer les femmes dans leurs activités de petits commerces.

Objectif spécifique : appuyer les femmes membres à bien assurer leurs propres activités a fin de periniser le nettoiement périodique des zones ciblées

Bref description des activités à mener avec le prêt: Les femmes membres achètent et revendent tout matériel de consommation courante Avec le fond prêté le groupement achètera des produits a revendre entre membres et a d autres demandeurs et les bénéfices issu de toutes ses transactions servira aux remboursements et aux renforcement des pouvoirs d achat des femmes membres..»

loans.use: Bulk purchase of goods for retail sale

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana started her business selling bedding supplies after a relative shared an opportunity with her. She is able to buy inventory directly from a manufacturer and resell it in her store which is located in a mall facility. Svetlana has a reputation as a hard-working, honest entrepreneur. Her business helps support her family of four. She and her husband, Sergei, have two children who are in their 20’s.

Svetlana’s goal is to continue developing her business and increase her sales. She has requested a loan of $1000 to expand significantly by opening a new sales location. This is Svetlana’s fourth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. It will be exciting to see where Svetlana’s business will go in the future.

loans.use: Open new sales facility

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N. owns Debby’s Salon where she has run her hair styling business for 12 years. Her salon sits about 75’ back from the busy highway. On busy highways, buildings tend to sit back. That area between the highway and the buildings is always filled with activity. People cooking on small charcoal stoves, matatoo’s, taxis, stopping to drop off and pick up new customers, boda boda’s, motorbikes, waiting to take paying customers and just a constant flow of people.
Deborah’s business has a good location and a good clientele. As with many hair salons all over the world, it is place for women to visit, sit with their babies and pass the time. 
With her loan, Deborah plans to buy a generator. This is a big and important purchase, as electricity goes out quite regularly. Clients will tend to go to places that have back-up power.  She has a well stocked salon and is a very welcoming individual.

loans.use: Deborah plans to use her loan to buy a generator, so when the electricity goes out her clients won't be without a hair dryer.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Mr.  Emmanuel B. is 42 years old, married, with 7 children.He buys rubber latex from different villages and sells to factory .Rubber latex is use for the production of plastics,slippers etc.He has been a LAPO client since 2004. Mr. B. needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more rubber latex for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of rubber latex for sale

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. Phun P., 28, is married with one young child and works with her husband selling charcoal and coconut in the town of Kampong Cham, Cambodia. To transport their goods to town they use a motorcycle with a trailer attached to use as their business' transportation. On average, this couple earn about $11 each day in revenue. Mrs. Phun P. hopes to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of coconut to meet her growing demand. She is looking forward to raising her income and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase in a large quantity of coconut to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.name: Narirurwe West B Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Jamawa K.. She has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase the stock in the shop. Jamawa is 29 years old and is married. Her husband has a butcher shop. She has 4 children ranging in age from 3.5 to 13 and only 2 of them go to school.

Each week, Jamawa makes approximately 70000 UGX (about $40) profit. She is requesting a loan so that she can earn more money to be able to buy a weighing scale. In the past, Jamawa had a loan from BRAC Uganda for 100000 UGX (about $60) in order to invest in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jamawa is joined in her small group by Fatina B., Sisirsa K., Aidah N., Fazira N., and Safina Nangobis. Fatina B. has a grocery store and wants to increase the inventory. Sisirsa K. is currently selling sugarcane and wants a loan to purchase more sugarcane to sell. Aidah N. operates a retail shop and wants to buy more items to sell. Fazira N. runs a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to increase the oils and other items for sale in the salon. Safina N. sells charcoal and wants to use the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To add more stock in the retail shop

loans.name: Hanifa's Tujitume Group

texts.en:
Hanifa is 34 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 15,11 and 7 years old. Hanifa owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who run businesses dealing in food vending, business and trading.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ni Luh Deli

texts.id:
Being a cow breeder is an activity is not left out of Niluh Deli. Her husband also helps in this activity. Collecting grass for the calves is one of the works frequently performed by her husband. They mutually agree to cooperate, that is one work that needs to be attended to. Everyday at 6 am already busy providing grass feed which is readied for early evening; while mid-day they are left in the yard to seek their own food, approaching night at 6 pm again busy feeding the calves. This activity is carried out so that the calves reared will be fat and healthy, finished green supplies is not lacking in the village but need to seek in the area surrounding the village, income maybe little nevertheless can aid and increase income for the family.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Menjadi peternak sapi adalah suatu kegiatan yang tidak pernah ditinggalkan Niluh Deli.Suami juga membatu dalam usaha ini.Mencari rumput untuk sapinya adalah suatu pekerjaan yang sering dilakukan oleh suami Deli.Mereka sepakat untuk saling kerjasama, itu adalah suatu pekerjaan yang sudah ditekuninya. Setiap hari pukul 6.00 pagi sudah sibuk memberi makan rumput yang sudah dipersiapkan sore harinya.sedang untuk siang hari dibiarkan di kebunnya untuk mencari makan sendiri.menjelang malam hari pukul 6.00 sore juga sibuk untuk memberi makan sapinya. Kegiatan ini dilakukan dengan harapan sapi peliharaannya bisa gemuk dan sehat.persediaan pakan hijauan tidak pernah kekurangan didesanya asal mau mencarinya di daerah sekitar desanya. penghasilan memang sedikit namun bisa untuk membantu dan menambah pendapatan bagi keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase calves and supplies (Membeli anak sapi dan pakan)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary O. is 49 years of age; she lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She is married with 5 children, and she sells frozen items such as chicken and foods, which she learned form her sister and started 2005. She is asking for a loan of $875 to enable her buy more frozen items for sales to improve her business. She has been a LAPO client for 2 years as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more frozen items such as chicken and food for sales

loans.name: Gulbibi

texts.ru:
Gulbibi is a widow, she is 46 years old and has two children. Her oldest son is working in Russia and sends money home from time to time. She works in a convenience store. Just this year she has married off her daughter. She used all the money from the business towards the wedding, to buy gifts and organize the event. Right now she is alone and with no help from anyone, she has turned to MicroInvest to help grow her business. She is satisfied with the loan terms and will be able to save money made from her business for any unforeseen expenses in the future.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гулбиби вдова, ей 46 лет у нее двое детей. Старший сын находиться в России на заработке , он время от времени присылает ей деньги , она торгует в магазине продовольственными товарами. В этом году она выдала дочь замуж. С бизнеса то что, было, использовала на свадьбу дочери: покупка приданного, проведение мероприятий. Теперь, когда она одна и не кому ей помочь, она обратилась в «Микроинвест» для восстановления бизнеса, ей понравились условия кредитования и в будущем она может отложить с бизнеса на «черный день» и другие не предвиденные расходы.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima Sharapova lives in the Gissar district with her family. She is married and has four children. She is a teacher at a Gissar secondary school. Besides teaching, Fotima supports her family by selling food products. She has a small store near her home. Fotima wants to increase product turnover by obtaining a loan. It will help her raise her income. Fotima plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Шаропова Фотима проживает в районе Гиссар. Живет со своей семьей. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Работает учителем в средней школе Гиссара. Кроме того , чтобы обеспечить семью она занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет небольшой магазинчик рядом с домом . Хочет увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита. Это поможет ей увеличить доход . Погасить кредит Фотима планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. S. Thi Nguyen is 56 years old. Prior to joining the Fund, her family’s finances faced many difficulties due to the unfornate passing of her husband while the children are still young. After joining the Fund, she has boldly borrowed money to invest in doing business. Being a quick-minded, smart woman, she easily familiarized herself with the details of business and trading. To date, she has become a woman who is very experienced with dealing in agricultural products. This business helped the family’s finances become more stable. Besides this business, she also worked with her son and daughter-in-law to raise chickens and fish. The family’s quality of life is getting better day by day. In this round of funding she is requesting 10,000,000 VND to invest in her business. Their average monthly income is 3,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Sâm năm nay 56 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp không ít khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm, con còn nhỏ. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán. Là người phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn, tháo vát nên chị đã làm quen với công việc kinh doanh không mấy khó khăn. Đến nay chị đã trở thành một người phụ nữ có rất nhiều kinh nghiệm trong kinh doanh các mặt hàng thực phẩm. Và chính công việc kinh daonh đã giúp cho thu nhập của gia đình chị ổn định hơn. Ngoài kinh doanh buôn bán chị còn kết hợp cùng con trai và con dâu chăn nuôi thêm gà, cá. Cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang được cải thiện từng ngày. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vào kinh doanh phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Ron

texts.en: Mrs. Ron R. lives in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. She owns a grocery store in the local market. In this business, she can earn around $6 a day to support her family. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Ron R. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Eith Kunthea, helps her in her grocery business. Mrs. Ron R. is a 31-year-old woman without any children. Mrs. Ron R. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Greetings from Charlotte in Byumba, in the north of Rwanda! Charlotte is 29 years old, married with 3 children and 1 adopted orphan.

She owns a shop where she sells various clothes for women and children in a nearby market. She has been in this business for three years. She earns about US$ 45 per month. She employs one person to help her in her business.

Charlotte is requesting a loan worth 150,000 Frws to buy more items for her clothes shop for the Christmas season. The loan term is 6 months.

loans.use: To buy more items for her clothes shop for the Christmas season

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 47 años, vive con su madre y con su madre. Cada día se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los ingredientes esenciales para la elaboración de tamales, cerca de las 11 de la mañana, sale con los tamales preparados a vender y también a repartir a su clientela. Vende de manera ambulante en la puerta de los colegios, hasta horas de la tarde, donde regresa nuevamente a lavar todo lo que utilizó, de esta manera obtiene las ganancias diarias, ella es el único sostén de su hijo. Martha  disfruta de este trabajo porque le gusta cocinar, además de que este platillo es muy sencillo de elaborar para ella. Martha trabaja por la educación de su hijo,  quiere verlo como un profesional de éxito. Solicita este préstamo para hacer las compras al por mayor de harina de maíz, aceite, entre otros ingredientes para abastecer los pedidos que le solicitan.
texts.en:
Martha, 47, lives with her mother and grandmother. She rises very early every day to go to the market to purchase the essential ingredients to make tamales. By about 11 am, she goes out to sell the prepared tamales, and also to deliver to her clientele. She makes street sales at school entrances. In the afternoon she returns again to wash everything that she used, and in this way she makes her daily income. She is the sole support of her son. Martha enjoys this work because she loves to cook and this dish is very easy for her to make. Martha works for her son's education, she would like to see him become a successful professional. She is requesting this loan to purchase corn flour, oil, and other ingredients wholesale, to stock up for the orders that come to her.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire the ingredients necessary to make tamales

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora I. is 26 years old and is married with one child. Difficult living conditions have forced her husband to leave for Russia to find work.
