Nigora makes dried apricots and sells them at the local market. This is her family's main source of income and it provides a steady cashflow. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is now requesting a loan which will be used to stock up her inventory of dried apricot. She deeply appreciates your support and would like to thank all of you.

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots inventory.

loans.name: Fred's Group

texts.en: Fred S. is the leader of Kutesa Group 2. He is married with 5 children, ages 8 to 20 years. He is also caring for 4 other dependents.  Fred has been in the group for 8 years. He runs two retail shops in Kasanga and Koba, and also grows green vegetables like nakati, dodo, cabbages etc which he takes to Kampala to the large market for sale.  However, with plantains, his biggest challenge is the high and ever increasing transport costs which sometimes cause delays in delivery of his products to Kampala. Since these are perishables, with the use of loans he reduces  costs  and the excess costs are covered in pricing.  Fred has a future plan of one day acquiring his own truck as well as opening up a wholesale shop/ outlet in Lugazi Town Council.  Fred needs a loan to finance his shops amd for buying more quality seeds for planting more vegetables.

loans.use: Restocking his 2 retail shops and to buy quality seeds.

loans.name: Saleem M.ramzan Group

texts.en:
Saleem baji is a 53 year old widow and resides in a two room brick house with her four sons in a city Multan, Pakistan. Her husband died 5 years ago. Saleem baji and her husband were very close and when he past away she became very depressed. Her sons helped her through that very difficult time and she is very thankful. Her sons run a milk shop in the community. She has successfully repaid her past three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her sons’ milk selling business.

Saleem baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Nosheen baji is requesting a loan to buy bangles for her bangle selling business. Haseena baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Khatoon begum baji is requesting a loan to buy goats for her animal selling business. Shahnaz baji is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a milk selling business

loans.name: Nadejda

texts.en: Nadejda was born in 1952. She lives in Baku city. She has 10 years of experience in her consulting business. Now she needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy a computer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn M. is a single parent who sells vegetables and cooked snacks in their village at San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. Her child, Christian, serves as her inspiration in life. Her son is four years old and will go to a Day Care Center this next school year, thus, Rubelyn strives to earn money for her child. They are currently living with her parents in the village since her husband left her when she was barely four months pregnant with Christian.

Rubelyn is working for a better life because she wants to provide the best for her child. She maintains her business to provide a daily income and be able to save a little for the education of her child. However, due to lack of capital she was not able to generate higher sales. Because of this, Rubelyn decided to look for a lending program to assist her in the business for her to improve and increase her daily income. She wants to borrow PHP4,000 to fulfill her plans. She is working hard to attain her dream of having a successful business and she believes that through her faith with God, her dream will somehow become a reality because with God, “nothing is impossible.”

loans.use: Financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is engaged in rice farming. She is 39 years old and all of her three children are studying. She depends mainly on her harvest to be able to pay all the tuition and book fees of her children. Her harvest is intended for family use and the rest is sold to rice traders for additional income. She wants to establish a new store. However, she doesn't have enough capital to start a new business.

She is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. Some of her loan will also be used to start a sari-sari (general or variety) store. Her loan will definitely give her a better harvest. She hopes someday that she will be able to buy more farmland. In that way, she will have more rice to sell for the future of her children.

CEVI supports Carmelita in her business. Now, she enjoys having the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha has been a vegetable and firewood seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She belongs to the Subira ina mpaka loan group (group code 2058). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $155. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood, tomatoes and vegetables for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.

Mwanaisha is 42 years old, married, and has six children: ages 24, 21, 20, 18, 16 and 14.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, vegetables and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. owns a small rice field. She is 41 years old, a widow, and has seven children. She is the only one who works to win food and clothing for the family. She would like to buy another farm to increase her harvest. She dreamed that someday, all her children will graduate in college and have better jobs in the future.

The reason why Norma would like to loan from CEVI is that she wants to buy herbicides and fertilizers for her farm. The loan will also be used to venture into another line of business to supplement their income.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them start and have their own business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides for her farm

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O. is 45 years old. She is married and has five children, three sons and two daughters. Felicia lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Felicia’s husband is a radio repairer while she is a trader. She runs a cold store in her community. Felicia says her cold store is at the market square. She sells fresh fish, beef, chicken, turkey, etc. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. She has been in business for two years. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Soyol-Erdene

texts.en:
Soyol-Erdene B. lives with his wife and two year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Soyol-Erdene's mother-in-law lives with them and takes care of her infant grandson when his parents are away at work.

Soyol-Erdene has a small business in food retail, specifically focusing on fresh vegetables. He rents two stalls in "Burd" a local food market in which he sells various fresh vegetables. Although he just launched this business in early 2008, he has successfully opened one more stall for fresh vegetables and two other stalls for meat products. He is mainly in charge of the fresh vegetable stalls and his wife sits at the meat stalls.

In the future, Soyol-Erdene wants to enter the wholesale market for fresh vegetables and meat products. He requests a loan to purchase more fresh vegetables and meat for his business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables and meat to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a typical businesswoman. She sells foodstuffs in her house. She is 39 years old and married with three children. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 
She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 29-year-old single mother of two. She is a tailor and a dressmaker – she even made the dress that she is wearing in the photo! She wants to use this loan to buy a new Singer sewing machine which will help expand her business.

Winnie has been a tailor for six years. She went to a training school before starting her own business out of her home. When asked about her challenges, she explains that the road outside of her house is bad; that means that it is difficult for customers to get to her. She also explains that many customers don’t want to pay for high quality work. Sometimes they place an order and when she provides the service, they only pay part of the balance, and then “they disappear” – leaving her to cover the rest of her costs.

Winnie wants her business to grow so that her kids can have a better education. If possible, she wants to buy some land so that some day they can have an actual home.

K-MET, the NGO providing the loan, is not a traditional microfinance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. For more information about K-MET, click on “About the Field Partner” on the right-hand side of the web page.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi E. est une femme de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’un bar restaurant à Lomé. Elle désire avec ce deuxième crédit, améliorer la taille de son commerce en approvisionnant son magasin et aussi élargir son espace de réception.
texts.en:
Essi E. is a 43-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three. She is the owner of a bar-restaurant in Lomé. She would like to use this second loan to better the size of her business by stocking her store and also to enlarge her reception area.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store and to expand

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel M. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 26 years old. Hazel is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Hazel runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Hazel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hazel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Hazel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and serve as working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Hazel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Luis Joaquin

texts.es: Luis Joaquín V. tiene la edad de 43 años, es un hombre casado  tiene 2 hijos  que dependen de ella, sus deseos son mantener su negocio activo por que todavía necesita mantener a su familia. La actividad económica a la que se dedica el  la venta y destace de cerdo hace mas de 5 años  que se dedica a esa actividad. Inicia este negocio  por la necesidad de trabajar ya que no tenía trabajo y sus hijos necesitaban alimentos y estudios. Más tarde decide quedarse con este negocio y empieza con la compra de un cerdo y al tener afluencia de clientes decide invertir más en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital e trabajo destinado para la compra de  más productos cerdos para criar y además para la alimentación de estos animales que es muy cara. Su deseo es que su negocio logre tener la mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Luis Joaquín V. is 43 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. He desires to maintain an active business so that he can continue to support his family. For 5 years, he has been selling and butchering pigs in order to earn a living. He started his business out of necessity because he needed work in order to feed and educate his children. Luis started by purchasing one pig and decided to invest more resources into his business once he experienced an influx of customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to buy more pigs for breeding. He will also buy animal feed, which can be very expensive. He hopes that his business will continue to churn out a high quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Sam Try Group

texts.en:
Hawa B. (left) is the leader of this group. Hawa owns a kiosk where she sells provisions such as cans of milk, sugar, mayonnaise, cheese, butter, breads, etc. She also sells market foods like palm oil – the country’s most popular cooking oil. Hawa has been a businesswoman for six years now. Hawa lives in Makeni together with her husband and two children. Hawa’s husband works for two of the leading mobile networks in the country as a sales agent. Her twin children are attending primary school and are in class II. Hawa was born in Mabolo, in the Kambia district of Northern Sierra Leone about 28 years ago.

This loan is for members of the Sam Try group. They are small scale entrepreneurs in Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a first-time loan of Le 1,500,000 from SMT/Kiva, in order to help themselves improve their businesses and living conditions.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Excellent Group

texts.en:
Excellent group is composed of five borrowers led by Mark N., a 33-year-old single father of a year-old child. Mark is a high school graduate but, due to the civil crisis in Liberia, he could not further his education so decided to go into the business field. He lives and work in Lynch Street, Monrovia, Liberia.

Mark's business is molding bricks. He buys cement by the bag, molds it and sells the bricks to the residents of Monrovia. He started this business 15 years ago, with $350.00 LRD but later borrowed some funds from his friends to improve his business. Mark molds good quality bricks so that his customers are encouraged to always buy from him. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more cement to improve his business. Mark's goal is to grow his business so that he and his family can be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cement

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Ayo is 40 years old and married with three children. She has a salon where she does hair for her customers and she also sells drinks and gift items. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and gift items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and gift items

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. Her group is called Sacro. She is from Cruz Pata and still lives there. She is 57 years old and is married with 8 children and 4 grandchildren. 

Tomasa is a farmer. She grows potatoes, beans and wheat. With the loan, she will buy seeds, fertilizer and dirt for her fields.

Tomasa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: purchasing seeds, fertilizer and dirt for her fields

loans.name: Anelith

texts.es:
La señora Anelith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos”, Distrito de Zapatero, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.

Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar, le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas preparadas, ubicada en su misma casa, donde poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su restaurant “A.” y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón que le pone a sus comidas y con  la amabilidad que le caracterizado siempre.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Anelith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Anelith belongs to the Manuela Ramos community bank in Zapatero district, Lamas province, in San Martín department. She is 36 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom she still supports. In order to contribute to family income, Anelith had the idea of opening a small business selling meals. She runs the business from her home where she has slowly gained experience in this type of work. She has become well known and much liked by her clients. She still runs this business, taking care of her customers who come to the restaurant “A.” on a daily basis. They are regular visitors because of the personal attention she provides, the tasty seasoning she puts in her dishes, and the friendly atmosphere which always surrounds her. With this S/.2,500 loan Anelith will buy bags of sugar, different types of vegetables, and cases of eggs and chickens. She also plans to buy kitchen utensils to replace those she currently owns. In this way she will provide her customers with better service and care. She feels very confident and wishes to get ahead in life. She is grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing her with peace of mind and the opportunity to achieve her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meal ingredients

loans.name: Juliver Gil

texts.es:
El socio JULIVER GIL es un futura padre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

El socio tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y su esposa Jessica esta embarazada. Ellos viven en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. El y su esposa tienen un pequeño restaurante donde venden desayuno almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años que trabajan en el negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. 
Nuestro socio es una joven responsable y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para abrir otro restaurante por el distrito de San Jerónimo quiere comprar cubiertos y platos.  
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juliver Gil is a future father and a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura”. He is 26 years old and in a common law marriage. His wife Jessica is pregnant. They live in San Jerónimo District in the community of Angostura, which is located south of the city of Cusco.

He and his wife have a small restaurant where they serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They have been in this business for several years and have done very well as a result of all the effort they put into their work. Juliver Gil is a responsible and enterprising young man who wants to succeed on behalf of his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase silverware and dishes so that he can open another restaurant in San Jerónimo District.

Juliver Gil is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase silverware & dishes

loans.name: Saphaqui Group

texts.es:
Tejido de prendas de vestir (mantas), venta de comida (ceviche, salchicha), atención de cabinas telefónicas, taller de mecánica, costura de chamarras, son los diferentes negocios a las cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Saphaqui.  Este grupo desarrollan sus reuniones en el Centro Focal Los Andes con el apoyo y orientación de su asesora de créditos, desean invertir en sus negocios  comprando herramientas de trabajo, tela, papa al por mayor y otros.
Ellas esperan estar mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mjer hasta lograr ahorros considerables que les permita reinvertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The members of the Saphaqui group are involved in many different businesses including knitting articles of clothing (blankets), selling food (ceviche, salchicha), operating a telephone kiosk and a mechanic garage and sewing jackets. This group develops their meetings in the Los Andes Center with the help and guidance of their loan advisor. They hope to invest in their businesses by buying tools, fabric, potatoes and more. They hope to be with the Pro Mujer family for a long time, until they earn considerable savings that allows them to reinvest in their business

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools of the trade and groceries

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta M.'s main source of income comes from making and selling charcoal in her community. She is 30 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. Marieta is just starting her business. In 2009, Marieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marieta is requesting a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reyes Carvajal Group

texts.es:
REYES CARVAJAL es un Banco D. Emprendimiento que ingresa a su segundo ciclo sin tener dificultad D. pago en su inicio, son personas D. la misma zona con distintas actividades, muchos D. ellos no cuentan con un negocio establecido pero con el prestamo iniciaran uno, cuentan con una mesa directiva elegida democraticamente por asamblea en la que salio elegida como presidenta la Sra Daria que tiene su negocio D. venta D. comida en la parada del minibus "263".

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Florentina que se dedica a la venta D. golosinas.

La Secretaria es la sra Estela que trabaja en labores D. casa. desarrollan tambien otras actividades.

Como parte D. la base del banco se encuentra la srta Mariela que venD. ropa, el Sr. Edgar  se dedica a la reparacion D. celulares, el Sr. Heriberto trabaja en el club D. golf, la Sra. Monica  venD. comida con su madre,el Sr. Vicente Trabaja como mecanico en un taller D. automoviles, la Sra. Veronica trabaja como empleada domestica, por ultimo esta la Sra. Virginia que se dedica a la atencion en una tienda D. Fotocopias. con estas actividades ellos sostienen a sus familias esperan tener un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

Todos ellos estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Reyes Carvajal is communal bank that has entered its 2nd loan cycle without having any difficulties with payments during the first cycle. The members are from the same area but are involved in different activities; most of them do not have an established business but with the loan they will start one. They have a board that was elected democratically by assembly, in which Daria was elected president. She has a business selling food next to the bus stop for minibus "263." Florentina was elected treasurer; she sells candy. Estela is the secretary, and she is a homemaker. The group is also developing other activities. The foundation of the group is formed by Mariela, who sells clothing, Edgar, who repairs cellular phones, Heriberto, who works at a golf club, Monica, who sells food with her mother, Vincent, who works as a mechanic in an auto repair shop, Veronica, who works as a domestic, and finally Virginia, who works in a photocopy shop. With these activities they support their families and hope to have a better future for their children. All of them are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 52 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. In the future, she hopes to own a world-class supermarket. Florence is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell. Her husband is a pastor and he also supports the home. She is thankful to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie A. is from the village of Mahayahay, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is forty-three years old. Jessie is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Jessie's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yee

texts.en:
Mrs. Yee L. is a villager who lives in Preak Reussei village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows crops. In this farming, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and to pay for a farm laborer.

Mrs. Yee L. is 34 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a student in the local school while the youngest one is too young to study or work. Her husband, Mr. Thoeun Seangly, is a farm laborer and also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family’s living. He is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pay for a farm laborer

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es: Esta cliente es originario del municipio de San Francisco del Norte y el crédito será destinado para mejorar su negocio, bolsas de pan, cajas de shampoo, compra de enseres domésticos, tales como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, maíz, golosinas, cajas de jabón de baño, de lavar, ha sido una buena cliente, ha sacado su negocio adelante con la ayuda de créditos que ha obtenido y  cumple en tiempo y forma la cancelación de su crédito.
texts.en:
This client is from the San Francisco del Norte municipality. The loan is to improve her business. She will buy bags of bread, cases of shampoo, and domestic goods like oil, rice, beans, corn, sweets, cases of bathroom soap, and laundry soap. She has been a good client. She has gotten her business ahead with the help of the loans she has received. She has paid the loan completely and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy domestic goods

loans.name: Roberto Julio

texts.es: Don Roberto de 32 años de edad, padre de familia de un hijo de 2 años de edad, su esposa trabaja como ingeniera agrícola, y ambos están logrando hacer su casa. Ya tiene parte de la casa avanzada lo cual es un gran logro de alegría para ambos ya que obtendrán un techo digno para su  hijo como mejor privacidad. Don Roberto trabaja como contador desde  hace varios años el cual es su medio de fuente. Con este préstamo quiere comprar zinc, perlines, golosos, puertas que le hacia falta para terminar la casa en poco tiempo y poder mudarse. Sus planes es seguir laborando y ahorrando para seguir con la construcción de las mejoras.
texts.en:
Don Roberto, 32, is the father of a 2 year old son. His wife works as an agricultural engineer and they are working together to build a house. Part of the house is now complete, a source of great pleasure for both of them because it will provide a decent place for their son to live and more privacy. Don Roberto has worked as an accountant for several years and the work is his main source of income. With the loan, he wants to buy roofing materials and other supplies that he needs to finish the house so that the family can move in. His plan for the future is to go on working and saving so that he can continue making improvements to the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for house construction.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet R.'s main source of income comes from providing construction services to local community members. Juliet owns and operates a sand and gravel (quarry) business. She is 35 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Dullan, Aloran. Juliet has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2005, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional business revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Reinaldo Maximiliano

texts.es:
Reinaldo Crespín de 58 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene cuatro hijos de 31, 27, 25, 18 años. Reinaldo antes trabajaba en un taller de costura, pero al ver sus hijos el cansancio y la necesidad de su papa de tener su propio negocio desde su casa decidieron comprarle una maquina de coser industrial. 

Por la ayuda que sus hijos le dieron ahora el tiene su propio taller de costura en la sala de su casa, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm, por el arreglo de camisetas cobrar $ 5.00, pantalones $ 15.00, calentadores $ 9.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar dos maquinas de coser, y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Reinaldo Crespín, 58, lives in an urban area of El Suburbio, Guayaquil; he has four children who are 31, 25, 25 and 18 years old. Reynaldo used to work in a tailor shop but, when his children saw how exhausted he was and that he needed to have his own home-based business, they decided to buy him an industrial sewing machine. Thanks to the help from his children, he has his own tailor shop in his house. His wife helps him and they are open for business from 8am until 10pm. He charges $5.00 for shirt repairs, $15.00 for pants and $9.00 for legwarmers. He will use the funds to buy fabrics and thread. He would like to buy two sewing machines in the future and make improvements to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie E. is from the town of Banga. She is 33 years old. Annalie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Annalie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Annalie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Annalie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annalie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annalie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr.  Victor tiene 36 años es soltero sin hijos,culmino sus estudios secundarios.
El tuvo que viajar a España ya que no tenia trabajo y con los ahorroas de su trabajo el volvio a Paraguay y pudo invertir en la apertura de un Cyber, actualmente cuenta con 3 locales propios y desea abril otro por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de mas computadoras.
texts.en:
Victor, 36, is single and childless; he completed secondary education. Due to unemployment he went to Spain to work. With his savings he returned to Paraguay and was able to invest in a Cybercafe. He currently owns three locales and wants to open another one, thus the loan request to purchase more computers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena G. is from the village of  Catarman, Camiguin  Province. She is 46 years old. Elena is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has been operating his mixed farm in Kitale town in Western Kenya for 10 years. He has employed two people from his community to help with the farm work.

Isaac is 28 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 1½ and 12. Three of his children are currently attending school. Isaac is also a mechanic (pictured on his motorbike and onlooking is one of his children).

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.80,000 to start a poultry project and build a dairy unit. He says that he hopes the extra income from this loan will enable him to meet the basic needs of the family. He would also like to expand and increase his productivity in terms of the number of chickens and also practice zero grazing.

His primary challenge has been the fluctuation in the prices of milk and poultry diseases.

loans.use: To start a poultry project and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Erdenebileg B. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvs province, western Mongolia. He and his family have been living together in a house for 9 years. Erdenebileg began his carpentry business in 2003. He produces  'ger'--a traditional Mongolian housing tent--parts such as wooden walls, doors and poles, which make up a 'ger' roof while his wife sews shoes which are well-known as “a pair of white-soled shoes,”  popular and warm. 

Erdenebileg and his wife are working hard to expand their product line to include furniture as well. Erdenebileg would one day like to open a small factory in which he can produce even more products with ease.  He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more wood, fabrics, finishing materials and supplies in order to expand his business and keep up with customers’ orders.

loans.use: To  purchase materials for his and his wife's businesses

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 33 años D. edad resiD. en el Municipio D. San Francisco Gotera Departamento D. Morazán, es madre soltera vive con madre y su hijo D. 18 años D. edad, la familia depenD. económicamente D. los ingresos del negocio, ella posee un puesto en el mercado donD. venD. comida.
Hace a siete años se dedica a la venta D. comida, posee su comedor en el mercado municipal D. San francisco Gotera, venD. desayunos y almuerzos, su hijo trabaja en un taller D. estructuras metálicas para ahorrar ya que él quiere estudias en la universidad, Paula actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en la compra D. una refrigeradora ya que esto le permitirá conservas mas los alimentos y bebidas refrescantes.
Los sueños D. Paula son apoyar a su hijo con realizar los estudios universitarios, trabajar para incrementar el negocio y tener casa propia, mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. la familia
texts.en:
Paula is 33, and lives in the San Francisco Gotera town, Morazán department. She is a single mother and lives with her mother and 18 year old son. The family depends on the income from her business. She has a stand in the market where she sells food. Seven years ago she started selling food. She has a dining area in the city market of San Francisco Gotera where she sells breakfasts and lunches. Her son works in a shop making metal structures to save money now that he wants to study at the university. Paula is currently requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator since this will allow her to keep the food and soft drinks better. Her dream is to support her son with his university studies, work to increase her business, and to have her own house-all of which will improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator since this will allow her to keep the food and soft drinks better.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is from the village of Namnama. She is 48 years old. Ofelia is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns & operates a business planting and selling vegetables in the market. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
In Mea Neak village in Takeo province lives Mrs. Nget S., who was born in 1978. She and her husband, Mr. Savoeun Nget, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a fisherman. 

She faces difficulty because in her field, it is time to grow rice, but she does not have rice seeds. So to improve this problem, Mrs. Nget S. is seeking a loan to buy rice seeds. With the rest of the loan, she will hire a plowing machine to plow her field. 

She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while another one is a farmer and one is a student. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat is a brave married woman who works hard for the good of her three children, and she does so alone. The strict discipline she uses with her children allows her to count on her household’s advice and support in working the fields. Shahodat’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her and they have gathered many lessons during this time that they can use when they form their own households. What Shahodat urgently needs right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for cultivating her land and to be prepared for upcoming growing season. Shahodat doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Peter Njoroge

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old and married to Peris Waithera. They have two children. Peter has been farming in Olkalou town for the last 22 years.  He heard about KADET through a staff member, got interested, and joined the organization.  This will be Peter’s second loan from KADET; he paid his first loan on time and without problem. 

Peter plans to use the loan to plant and harvest more potatoes on his farm. In the future, he hopes to buy more land and start farming on a larger scale.

loans.use: To plant and harvest more potatoes

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is twenty-six years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children who are between the ages of 3 and 8. Two of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for five years. His farm currently produces milk and tomatoes which he sells at the local market. He also earns income from his battery charging business. 

Moses has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to purchase a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to send his children to better schools. His biggest challenge has been the lack of enough animal feed especially during the dry season. He hopes that in the next five years he will be able to acquire five dairy cows and a chuff cutter (to cut fodder for them).

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe S. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and single. To make a living, Fe works for a family member's business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for her work.

In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan Fe has borrowed from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the family's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth  Denisse

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 28 años y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles como mesa,,armarios,estantes,camas entre otros, la socia lo vende en las diferentes ferias que se realizan cada fin de semana y también a las personas que le solicitan.                  

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de acabo de muebles como pintura,tiner,madera entre otros. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "My Peru". The bank is located in the district, area, and province of Cusco. 

Her name is Elizabeth. She is 28 years old and she is single. She carries out her daily work with her business selling furniture, such as: tables, armoires, stands, beds etc. she sells her products in the various fairs that take place on the weekends and to individuals who place orders. 

She requests a loan to purchase products for finishing furniture, such as: paint, thinner, wood etc. 

She is very grateful to all those who are becoming part of her dream and she is compromised to the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase products for finishing furniture, such as: paint, thinner, wood etc

loans.name: Fidelina Albertina

texts.es:
la señora Fidelina Albertina L. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la colonia 21 de Diciembre de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de pan y rosquillas, su producto lo distribuye en varias pulperias y tambien vende por detalle a sus vecinos.
Fidelina tiene la ayuda de su mama para la fabricacion del pan y de las rosquillas, Fidelina lucha mucho para sacar a su hija adelante y darle una mejor calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar los materiales para la fabricacion del pan y de las rosquillas.
texts.en:
Fidelina Albertina L. is 38 years old.  She lives in the 21 de Diciembre neighborhood of the city of Choluteca.  She makes and sells bread and 'rosquillas' (a type of doughnut).  She delivers her products to several grocery stores and she also sells retail to her neighbors.

Fidelina has her mom's help in making her bread and 'rosquillas'.  Fidelina works hard to get her daughter ahead in life and give her a better quality of life.

Fidelina will use her loan to buy the material she needs to make bread and 'rosquillas'.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, sugar, milk, cheese, corn, firewood and water

loans.name: Murat

texts.en: Murat B., 46 years old, is married and has three children. He and his family lives in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His two daughters attend a local high school. His wife and eldest son together help him with his work. Murat has been operating a meat trade business for about nine years. He started his business with a 300,000 MNT loan. During those years his business grew and now he owns a house with eight rooms. Murat said, "with my successful business, I made my own house and we living happily." He spent his own capital to buy about 60 livestock. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay for more meat, and also to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To pay for more meat and increase his working capital

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.es: La señora Cresencia Isabel Díaz es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora  de 68 años quien desde 1990 se dedica al comercio variado es decir vende desde ropa, cosméticos, cremas etc. con los cuales saco adelante a sus cinco hijos. Ella con el crédito comprara mercadería para su negocio en especial útiles escolares ya que se aproxima el inicio a clase y tiene muchos encargos.
texts.en: Mrs Cresencia Isabel Díaz is a hard-working and enterprising woman of 68 years. She has been a merchant of varied items since 1990; she sells clothing, cosmetics, creams, etc. This is how she got her five children ahead. She will use this loan to buy merchandise for her business, especially school supplies, since school is about to start and she has many orders.

loans.use: school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 20 years old and single. He graduated from primary school. He has a mini-market, and he will use this loan to develop his mini-market and purchase a refrigerator and various food products such as sugar, rice and tea. The borrower has a good character on the market. All the prices are reasonable and that makes lots of customers do their shopping at his mini-market. The borrower has a huge ambition to develop his business to raise his income.

loans.use: For purchasing products & a vertical fridge

loans.name: Hilda Yovana

texts.es: La señora Hilda Yovana se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un año , su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado de San Joaquín . La solicitante es soltera no tiene carga familiar por lo tanto ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares además tiene otro ingreso económico por que trabaja en un centro Comercial de Ica . Está solicitando el crédito para invertir en su negocio de ropa ya que comienza la campaña escolar, se propone otorgarle el préstamo ya que presenta experiencia crediticia con el BCP  y está pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda Yovana has been selling clothes for one year. Her business is located at the San Joaquín Market. Hilda is single and has no family dependents, yet she helps her parents with their household expenses. She also earns extra income working at a shopping center in Ica.

Hilda is requesting a loan to invest in her clothing business since the beginning of the school year has started. She is being recommended for this loan because she has current credit experience with BCP and is submitting her payments on time.

loans.use: Operating capital for her clothing business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher Y. operates motorcycle transport in Malindi town. He has been in this business for four years and earns a monthly profit of about $150. He is 50 years old, married, and the father of six children.

He has never borrowed from any other micro-finance institution (MFI), and he is applying for a third loan after being introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He plans to use the entire loan amount to service his motorbike and to set up a new business of selling charcoal and firewood for his wife.  

Christopher intends to use the anticipated profit to save for paying school fees for his children. He hopes to grow his business, and in the future to venture into crop farming.

loans.use: to service his motorbike and to start a new business for his wife

loans.name: Zakaria Muriithi

texts.en:
Zakaria has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 36 years. He is 68 years old, married to Tabitha Wanjiku and they have 6 children.  

Zakaria was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Zakaria hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Elise was born in 1964 in Abomey, a major historical town in Benin. She moved to Cotonou, Benin's largest city, 15 years ago. She lives with her husband, Daniel, and two of their four children. All of their children are schooled.

For the past 13 years, Elise has sold meals from her stall in the Sama-Lémé district. This is her 8th loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments. This loan will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. She cites her proactivity as her greatest attribute as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 48 years old and is married with seven children between the ages 10 and 25 years old. She has been selling shoes and bags for four years and her business is well-organized. She works from 7am until 7pm every day. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. Dative will reinvest the profits in her business and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and bags

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis de 24 años, es un hombre inspirado en su trabajo que desde muy joven inicio esta actividad ya que es una tradición familiar y abrió su propia papelería.

El labora de 8H00am a 7H00pm en la venta de de su papelería con el apoyo de su esposa. con la ayuda del prestamos quiere comprar cuadernos, zapatos, y variados mercadería. lo que mas anhela es que su papelería crezca con variedad de artículos para que le genere mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis is 24 years old and he is a man that is inspired in his work. He started this business since he was very young, especially because it is a family tradition. He opened his own office supply store. 

He works from 8am to 7pm selling office supplies and he has his wife's support. With help of this loan he wants to purchase notebooks, shoes, and various merchandise. What he most wishes for is to have his office supply store grow and to have a variety of merchandise to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, shoes, and various office supplies.

loans.name: Baktykan's Group

texts.en:
Baktykan U. is the treasurer of this group. She is 42 years old, married, and has two adult children. Five months ago with the initial investment of 30,000 soms, Baktykan opened a pavilion and started to sell groceries. She earns 20,800 soms per month. With money from the loan, she wants to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs, macaroni. etc. In the future Baktykan hopes to purchase a three-room flat. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and foodstuff

loans.name: 83 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiệp has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Thiệp is 56 years old and she is married. She has 4 children.

Thiệp is the group leader of the 18.5.83 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thiệp has been involved in this business for 3 years.

The main harship that Thiệp faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Thiệp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 34 años, es soltera, y tiene un hijo de 8 meses. Se dedica a la venta de plantas ornamentales, frutales, forestales. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de plantas y macetas para surtir su negocio.
Maríanela tiene un puesto de plantas ornamentales, frutales, forestales en Canán Alto y le va bien. Ingresó a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de su tía. Con éste es el segundo ciclo que está. Le parece interesante hay muchos facilidades en los prestamos y por las capacitaciones que da su promotora. Se inculca la cultura del ahorro. Con su ahorro se compró una cocina. Su sueño es ahorrar y poder comprarse un terreno y tener un vivero.
texts.en:
Marianela is a member of the Palmeras community bank.  She is 34 years old, single, and has an 8 month-old son.  Her business is selling ornamental plants, fruit plants and native plants.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying plants and plant pots with which to stock her business.  

Marianela has a plant stall in Canán Alto and her business is doing well.  She joined FINCA Peru through an invitation from one of her aunts.

This is Marianela's second loan cycle.  She likes the ease of the loans and the training that she receives from her loan officer.  FINCA Peru instill in their members a culture of saving.   With her savings, Marianela has bought herself a stove.  Her dream is to save up and be able to buy a plot of land and start a [plant] nursery.

loans.use: to buy plants and plant pots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: install a tile floor at his house.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
La señora Lupe es socia del banco comunal Las Tigresas del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad y un hijo.
Lleva cuatro años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de picarones (dulce peruano), el cual prepara por las tarde en el patio de su casa, tiene un par de mesas para comodidad de sus clientes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 cientos de platos descartables, ½ saco de azúcar, para hacer su miel, ¼ de clavo de olor, ¼ de canela, 1 vainilla, ¼ de anís, 1 galón de aceite, 1 perol.
Sus ganancias le sirve para solventar sus propios gastos, porque vive sola consu hijo en la casa de su mamá y no tiene muchos gastos.  Está muy tranquila porque Manuela Ramos la sigue apoyando.
texts.en: Lupe is a member of the 'Las Tigresas' (The Tigresses) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department. She is 50 years old and has one child. Lupe has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years. Her business is selling 'picarones' (a Peruvian dessert). She prepares them in the afternoons, in the patio area outside her home. She has a couple of tables for her customers' convenience. With this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles, Lupe will buy: 200 disposable plates, half a sack of sugar for making her honey syrup, quarter of a bag of cloves, quarter of a bag of cinnamon, 1 lot of vanilla, quarter of a bag of aniseed, 1 gallon of oil and 1 pot. Lupe uses her profits to cover her own expenses as she lives with her son in her mom's house and doesn't have many expenses. She is very happy that Manuela Ramos continue to support her.

loans.use: to buy a pot, disposable plates and ingredients

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия жительница Файзабадского района. Ей 43 года. Она разведена. У нее детей нет. Она имеет средне - специальное образование, учительница. По профессии Зулфия проработала 10 лет. На сегодняшний день она у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже три года. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Zulfiya lives in the Fayzabad district.  She is 43 years old, divorced and has no children.  She has a secondary-specialized education as a teacher.  Zulfiya has worked in her field for 10 years.  Today, she is involved in sewing national dresses at her home.  She has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Susie

texts.en: Susie is 40 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is a widow and has five children, one of whom lives at home with her. For the past five years Susie has been running a small restaurant in her community selling delicious Liberian dishes. Sometime she has the problem of few customers. Susie is requesting a loan to purchase rice, fish and oil for her business. She plans to buy a plot of land and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fish and oil for her business.

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en: Maxwell wants a loan to buy crates of soda for resale. He has been trading in beverages for the last five years. Twenty-seven years old, Maxwell hails from Kyenjojo District of Uganda. He is married, and a father of four children between the ages of one and five. He lives with his family in a permanent house. Having started as an agriculturalist on a small basis, he saved the money to start his current business. His dream is to become a wholesaler, and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda for resale.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a determined, 22-year-old businessman. He is single. 

He has been managing a business of motorbike transportation to make a living. His dream is to have several motorbikes for transportation. In five years, he hopes to be using a bus for transportation.
 
He is requesting for a loan of 10,000 KES to be used for the maintenance of his motorbike. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya,he has been enabled to save and also to access credit.

loans.use: To service his motorbike.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Visitacion; tiene 60 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 7 hijos  los cuales son todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, chanchos los cuales compra, cría y vende, la socia también tiene un par de vacas, ahora ella desea  empezar a invertir en la compra de ganados vacunos, para la crianza, reproducción y venta final. La socia es una señora muy carismática y trabajadora, ella desea seguir en actividad y con la ilusión de comprar sus vacas para la venta de los derivados y la reproducción de sus ganados, ella quiere dejarles a sus hijos el ejemplo de que no hay edad para hacer los sueños realidad, ella soñó en tener una buena cantidad considerable de cabezas de ganados vacunos, lo que significa  tener  en su casa vacas como mínimo un numero de 10, y criarlas, alimentarlas y hacerlas procrear y ese fue su sueño. La socia ahora solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vacas terneras.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” communal bank, which is located in the district of Cachimayo, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member, Visitación, is 60 years old, married and has 7 children, all of whom are adults. She works raising young animals, like chickens, and pigs which she buys, raises and sells. She also has a pair of cows and now she wants to begin buying cattle to riase, reproduce and in the end, sell.

Visitación is a very charismatic and hardworking woman. She wants to continue doing this work, with the dream of buying cows in order to breed them and sell their offspring. She wants to leave her children with the example that old age does not prevent one’s dreams from coming true. She dreamed of having a large number of heads of cattle, which means having a minimum of 10 at her house, raising them, feeding them, breeding them and that was her dream. She is currently requesting the loan to invest in female calves.

Visitación is grateful for the support provided her and is committed to making her payments on time

loans.use: to buy female calves.

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jessica de 24 años es una joven emprendedora que tiene un negocio de cabinas y recargas telefónicas. Comenzó a trabajar ayudándole a la mama en el negocio familiar que tenían pero como quería mejorar su situación financiera decidió tener su propio negocio. 

En la actualidad tiene su negocio de cabinas y recargas telefónicas. Trabaja con la compañía “Claro” quien le comprar los minutos para que sus clientes tengan las llamadas que necesitan.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones para mejorar sus finanzas por eso desea el préstamo para comprar minutos a la compañía y así cumplir con las exigencias de sus clientes para llamadas internacionales.
texts.en:
Jessica, 24, is a young entrepreneur who has a business of telephone booths and cell phone minutes. She started out helping her mother in their family business, but she wanted to improve her financial situation so she decided to open her own business. 

Currently her business has phone booths and cell phone minutes. She works with the company "Claro", buying minutes from them so that her customers can make the calls they need to. She has aspirations of improving her finances and for that reason she wants a loan to buy minutes from the company and meet the demands of her clients for making international calls.

loans.use: to buy telephone minutes.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi, a 35-year-old married father of three sons and two daughters, is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary. Ramzi wants to purchase a new rickshaw in order to work extra hours and increase the family income, but the amount of money he has isn't sufficient. He is therefore requesting a loan from FATEN, to be repaid monthly which, when combined with his savings, will enable Ramzi to make the purchase and help him to improve his family's living conditions.

About This Loan Product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan.

For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Esther Mawia

texts.en: Esther is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from six years to twelve years. She describes herself to be quiet and likes sharing ideas. She operates a retail shop where she sells items such as rice, sugar, bread, flour, and detergents. She has been involved in this business for fourteen years. Her business is located in a busy shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy cereals for selling at the retail shop. Her business goal is to grow her business into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell at the general store

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim is a weaver. She is a widow and a mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of her children are married and the other one has full-time employment. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yim is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to continue her weaving business by purchasing weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Jesulome Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESULOME est formé de treize personnes qui se connaissent de part leurs activités. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Julienne est âgée de 41 ans, et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Albert. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois à leur charge. Julienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une trentaine d’année, Julienne vend de la farine de manioc qu'elle produit à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Julienne vend des fruits. Ce qui lui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Julienne achète ses produits dans un village du Bénin et les revend dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Julienne et les autres membres du groupement JESULOME sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The JESULOME group is made up of thirteen people who know each other apart from their businesses.  The group representative, named Julienne, has her hand raised in the photo.  Julienne is 41 years old and married to a reseller named Albert.  The couple has four children, all of whom have attended school and three of whom are under their care.  Julienne did not go to school.  For the last 30 years she has been selling manioc flour, which she makes at home.  In addition to this business, she sells fruits.  This allows her to pay the family's expenses, along with help from her husband.  Julienne buys her products in a village in Benin and resells them in a city in Benin.  This is the first time that she and the other members of the JESULOME group have requested a loan through ALIDé. This loan will allow them to increase their business activities and their operating funds, in order to better respond to demand from their customers.

loans.use: to buy bags of manioc.

loans.name: Mahuna Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUNA est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Clarisse est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Clarisse est âgée de 32 ans, et est mariée à un certain Jean Marie. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge et dont certains sont scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, Clarisse et son mari ont un autre enfant vivant à leur charge. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Clarisse n'a pas été à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis quatre ans et qui lui permet d'assurer ses différentes charges. Parallèlement à cette activité, Clarisse vend des mèches et des produits de beauté dans son atelier situé dans son quartier.Clarisse achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Clarisse et les autres membres du groupe MAHUNA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHUNA Group is made up of three women who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Clarisse, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

She's 32 years old and married to one Jean Marie. The couple has four children whom they have to support. Some of them attend school.

In addition to their own children, Clarisse and her husband have another child to support. The couple provides for the household together.

Clarisse never attended school, but got trained in hairdressing, a business she's been running for four years and which enables her to provide for herself.

In parallel, Clarisse sells hair extensions and beauty products in her workshop located in her neighborhood. She purchases her supplies in a market in Benin.

This is the third time that Clarisse and the other members of the MAHUNA Group are seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. This loan will enable them to bolster their businesses in order to better meet customer demand.

Previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She has been selling clothes for the last thirteen years to support her family. She also does farming to increase her income. She has employed one person to assist her manage the business. 

Evalyne has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to add to her stock of clothes for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more retail stock, such as sugar, salt, and flour.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 23 years old and a single mother with two children.

She has been into her business for the last 4 years, from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 10,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more clothes and venture in a charcoal business to help educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale and stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Nune

texts.en: Nune lives in Yerevan with her husband and son who is a student. Nune has opened a little grocery this year to have a stable source of income. Nune has applied for this loan to develop her business. With the loan's help she plans to purchase goods for her shop. This loan will help Nune to continue successfully running the shop and make the business more profitable. Nune will get more income and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory.

loans.name: Domitile

texts.en:
