Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like dried fish

location.town: Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. operates a local café in the Takaye area in Malindi town.  She earns a monthly profit of 26,000 KES.  She is 41 years old and a single mother of two children who are below 18 years of age. 

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who has also gained from the services that KADET offers.  She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy more equipment like cups, glasses, plates, and chairs and to also renovate the business premises.    

Esther intends to use the anticipated profit to save and pay school fees for her children.  She hopes to grow her business, and in the future to establish a retail shop beside the café.

loans.use: To buy utensils like plates, glasses, cups, spoons and to add more chairs and to renovate the business premises.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen lives in Gujranwala, Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture. She resides with her family in a two-room brick house she moved to 13 years ago. She is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She has three children. Her eldest son is enrolled in a local school while the others are too young to attend school. Her husband's name is N. M. and he is a painter by profession who paints walls, buildings and houses. He receives orders and fulfills them within the set period of time to earn income for the family.  

Noreen’s father-in-law and brother-in-law also live with the family. Both of them contribute to the family financially by doing painting work. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes and paint brushes to provide better quality service to his clients. He has operated this business for the past 7 years and Noreen is confident that an investment will help him increase his orders and income. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah, applying for the first time. In the photo Noreen, in yellow, holds her Asasah passbook.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes and brushes for painting business

loans.name: Merciditha

texts.en:
Merciditha is a 44-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. Merciditha works very hard to provide for them.

Merciditha runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Merciditha has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, sardines, curls, laundry soap, candies etc. 

In the future, Merciditha would like to repair her house and save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase additonal stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair extensions and a variety of hair care items

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, es natural del distrito de Quimbiri, tiene 39 años de edad, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, convive con Elena de 39 años y fruto de esa relación hoy tienen 02 hijos Judith de 15 años y Antony de 06 años y juntos viven en su propia casa. Luis empezó su aventura como agricultor desde muy niño, arando en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión por el agro le llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras, tiene ya 18 años trabajando en esta actividad y lo hace de manera independiente; cultivando café y cacao sobre sus 10 hectáreas de terreno que posee. En tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros para que le ayuden a extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto,  de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque gracias a su esfuerzo hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le proporcionan los mejores frutos, logrando obtener ganancias de cada kilogramo que vende. Sin embargo cuando es temporada de invierno debe procurar que los insectos no perjudiquen sus plantaciones, así con las constantes lluvias, impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. Con el crédito solicitado comprará  abono para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: Luis is originally from Quimbiri. He is 39 years old and he is a very happy, hardworking man. He lives with his common-law wife, Elena, 39 years old. From their relationship they have 2 children, Judith, 15, and Antony, 6. They all live together in a house which they own. Luis started his adventure as an agriculturist when he was a young boy, working on his parents' land. His passion for agriculture brought him to acquire his own land and today he has worked independently for 18 years. He cultivates coffee and cocoa on the 10 hectares of land that he has. During the harvest season he hires farmhands to help him harvest the product quicker. This way he manages to complete his work at a greater pace. He is very committed to his business. And it is thanks to this business that today he enjoys watching his plants yield better products, earning better profits for each kilogram that he sells. When the winter season arrives he must take care to avoid insects from harming his plantations. The constant rain also impedes his work. This is his 12th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is ready to make his payments on time as he wishes to access future loans. With the loan that he requests he will purchase fertilizer for his land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. He has been operating a butcher shop for ten years. Besides this, he also does farming.  

With income from his business, Livingstone is able to provide for his family including educating his two children. His dreams and aspirations are to expand his business and to open other outlets of his business. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy meat and a scale.

loans.use: To buy meat and a scale.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

For the past 2 years, he has operated a vegetable selling business. He sells in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. Salim faces a major challenge of seasonality in the business. During the rainy season, the demand for green vegetables is lower compared to dry hot season where the demand is higher. He dreams of expanding the business and establishing another shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, sukumawiki (green vegetables), onions, garlic and pepper. Salim decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, sukumawiki (green vegetables), onions, garlic and pepper.

loans.name: Fanny Patricia

texts.es:
Fanny Patricia tiene 32 años, vive en Union Libre vive con el compañero y dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Fanny se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es construir una casa grande y comprar un carro.

Le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Fanny Patricia is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She lives in the Canton Ventanas Province of Los Rios.

This group is called Unidos Venceremos (United We Will Conquer). It is located in La America Building in Canton Ventanas. This group works pertains to agricultural work in the short planting season for corn, rice, and gandul beans.

Fanny has been working in agriculture, especially in planting corn, rice, and beans, for a long time. She makes purchases each month in Ventanas and sells [produce] in the local market.

She is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This loan will help her financially to meet her needs in the face of challenges such as plagues, crop diseases, and climate variation. Her dream is to build a big house and buy a car.

She likes to clean her house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 57 años, madre de cinco hijos los cuales son mujeres y hombres de bien según comento. Ella se dedica desde hace varios años al comercio de frutas, verduras y granos básicos entre otros. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en frutas y verduras de temporada para fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en: María del Carmen is 57 years old.  She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has five children.  She tells us that all of her children are fine, upstanding men and women.   María has been selling fruit, vegetables, basic grains and other products for several years.  She will invest this loan in buying seasonal fruit and vegetables in order to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Vannak is a farmer.  She also produces rice wine and raises pigs. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and assists his wife in the businesses when he is free. Vannak has asked for a Kiva loan before, and is now requesting another loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting, because she does not have transportation. Vannak and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Syano

texts.en:
Syano is a hardworking 28-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. 

He has been engaged in farming for the last 11 years to provide for his family. Previously he used to sell second-hand clothes to make ends meet. 

He wants in the next five years to buy more land so that he can extend the area he cultivates and get more produce.

He is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Thanks to the extension services of Faulu Kenya, he is now able to grow more produce on his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 31 años es una madre pujante y trabajadora. Tiene un hijo de 5 años, esta casada y vive con su hijo y su esposo en una casa propia. El trabajo de Diana empieza por la mañana cuando tiene preparar a su hijo para mandarlo al jardín, luego visita a sus amigos, colegas y familiares ofreciendo los calzados que le envían de la ciudad de Lima para su venta.  Ella tiene que trabajar sola en la venta de zapatos pues su esposo maneja una mototaxi que compraron con el anterior préstamo realizado con la institución.Diana es feliz con su trabajo porque junto a su esposo hacen un mejor ingreso económico. Ella también es profesora en una institución educativa, pero su sueldo de docente muchas veces no es suficiente para solventar sus gastos. En el futuro el plan de Diana es comprar una mototaxi más para poder tener un ingreso más.Este es el tercer préstamo de Diana y espera poder seguir trabajando con la institución y con su grupo de socias ya que son muy unidas y sobre todo responsables.Con el préstamo solicitado espera poder dar una inicial para una mototaxi que tiene en mente poder comprar.
texts.en:
Diana, 31, is a vigorous, hard working mother.  She has a 5-year-old son, is married and lives with her son and husband in her own house.  Diana’s work starts in the morning when she gets her son ready for Kindergarten.  Then, she visits her friends, colleagues and family members to offer shoes that are shipped to her from Lima to sell.  She has to work selling shoes by herself because her husband drives a mototaxi that they purchased with the previous loan they got from the institution.  

Diana is happy with her work because together with her husband she’s producing better income.  She also works as a Teacher at a school but her teacher’s salary often is insufficient to cover her expenses.  Diana’s future plan is to buy another mototaxi to have an additional source of income.

This is Diana’s third loan and she expects to continue to work with the institution and with her group of members who are very unified and, above all, responsible.  She will use the requested loan to make the down payment on a mototaxi she’s thinking about buying.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is divorced and has two children. She fries fish to sell in Abura, which she has been doing for 10 years. As a divorcee, single-handedly taking care of her children has not been easy. A loan will go a long way to help her buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business for further growth and to take care of the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Esther has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Celso David

texts.es:
Celso David tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero tiene un hijo vive  solo,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Celso David  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener casa propia para vivir con el hijo.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con el hijo.
texts.en:
Celso David is 33 years old, single, and has one child. He lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The Communal Bank called “El Placer” is part of the canton of Chillanes and in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, which is located 30 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. This Communal Bank consists of 24 members who are farmers. They grow bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soybeans, and oranges. In addition, they raise domesticated animals.

Celso David grows rice, corn, oranges, soybeans, and bananas. He purchases his supplies in San Jose del Tambo and sells his products at the market in Chillanes and at the fair on Sundays.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies and fertilizers. This money will help him improve his crops. Celso David does not face any major challenges. His dream is to own a house where he can live with his son.

In his free time, Celso David enjoys spending time with his son.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mustapha A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the secondary schools in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.

This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to request a loan of 12,900,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries cannot finance. For example, some of them will use the loan to buy house-building materials, a plot of land, pay their children’s school fees, etc. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and will pay SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Mustapha is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in Waterloo 48 years ago, Mustapha is married and has two children who are in college. Mustapha, who has 16 years of experience in the teaching field, has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and invest the rest in his business.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet was born in 1959. He is married and lives in Noyemberyan city, Tavush region, not far from Ijevan city. His family consists of his wife, who works as a librarian, and two school-aged daughters. 

For about 20 years, Hamlet worked as a mechanical engineer in one of Abovyan's city factories, but since 2003 he has been trading in jewelry and souvenirs. With the income from his business, Hamlet supports his family and has been able to buy new furniture for his house and improve his family's living conditions. 

Recently Hamlet diversified his business: now he sells not only jewelry and souvenirs, but also sunglasses. 

Hamlet intends to buy his own place for his business, which will reduce his business expenses. He says that, thanks to his business income, he has already saved some money to buy a small stall. 

Hamlet is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy an assortment of jewelry and to buy vases, photo frames, tea and coffee to sell. He plans to add future income to his saved money. Hamlet hopes to buy his own place very soon.   

This is Hamlet's second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and vases, photo frames, tea and coffee to sell

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos que ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez 8ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para o distrito d Boane a procura de emprego, é pedreiro mestre de obras ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para o bra da sua casa (chapas, areia, pedra, barrotes, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade com o projecto da sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, para tal irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alexandre was born in Sofala Province in central Mozambique. He is married and the father of two children, all of whom are in school. He completed school through the 8th grade himself, but wasn't able to continue out of financial constraints. He lives in his own home with his family, which he supports.

He left his native region for the Boane District of Maputo in search of work. He has been a stone mason for more than 10 years and earns a monthly salary of nearly 5,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] that goes to his household expenses and also some savings in his personal bank account.  

He has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be his fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 12,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which he plans to buy construction materials for his house (sheet metal, gravel, stone, bricks, metal, etc.). He plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to finish his home and provide a more comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house (sheet metal, gravel, stone, bricks, metal, etc.).

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with four children, two of whom are still attending school while the other two have completed high school. His wife is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Peter has operated a goat meat selling business for the past five years; he sells his livestock at the marketplace and his clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of rising prices of livestock in the market. He aspires to expand his business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase more goats and also some cattle for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it lends loans with low interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase more goats and also some cattle for resale.

loans.name: Jairo Roman

texts.es: Jairo Román tiene a cargo un hijo de 7 años, tiene su pulpería trabaja de lunes a viernes de 7 de la mañana hasta las  9 de la noche, desde hace 3 años. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos, jugos, huevos, fideos, leche y pan. Esta inversión ayudara tanto a su familia como a Jairo, porque estará mejorando el inventario de su negocio ofreciéndoles ganancias. El propósito de él es terminar con ciertos detalles de su vivienda, cuidar de su actividad para poder ayudar a su familia y ser responsable con el préstamo.
texts.en: Jairo Román is responsible for a 7 year old child. He has had a grocery store for the last 3 years which he opens Mondays to Fridays from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. He is currently asking for a loan to buy dry grains, soft drinks, juices, eggs, noodles, milk and bread. This investment will be of as much help to Jairo as to his family, as it will improve his business inventory and increase profits. His purpose is to complete certain bits and pieces in his house, take care of his business so as to be able to help his family and be responsible for his loan.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, soft drinks, juices, eggs, nodles, milk and bread.

loans.name: Kidodo

texts.en:
Kidodo is a married woman with five children. Three of them attend school while two have completed school. Her husband, Guni, is a farmer who contributes to the family income. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Kidodo has operated a retail shop for the past three years. She also runs a motorbike transportation business and a charcoal-selling business. Her clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her shop into a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase more corn flour, wheat flour, sugar and soap for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more corn flour, wheat flour, sugar and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Tsolak

texts.en: Tsolak is from the village of Kamo in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is married with two sons (seventeen and nineteen years old).  Tsolak has a high school education and has been farming for the past ten years.  He considers himself a sociable person and dreams of renovating the family home.  As his financial means are insufficient, he has turned to microfinance to fund his business.  He is looking for a loan to purchase animal feed.  He expects this investment to increase the family income and allow him to save some money.  This is his first microfinance loan and he is pleased with the services.  He enjoys being a self-employed entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
59-year-old Imelda, a mother of three operates her retail shop in Mpigi. She has been in business for the last 30 years.

It’s been her sense of diligence and determination that have laid the firm foundation for her business. She has not let complacency become a part of her trivial round as she believes working hard every day is the key to more success. The unintended consequences of complacency are what she wants to steer clear of. Though she has achieved much, resting on her laurels is something she is not inclined to.

At her shop, she sells a variety of general merchandise, to wit, curry powder, soft drinks, maize flour, sugar, mineral water, blue soap, etc. Prior to this enterprise, she was involved in farming.

Imelda intends to use her loan to purchase more retail goods such as maize flour, salt, beans, rice, curry powder, soft drinks, etc to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods such as maize flour, salt, beans, rice, curry powder, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité MUJERES TRABAJADORAS, está constituido por  19 señoras quienes se encuentran luchando dia a dia por llevar a sus hogares el pan de cada dia. Todas son mujeres jefas de familia, muy sacrificadas y luchadoras.
Tal así el caso de la sra. Deolinda, quien está casada y se dedica a la venta y compra de fideos, leche, bebidas, ropas, artículos de bijouterie; una vez adquirido estas mercaderías lo vuelve a vender. Y con los venta adquirida puede mantener a su familia y mantener un negocio bastante exitoso en su barrio. Unos de los tantos sueños de la sra. Deolinda es poder contar con una despensa y convertirse en una microempresaria más exitosa de lo que ya ha podido convertirse en este corto tiempo que se unió a la fundación.
Ella es una señora muy emprendedora ya que se dedica a variadas cosas, en lo cual le va muy bien, es por ello que solicita el crédito para poder abastecerse con fideos, leche, bebidas y demás artículos de primera necesidad, lo cual le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) committee has 19 members who struggle daily to provide daily bread for their homes.  All of the women are heads of household who are very self-sacrificing and tenacious.

Such is the case of Deolinda who is married and buys and sells noodles, milk, beverages, clothes, costume jewelry.  Once she acquires these goods she resells them.  With profits she’s able to support her family and maintain quite a profitable business in her neighborhood.  One of Deolinda’s many dreams is to have a store and to become a more successful micro businesswoman than what she’s managed to become in the short time since she joined the Fundación.

She is a very enterprising woman who does a variety of things and does well in them.  Because of this, she’s asking for a loan to buy noodles, milk, beverages and other basic staple items that will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk, beverages and other items to resell.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan (in the photo), aged 36, and her husband, Hai, aged 42, live in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1994 and have one son and two daughters: two attend school and the third is still too young.  

Sophan and her husband are farmers. They grow longans (a tropical fruit) and flowers. They also buy some flowers under contract from their fellow villagers and sell them to a middleman who comes to buy them at their home.  

Sophan is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional flowers for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional flowers for resale.

loans.name: Muthaisu

texts.en: Muthaisu is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2  to 11 years. She describes herself as quiet and likes sharing ideas. She operates a grocery store where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, mangoes and kales. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located along a busy road. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more potatoes and cabbages. Her business goal is to run many more green grocery stores within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now.

Argie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Argie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a potatoes growing business.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam M. is a single mother of two young girls. Like many young women in Kenya and in Africa at large, she is a primary school dropout due to lack of money to pay for her fees. She started her business in the year 2001 with initial capital of four dollars from her husband. They have since divorced.

With the requested loan of $300, she plans to increase her stock of assorted household items. Mirriam's business even takes her to the neighbouring country of Uganda. She sells household goods such as blankets, cooking pans, detergents, etc. at reasonable prices from Kenya.

Miriam depends on her business for her livelihood and to educate her daughters and pay for their general living expenses. She is an optimist and believes in what she is doing. She looks forward to opening a shop in Mbale, Uganda one day.

Mirriam's hard work is an inspiration for others in her community. It's amazing the amount of goods she and other vendors are able to carry and the long distances they travel. One can only admire their determination to fight on and overcome poverty. One can only be humbled by their sheer determination. Truly worth support by Kiva Partners.

loans.use: Buy stock for household items business

loans.name: Maria Floriberta

texts.en:
Maria Floriberta is 24 years old and has three children. Her husband works as a driver of local transport between her village to the closest city. She works buying and raising pigs, chickens, and turkeys which she later sells in the city market or to local customers who buy from her home. With this loan she plans to purchase feed and vaccines to prevent diseases that affect her livestock. She belongs to Grupo Palmas 1.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

MARIA FLORIBERTA TIENE 24 AÑOS TRES HIJOS SU ESPOSO SE DESEMPEÑA COMO CHOFER EN EL TRANSPORTE COLECTIVO DE SU LOCALIDAD A LA CIUDAD MAS CERCANA .ELLA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y CRIANZA DE PUERCOS , GALLINAS Y PAVOS Y LOS SALE A VENDER EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD O A CLIENTES QUE LLEGAN A SU CASA.CON EL PRESTAMO DESEA COMPRAR ALIMENTOS Y VACUNAS PARA PREVENIR LAS PLAGAS QUE AFECTAN A SUS ANIMALES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO PALMAS 1.

loans.use: CRIANZA DE ANIMALES

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz N. owns and operates a clothing stand in Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Ramiz has already successfully repaid one loan with Norwegian Microcredit showing that he is a trustworthy customer. Ramiz would like to obtain funding once again so that he can increase the quantity and quality of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and quality of his inventory

loans.name: I Wayan Sutarma

texts.id:
I Nyoman Sutarma owns a welding shop with one contract employee. Sutarma serves each customer who comes around, and services their equipment, and on top of that Sutarma himself also immediately begins work on each order. This business was pioneered four years ago with Rp. 1,700,000, which went towards used carbide welding equipment. Now it has grown into a busy shop with many orders. Moreover, now it has been completed with an electric welding machine which was purchased with money made possible through a loan of Rp. 2,000,000. With the business Sutarma now runs he can take in Rp. 400,000 a day with a profit of Rp. 150,000 a day. Sutarma uses this income to fund his kids who are still in primary school. Sutarma feels proud to own this business because in addition to earning a living, the man from Nengah Purwani can also contribute to the economy for the people in the area.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

I Nyoman Sutarma memiliki usaha yaitu bengkel las dengan satu (1) orang tenaga kerja yang digaji dengan sistem kontrak / prosentase. Sutarma bisa melayani setiap pelanggan yang datang memesan ataupun menservice barangnya. bahkan Sutarma sendiri juga ikut terjun langsung mengerjakan setiap pesanan yang ada. Usaha ini dirintisnya sejak 4 tahun yang lalu dengan modal Rp. 1.700.000.- yang berupa alat las karbit bekas (second). Kini sudah berkembang menjadi bengkel yang ramai dan banyak pesanan . Apalagi sekarang sudah dilengkapi dengan mesin las listrik yang di belinya dengan menggunakan uang pinjaman dari Dinari Rp 2.000.000 . Dengan usaha yang dimiliki sekarang Sutarma bisa berproduksi Rp 400.000/hari dan keuntungan bersih yang di dapat Rp 150.000/hari . Hasil inilah yang Sutarma pergunakan untuk membiayai seorang anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah menengah pertama ( SMP ). Sutarma merasa bangga memiliki usaha ini karena selain mendapatkan hasil tambahan , suami dari Nengah Purwani ini juga bisa menciptakan lapangan kerja bagi masyarakat sekitarnya .

loans.use: Purchase a dynamo to increase repair capacity and complete orders in a more timely fashion - Membeli sebuah mesin dinamo untuk meningkatkan kinerja bengkelnya, sehingga pesanan dapat diselesaikan tepat waktu

loans.name: Sakinakhanim

texts.en: Sakinakhanim (her husband is pictured) is the mother of three children. One year ago her family started this business. Sakinakhanim is 53 years old and she lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Garagurtlu. Now they need a loan of $825 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve their orchard and then they will be able to meet all demands of their family.

loans.use: Sakinakhanim would like to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her orchard.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa is 41 years old, and she has only a fourth grade education because her father thought it sufficient that she know how to write her name since it was most important that she work in the field. She has four children who depend upon her. Carmen was born in San Ignacio, in the province of Cajamarca, and she lived with only her father and brothers because her mother abandoned the family when Carmen was a child. (It is only within the past five years that she has met her mother).

At the age of 14 Carmen fled from her house with some friends because her father was abusing her. She came to Trujillo to work as a maid, and at 16 became pregnant and had to leave her job (she has since married the child’s father). She then dedicated herself to washing clothes and later her sister-in-law gave her the idea of selling candy, and that’s how she started in this activity.

Currently she lives in the settlement “Ramón Castilla” of the district Huanchaco in Trujillo and she works selling candy during the school year at the entrance to a school located in the center of the city of Trujillo. During vacations and on the weekends she sells candy in the Plaza de Armas and also at the hotsprings of Huanchaco.

She obtained her first loan of S/300 (approximately $100) as part of the group Mientras Tanto “Sol Radiante” with which she purchased candy in order to stock her cart. Recently she has requested a loan from Manuela Ramos for S/700.00 (approximately $234) to be paid back in four months, with which she will buy some soft drinks and toys which she plans to sell during Christmas Vacation. Carmen Rosa dreams of having a stable business in a mall or market in order to not have to walk around selling her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, estudió solo hasta cuarto grado de primaria porque su padre consideró que era suficiente con que sepa escribir su nombre y que era más importante el trabajo en la chacra; tiene 4 hijos y todos dependen de ella. La señora Carmen Rosa es natural de San Ignacio, provincia del Departamento de Cajamarca, vivió solo con su padre y sus hermanos porque su madre los abandonó cuando era pequeña, dice haberla conocido recién hace cinco años. A la edad de 14 años huyó de su casa con unas amigas porque su padre la maltrataba y se vino a Trujillo a trabajar como empleada del hogar, a los 16 se embarazó del que es su esposo actualmente y tuvo que dejar el trabajo. Se dedicó entonces a lavar ropa ajena y posteriormente su cuñada le dio la idea de vender golosinas, es así como se inició en esta actividad. Actualmente vive en el Asentamiento Humano “Ramón Castilla” del Distrito de Huanchaco en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad y se dedica a vender golosinas en la puerta de un colegio ubicado en el centro de Trujillo, esto durante la época escolar, en la época de vacaciones y los fines de semana vende en la Plaza de Armas y también en el balneario de Huanchaco Obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) en el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Sol Radiante” con el que compró golosinas para surtir su carrito. Recientemente ha obtenido un préstamo de Manuela Ramos S/.700.00 (aproximadamente $234) para cancelarlo en 4 meses, con los que compró algo de bebidas gaseosas y también juguetes, los que piensa vender durante las Fiestas Navideñas. La señora Carmen Rosa sueña con tener un negocio estable en algún centro comercial o mercado para dejar de ser ambulante.

loans.use: To purchase softdrinks and toys

loans.name: Pheab

texts.en:
Mr. C. Pheab and his wife have five children, one son and four daughters. One of their daughters is married and living with them. The other four children are studying at a local school. Pheab and his family live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Bassac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. He sells and delivers meatballs and other food with his motorbike around the village, which he has done since 2005. His wife buys flowers from local farmers for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. 

He is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA for the amount of $1000. He will use this money to buy a motorbike for his son in-law to travel to work and to help his wife expand her flower business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and buy flowers for reselling

loans.name: Sayaad Haider

texts.en: Sayaad Haider lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has just graduated from school. During the school time, he was worked in a tailor shop. Now he has opened a tailor shop for himself. He wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to buy new sewing machines and make his shop bigger to attract more clients and make a good monthly income to help his family. He is happy with all members of his family.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Olga Carmen

texts.es:
For the past year Olga has been a part of “Banco Comunal “Rikchariy”” which means “Wake Up” en Quechua. She lives with her partner, is 40 years old and has 3 children, she sells potato and cereal in the Ayacuchana jungle and she also takes her products to the city of Lima and they are sold at the wholesale food market in the town of Ayuchucho and at the farms. From the Ayacuchana jungle she brings fruits and coke which are sold at the Nery García market.

Olga requests a loan of 2000 soles ($700) to invest in buying potato. Her savings will be used to increase the business capital and for the education of her children. It is Olga’s dream that her children will become professionals and her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rikchariy” que significa “Despiértate” en Quechua, hace 1 año. Olga es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Olga vende papa y cereales en la selva ayacuchana y también lleva a la ciudad de Lima, sus productos los compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en las chacras. Además Olga trae de la selva Ayacuchana frutas, coca, productos que vende en el mercado Nery Garcia.

Olga necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa. Sus ahorros son para incrementar el capital de su negocio y la educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Olga son que sus hijos sean profesionales y su negocio más grande.

loans.use: Purchase potato to increase sales and make business grow.

loans.name: Asha's Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
Asha is 22 years old and is a single woman. Asha owns a small tailoring shop, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have small businesses.The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
Silvestre started a his career with a natural-water retail business. Later, he began selling electronic equipment but, when he realized that the income generated was small and fell short of covering family's expenses, and with his brother's assistance, he started a business of forged-metal doors. They have built a clientele that have pushed profits upwards. Nowadays, they own a blacksmith shop that has been doing well, although he still sells water on the weekends.

He is requesting a credit line in the amount of $575.00, to be repaid within six months, to purchase more material for the shop and the season's fruits. He is hopeful that with Kiva's help he will be able to achieve this. p> Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Silvestre inicio el negocio en la venta de aguas naturales en un tianguis, después empezó vendiendo aparatos electrónicos, al ver que los ingresos eran pocos, y no le alcanzaba para los gastos económicos de la familia, entonces con la ayuda de su hermano iniciaron la elaboración de puertas de forja y empezaron hacerse de clientes, incrementando sus ganancias, hasta la actualidad que ya tienen una herrería, y les ha ido muy bien, pero también sigue con la venta de aguas naturales aunque solo los fines de semana, por que entre semana se dedica a la herrería.

Ahora esta solicitando de un crédito de US $575 que pagara a 6 meses, para comprar la material para herrería y fruta de temporada, tiene la esperanza que con el apoyo de Kiva, podrá lograrlo.

loans.use: Purchase more material.

loans.name: Sodon

texts.en: Mr. Sodon S. lives in Choeung Snar Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a widower with two children, both of whom are enrolling in school. Mr. Sodon S. is a farmer who raises poultry. His business now faces a small problem because Mr. Sodon S. does not have enough money for duck food; therefore, he needed to request a loan to buy more duck food to feed them.

loans.use: To buy more duck food.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Coumba used her first loan of 250,000 CFA francs to set up an area in her house to make fruit and vegetable products. In this area, she makes fruit drinks and jam which she sells in her neighborhood. Her products are used during family ceremonies instead of artificial drinks.
 Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Coumba a installé une petite unité de transformation de fruits et légumes dans la maison familliale.Avec  son unité elle transforme les fruits en boisson ,en  confiture qu'elle vend au niveau du quartier.Ses produits sont utilisés lors des céréménies familliales à la place des boissons chimiques.

Avec ce nouveau credit, elle compte renforcer ses stocks de matieres premieres. Ce pret sera d'un grand apport dans l'amélioration de la  rentabilité de son activité.

Cette mere de famille tres dynamique compte beaucoup sur les financement de Kiva pour développer son activité

loans.use: capital

loans.name: Kodzovi Mawuena

texts.fr: Kodzovi Mawuena A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants.  Il habite et travaille dans son propre atelier de soudure à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise.  Avec ce crédit, il souhaite aménéger son atelier et acquérir des outils de travail. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de la vie.  Monsieur Mawuena est un bon client puisqu’il a déjà bénéficié de plus de trois crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers.

loans.use: Aménager son atelier et acheter des outils de travail

loans.name: Adiza

texts.fr:
Madame D. Adiza est née le 27 août 1973 à Sotouboua dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 1996, elle vend des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé. Son lieu d’approvisionnement est le grand marché de Lomé, marché dans lequel elle achète à un prix moindre. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 5 sacs de riz, 24 cartons de savons et 10 cartons de tomate.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiza D. was born on August 27, 1973 in Sotouboua in the central region of Togo. She is married and the mother of two children. Since 1996, she has been selling staple items in the district of Agoè in the north of the city of Lomé. She buys her merchandise in the big open-air market of Lomé, since it is there that she can buy at the lowest price.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to complete her stock with the purchase of 5 sacks of rice, 24 cases of soap, and 10 cases of tomatoes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staple items for re-sale

loans.name: Laura Zefanias

texts.pt:
Laura Zefanias M. nasceu na província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 48 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos, sendo a primeira com 25 anos de idade e ultima com 11 anos de idade. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Laura não teve a oportunidade de ir a escola devido a guerra de libertação colonial e a sua família não tinha condições para pagar o internamento noutras zonas. Passou a sua juventude ate ao casamento, e pois esta foi a cidade de Maputo na companhia do seu marido em 1988 no bairro do Aeroporto B. Local onde mora até hoje e por ai o marido abandonou-a. Assim viu se obrigada a procurar alternativas para sustentar os seus filhos onde optou pelo negocio de venda de produtos da primeira necessidade.

Laura vive basicamente de negocio onde trabalha todos os dias das 6 as 18horas, destaca nos seus produtos o sal e repolho, onde o sal adquira por 140,00mt o saco de 50kg e vende por 250,00mt. Tem um rendimento diária de 400,00mt e poupa mensalmente 3000,00mt.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva nunca solicitou noutras instituições, e conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que já eram clientes. Constitui grande sonho para Laura ter mais uma banca para aumentar os seus rendimentos.
texts.en:
Laura Zefanias M. was born in the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. She is 48 years old, divorced, and the mother of 5 children. The oldest is 25 years old, and the youngest is 11 years old. She only supports her family. Laura did not have the oppurtunity to go to school due to the war of colonial liberation, and her family did not have the conditions to pay for enrollment in other zones. She passed her youth until her marriage when she moved to the city of Maputo with her husbands' company in 1988 to the Airport District B where she lives today, and from there her husband abandoned her. As such she found herself obliged to search out alternatives to support her children and she decided to sell products of primary necessity. Laura lives basically through the business where she works every day from 6:00am to 6:00pm. Her stand out products are salt and cabbage. She acquires the salt for 140MT per 50kg sack, and she sells it for 250MT. She has a daily income of 400MT and saves 3,000MT monthly. This is her first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva, and she never solicited other institutions. She came to know Hluvuku through some friends who were already clients. Her big dream is to have one more stand to increase her profits.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products for resale

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Juana tiene 47 años de edad, habita en el barrio San Antonio Sur del municipio de Ticuantepe, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 16 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como albañil y junto a Doña Juana se encargan del cuido y manuetnción de su familia. La Sra. Juana trabaja en una casa particular como empleada doméstica, tiene seis años de dedicarse a este oficio, el cual inició en vista de las necesidades económicas de su familia, ya que su esposo obtenía pocos ingresos. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para mejoras de vivienda en la reparación del techo ya que lo tiene en mal estado, y las lluvias le están afectando las pertenecias de su vivienda. Espera poder contar siempre con un trabajo, ya que su sueño es poder convertir a sus hijos en profesionales
texts.en:
Juana, 47, lives in the San Antonio Sur neighborhood in Ticuantepe. She is married and has two children, ages 10 and 16. Her husband is a construction worker, and both provide for their family's needs. Juana has worked as a house maid for the last six years. She started working in this job to help her husband increase the household income. The loan Juana is requesting will be used to fix the roof, which is in bad shape. With the rain season looming ahead, Juana is concerned that her belongings will be damaged. Her hope is to always have a job, and her dream is to give her children a college education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing the roof in her home.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever  es un joven de 22 años, vive con su joven pareja y su  pequeño hijo. Se dedica a cultivar  cítricos, dentro de ellos lo que más cultiva es naranja, actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace 5 años.  Ser agricultor  es lo que más le agrada, sobre todo la cosecha, ya que  es lo más gratificante de todo el trabajo que realiza, además las naranjas son las frutas más demandas en la zona, debido a su  reconocido valor de venta que tienen. Sin embargo, lo que es más tedioso dentro de esta actividad es poder  limpiar los terrenos y cuidarlos de los insectos  que malogran los frutos. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insecticidas y abonos para sus hectáreas de  cultivo de cítricos.
texts.en:
Ever is 22 years old and lives with his partner and their little boy. He has dedicated himself to farming citrus, mostly oranges, for 5 years now. He enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is the preparation of plots for planting and protecting the oranges from insects that spoil the fruit. Fortunately for Ever, oranges are in high demand in his area and fetch high prices at the market. This is his first loan from MFP. He will use the money to buy insecticide and fertilizer for his plots.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of insecticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Krishna Kumari M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur District, Nepal, with her husband, Mr. Jayu M., and their two daughters, who are studying in secondary school. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work. However, Mrs. M. and her husband make traditional brass religious statues.

The religious statues of Nepal are very famous and the demand for them is increasing around the world. Therefore, Mrs. M. is asking for a loan of NPR15000.00 (US $200) to buy raw materials including wax, silver, etc. for their business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Sardaran Ghulam Safdar Group

texts.en:
Sardaran baji is a 58 year old married woman that has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is G. S. and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. Sardaran baji and her husband have no children. For the past 15 years, Sardaran baji has been helping her husband with his scrap business. She is applying for a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles and waste papers) to expand her scrap business.

Sardaran baji is a group leader of some more women in her locality. Khursheed baji is requesting a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Rubina shaheen baji is requesting a loan to buy biscuits and chips at wholesale in order to sell to shops. Zubaida baji is requesting a loan to buy scissors and razors for her barbershop. Zareena baji is requesting a loan to buy milk for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for a scrap business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Pictured here is 27 year-old Veronica M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children who are between the ages of one and four. Additionally, she is is mother to one orphan.

Veronica has been running a tailoring business since 2006. She sells clothes mainly for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, five days per week and is assisted by her husband. Veronica currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print) and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides). She plans to use these materials to design clothing mainly for women. In the future, she plans to increase her stocks. Veronica thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) to make them into women's clothing

loans.name: Marbell Petrona

texts.es: La joven Marbel tiene 24 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, tiene una niña de 2 años y su esposo  trabaja en un restaurante en servicios de vigilancia. El negocio es la venta de ropa, y productos de cosmético que vende al contado y al crédito que inicio desde hace  cuatro años con fondos propios,  con la iniciativa de prosperar para su desarrollo personal. Con esta solicitud de crédito  es la segunda en la que va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y tener mas espacio. Sus planes es poder aumentar el volumen de venta y obtener mejores ingresos que gracias a Afodenic se están haciendo realidad.
texts.en:
This young woman is Marbell. She is 24 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighbourhood of Managua. She has a two-year-old daughter and her husband works for a restaurant providing security. She sells clothing and cosmetics both on account and for cash. She started her business four years ago with her own money, wanting to improve her situation and for her personal development. She is asking for this, her second loan, to buy construction materials to build a room and have more space. Her goal is to increase her sales volume and make more money, a goal which thanks to Afodenic is becoming reality.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Madame K. abla est mariée à un monsieur qui est soudeur, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’avédji, elle à 6 enfants,  elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de denrées alimentaires, c’est cette activité qui lui permet d’aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.  Le crédit qu’elle demande à WAGES va lui permettre d’agrandir son stock avec 4paniers de tomates, 4 paniers de poissons, 10 bidons d’huile de palme, 6 paniers de Gombo.
texts.en:
Ms. K. Abla is married to a gentleman who is a welder. She lives with her family in the Avédji district and has six children. Her income-generating work involves selling foodstuff. It’s a business that enables her to assist her husband with household expenses. The loan from WAGES that she’s asking for will allow her to increase her inventory of goods with: four baskets of tomatoes, four baskets of fish, ten drums of palm oil, and six baskets of okra.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Loluama

texts.en: Loluama L., 55, is married with six children. She has three years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the villagers seven days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~62 USD). SPBD loans are Loluama’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy raw materials needed to upgrade her business.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, yeast, oil, kerosene cooker and frying pan

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen L. has a small piggery. She is 41 years old, married and has three children. She dreams of having a store someday. For now, she is happy to have all her pigs for her business. Her husband, Welfredo L., is a farmer. Her husband manages their small rice field to supplement their income. 

As a mother, Helen wants to help especially in the family finances. She wants to avail loans from CEVI to support her pig business. The purpose of her loan is to buy feed and piglets. The loan will truly help her increase the size of her business.

Helen L. has been a CEVI client for a long time already. She enjoys having easy access to CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth lucha sola por el bienestar de sus tres hijos, quienes son su mayor orgullo, pues son muy responsables y dedicados en sus estudios; por ello, trata de darles las comodidades posibles para que sigan desarrollándose como hombres de éxito. Desde que se separó de su pareja fue asumiendo nuevos retos como madre y como comerciante, pues se esfuerza por el crecimiento de su negocio, el cual inició hace 8 años junto a su pareja, pero hoy trata de atender a sus clientes con la ayuda de sus hijos. Elizabeth vende cerveza para diversos eventos sociales, grandes y pequeños. Pero más adelante, desea abrir una tienda de bebidas en su casa para dejar de trasladarse de un lugar a otro y dejar de pagar los altos costo de alquiler del local donde almacena su producto, pero mientras junta el capital necesario seguirá trabajando igual, hasta que sus hijos cumplan sus metas como estudiantes y puedan ser un apoyo para ella dentro de su hogar. Desde hace 5 años pertenece a su banco comunal, este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, lo que le gusta de su grupo es la interrelación personal que hay entre sus compañeras, además del trabajo que realizan con el fin de tener mayores ingresos y progresar. Los 3500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de más cerveza para cubrir sus pedidos este mes, pues hay muchos eventos festivos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth struggles alone for the well being of her three children, who are her greatest pride since they are very responsible and dedicated to their studies; therefore, she tries to give them all the comforts possible so that they continue to develop into successful men. Since she separated from her spouse she has been assuming new responsibilities as a mother and a business woman, as she tries to grow her business that she started 8 years ago with her husband, and now is is trying to service her customers with the help of her sons Elizabeth sells beer at various social events, large and small. In the future she plans to open a beverage store in her home so that she can stop having to move from one place to another and stop paying the high rent for the storage of her products. In the meantime, until she has the finances necessary, she will continue as she is doing now until her sons reach their educational goals and can be of support for her in her home. She has belonged to her community bank for the last 5 years, this is her thirteenth loan with MFP. She likes the personal interaction with her partners in the group, in addition to the work they accomplish toward the goals of improving their incomes and getting ahead. The 3500 soles that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of beer to cover her orders for the month, there are a lot of festive events in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren D. lives with his wife and two teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two sons are high school students.

Davaasuren has a small carpentry business. He makes furniture and other wooden household items. He started his business in 2006 with 50,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,450 MNT). From the beginning, his business has done quite well and his capital has increased to 2,000,000 MNT. He mostly sells his handmade furniture to herder families in the countryside. Sometimes he barters his furniture in exchange for sheep and goats. He usually obtains requests for new furniture from families in the town because of the high quality and design of his products.

In the future, he would like to focus on the quality of his products, which Davaasuren values very much. He requests a loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: Purchase woods to build furniture.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Diouldé, 22 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt pour louer une boutique et l’approvisionner en marchandise. L’activité est menée avec l’appui de son mari. Elle veut contribuer à l’entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Diouldé, age 22, is married and has three children in her care. She is requesting a loan to lease a shop and to supply it with merchandise. This business is managed with her husband’s support. She wants to help with maintaining her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease and to supply a shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: Seventeen people living in Khsom village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chantha P. is the 34-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy rice seed. She plans to use the rest of money to purchase fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Prach Sarith, is a construction worker. This couple has three children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
31-year-old Tabu is a member of the Maendeleo borrowing group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a single mother of 2 children, aged 10 and 14 years. She also cares for 2 other dependents. Tabu started her own salon 1 year ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian Shillings.

This is Tabu’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more equipment for her salon. With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Tabu hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her salon

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie N. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 38 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie sells seafood like fish and shrimp in the local community. Margie has been in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Margie joined PMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase more seafood, and she is now requesting her 5th PMPC loan of 11,000 PHP.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase seafood for her market stall.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
EL Sr. Julio tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado hace varios años con la Sra. Eustaquia de profesión masajista, tienen 3 hijos, todos mayores y independientes.
El Sr. Julio es propietario de un taller de costura hace más de 6 años, tiene 4 empleados a su cargo y realiza trabajos de cortinados, tapicería y todo articulo de ropería para empresas en forma tercerizada y también a clientes exclusivos.
Se inicio con una pequeña maquina de coser junto con una ex compañera de trabajo iniciaron una pequeña sociedad. Actualmente cuenta con 7 máquinas industriales para confección de todo tipo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas de temporada.
texts.en:
Julio is 58 years old and married for various years to Eustaquia who is a professional masseuse. They have 3 children, all adults living independently.

For 6 years, Julio has been the proprietor of a sewing shop. He has 4 employees under his charge making curtains, tapestry, and all articles of clothing for enterprises that outsource the work, as well as for exclusive clients.

He began with a small sewing machine. Then, he and a former work companion formed a small partnership. Presently, they have 7 industrial machines that can be used in manufacturing of all types. Julio is asking for a loan to buy cloth that is in season.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTH FOR FALL AND WINTER

loans.name: Lovina

texts.en:
Lovina is 35 years old and married with seven children. She sells drinks and cooked food. She is from Okada in Edo State.

Lovina is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar M. G. quiere darle a su esposa una mayor comodidad al momento de cocinar por que donde viven es una casa de interés social y son muy pequeñas por lo que la cocina esta muy estrecha solo es un pasillo pequeño donde la señora apenas cabe. El señor viendo la necesidad y darle gusto a su esposa recurre a nosotros; para que lo apoyemos en su proyecto. Para ampliar su cocina el necesita comprar material para construcción y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Omar M. G. wants to give his wife greater convenience when cooking because they live in public housing and their home is very small. The kitchen is very narrow; it is only a small hallway where his wife can barely fit. Omar, seeing the need and wanting to please his wife, has turned to "Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP)" (Foundation for Progressive Housing) for support in this project. To expand his kitchen, Omar needs to buy construction materials and to pay for manual labor.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand kitchen

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou est une femme de 58 ans, elle est veuve et a 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2 depuis 3 ans et tous les prêts qu'elle a reçu ont été toujours remboursés sans problème. Avec son crédit elle commercialise du tissu et de l'encens. Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle assure la nourriture de ses 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou is a 58-year-old woman and a widow with four children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years. All the loans she received were always repaid without a problem. With her current, loan she is marketing fabrics and incense. With the profits she makes, she ensures that her four children are fed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her micro-enterprise

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza-21 Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Nueva Esperanza 21” esta representada por la señora Rosa Victoria y conformado por trece miembros que en su mayoría radican en la zona 21 D. diciembre  las socias son dedicadas a la comercialización  y venta D. diferentes productos como venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrios, a la elaboración y comercialización D. muebles D. madera en talleres D. carpintería, venta D. coca, venta D. comida, carne D. cerdo,  cosméticos, tiendas D. barrio y  taller D. mecánica.                                                                                                                 Los socios están en un mercado altamente competitivo ellas tienen sus estrategias D. como asegurar la venta D. sus producto además ya son conocidas en el mercado local y pretenden llegar a mercados internacionales mejorando la calidad D. sus productos.                                                                                                            El destino del crédito es para realizar compras D. insumos para sus tiendas y algunos para la compra D. equipos y herramientas para sus talleres otras D. las socias requieren del capital para la adquisición D. mercadería para agrandar mas sus tiendas.
Este grupo esta emprendiendo su sexto ciclo, la mayoría D. ellos ya se conocen entre si y cuentan con experiencia puesto que participaron durante cinco ciclos, es un grupo D. personas responsables, unidas y sobre todo con muchas granas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa Victoria represents the Nueva Esperanza 21 group. It is comprised of 13 members; most of them are from the 21 D. Diciembre region. The members sell different products. Some have neighborhood grocery stores. Some make and sell wood furniture in carpentry shops. Some sell coca, food, pork, and cosmetics. Some have neighborhood stores, and some have mechanic shops. The members are in a market that is highly competitive. They have their strategies for assuring the sale of their products. Also, they are well known in the local market, and they intend to arrive on the international market by improving the quality of their products. The loan is to buy supplies for their stores. Some will use it to buy equipment and tools for their shops. Others need the loan to buy merchandise to expand their stores. This group is undertaking their sixth cycle. Most of them know each other already and have experience, given that they have participated in five cycles. It is a group of united and responsible people. Above all, they have a great desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has four children, between the ages of 10 and 22. He sells clothes and shoes in Gikomba Market and has one employee. He has been in business for fifteen years and has successfully completed two previous loans with Faulu. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more inventory. 

In the future, John would like to expand his business and become a more prominent businessman. He describes himself as hardworking and says that he has learned how to keep records and provide customer care in Faulu, where he is his group's treasurer.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying jewelry for resale

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es: Sonia Maribel S. V. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 16 y 12 años de edad, del los cuales el mayor trabaja y estudia, mientras que los menores estudian y le ayudan a su madre a atender el negocio. Sonia posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, los cuales los comercializa desde hace 9 años. Sonia es una mujer la cual se esfuerza mucho por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijo, no solo en lo económico sino también se ha encargado de concientizar a sus hijos y guiarlos por el buen camino. Sonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Maribel S. V. lives in the department of Ahuachapán, she lives with her three children of 17, 16 and 12 years of age. Of the three children, the oldest works and goes to school and the younger two go to school and help their mom with the business. Sonia has a store of perishable and daily use items, she has had this market for nine years. Sonia is a strong woman who does her best to support her children, not only economically but also she advises her children and guides them along a good road. Sonia is seeking a loan so that she can resupply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishible items

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah C. M., 38, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Luis M. and they are blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been making slippers and bags and selling them to her customers for three years.

Jonah has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow three times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used almost all the money she borrowed to buy raw materials for her sandals and slipper making.  Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 7,000 per month.

Now with your help, Jonah would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying leather, sewing materials and other fabrics for her footwear business.

Jonah dreams that her products will become well-known someday and prays that they will have enough money so that they can help those who are in need.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy materials for her footwear and bag-making business

loans.name: Juana Epifanía

texts.es: La señora Juana tiene venta de comida las cuales realiza los fines de semana el crédito lo utilizara para invertirlo en el mismo y así poder darle una mejor atención a sus clientes, estos créditos con CEPRODEL del cual ha trabajado un año le han beneficiado a mejorar su calidad de vida y los ingresos para su familia, el negocio lo tiene desde hace mas de diez años y empezó con ahorros propios, ella vive con su esposo donde los dos trabajan hombro a hombro.
texts.en:
Señora Juana sells food on the weekends. She will use this loan to invest in this business so she can give her customers better service. She has worked with Ceprodel for one year, and these loans have benefited her and have let her improve her quality of life as well as her family's income. She has had this business for more than 10 years. She started it with her own savings. She lives with her husband, and they both work side by side.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, juice, chicken, meat, ketchup, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is friendly and a hard-working woman. She sells electrical materials to make a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells for long hours to make her business sustainable. She hopes to expand her business in the future by adding the sale of electronics. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 160,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She is 45 years old and married with 5 children. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purcchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Thom

texts.en: Thom T. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and is specialized in growing rice. She typically generates an income of $3 per day. She has always received help from her husband in planting crops. This couple has been married for years and has six children. They all are students and are also temporary laborers. After the rainy season for rice passed and the rice drying season arrived, Thom T. lacked some supplies to use in growing her crops. So, she has asked for a loan of $500 to be used to plow the farmland. She will then buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 27 year old married lady. She is a mother of one child who is in school.   Her husband works for a transport company.    She has been buying clothes and re-selling them to earn some profit for five years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya her business profits have increased.  She plans to expand her business to a wholesale in the future.  She has requested a loan of kes 90,000 to add stock of clothes. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Teotima

texts.en:
Teotima A. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Teotima is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Teotima owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Teotima has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.
